And if Satan cause thee to forget, then sit not, after recollection, with the unjust people. Footnote: And when <b>you see those who trifle with</b> Our Signs,
[6:70] And those who are righteous are not at all accountable for them, but <i>their duty is</i> to admonish them, that they may fear <i>God.</i>
[6:71] And let alone those who take their religion for a sport and a pastime, and whom worldly life has beguiled. And admonish <i>people</i> thereby lest a soul be consigned to perdition for what it has wrought. It shall have no helper nor intercessor beside Allah; and even if it offer every ransom, it shall not be accepted from it. These are they who have been delivered over to destruction for their own acts. They will have a drink of boiling water and a grievous punishment, because they disbelieved.
[6:72] Say: “Shall we call, beside Allah, upon that which can neither profit us nor harm us, and shall we be turned back on our heels after Allah has guided us, like one whom the evil ones entice away <i>leaving him</i> bewildered in the land, <i>and</i> who has companions who call him to guidance, <i>saying</i>, ‘Come to us?’ ” Say: “Surely, the guidance of Allah is the only guidance and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of all the worlds.
[6:73] “And <i>we have been given the command</i>: ‘Observe Prayer and fear Him;’ and He it is to Whom you shall be gathered.”
[6:74] And He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in accordance with the requirements of wisdom; and the day He says, ‘Be!’, it will be. His word is the truth, and His will be the kingdom on the day when the trumpet will be blown. <i>He is</i> the Knower of the unseen and the seen. And He is the Wise, the All-Aware. Footnote: And He it is Who created the heavens and the earth <b>the right way</b>; and the day <b>when He will</b> say, “‘Be!’ <b>And it is.</b>” (p) <b>Note:</b> See the explanation of <b></b> (Be! And it is) at page 59 under 3:48. (Publisher)
[6:75] And <i>remember the time</i> when Abraham said to his father, Azar: ‘Dost thou take idols for gods? Surely, I see thee and thy people in manifest error.’
[6:76] And thus did We show Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth <i>that he might be rightly guided</i> and that he might be of those who have certainty of faith.
[6:77] And when the night darkened upon him, he saw a star. He said: ‘This is my Lord!’ But when it set, he said: ‘I like not those that set.’
[6:78] And when he saw the moon rise with spreading light, he said: ‘This is my Lord.’ But when it set, he said, ‘If my Lord guide me not, I shall surely be of the people who go astray.’
[6:79] And when he saw the sun rise with spreading light, he said: ‘This is my Lord, this is the greatest.’ But when it set, he said, ‘O my people, surely I am clear of that which you associate <i>with God</i>.
[6:80] ‘I have turned my face toward Him Who created the heavens and the earth, being ever inclined <i>to God</i>, and I am not of those who associate gods <i>with God</i>.’
[6:81] And his people argued with him. He said: ‘Do you argue with me concerning Allah when He has guided me aright? And I fear not that which you associate with Him, unless my Lord will something. My Lord comprehends all things in His knowledge. Will you not then be admonished?
[6:82] ‘And why should I fear that which you associate <i>with God</i>, when you fear not to associate with Allah that for which He has sent down to you no authority?’ Which, then, of the two parties has greater right to security, if indeed you know?
[6:83] Those who believe and mix not up their belief with injustice — it is they who shall have peace, and who are rightly guided.
[6:84] And that is Our argument which We gave to Abraham against his people. We exalt in degrees of rank whomso We please. Thy Lord is indeed Wise, All-Knowing.
[6:85] And We gave him Isaac and Jacob; each did We guide aright, and Noah did We guide aright aforetime, and of his progeny, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward those who do good.
[6:86] And <i>We guided</i> Zachariah and John and Jesus and Elias; each <i>one of them</i> was of the virtuous.
[6:87] And <i>We also guided</i> Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot; and each one did We exalt above the people.
[6:88] And <i>We exalted</i> some of their fathers and their children and their brethren, and We chose them and We guided them in the straight path.
[6:89] That is the guidance of Allah. He guides thereby those of His servants whom He pleases. And if they had worshipped aught beside Him, surely all they did would have been of no avail to them.
[6:90] It is these to whom We gave the Book and dominion and prophethood. But if these <i>people</i> are ungrateful for them, <i>it matters not</i>, for We have now entrusted them to a people who are not ungrateful for them. Footnote: It is these to whom We gave the Book and <b>the faculty of judgement</b> and prophethood.
[6:91] These it is whom Allah guided aright, so follow thou their guidance. Say: ‘I ask not of you any reward for it. This is naught but an admonition for all mankind.’
[6:92] And they do not make a just estimate of Allah, when they say: ‘Allah has not revealed anything to any man.’ Say: ‘Who revealed the Book which Moses brought, a light and guidance for the people — though you treat it as scraps of paper which you show while you conceal much; and you have been taught that which neither you nor your fathers knew?’ — Say: ‘Allah’. Then leave them to amuse themselves with their <i>vain</i> discourse. Footnote: And they <b>failed to respect Allah as He should be respected when they said</b>: ‘Allah has not revealed anything to any man.’
[6:93] And this is a Book which We have revealed, full of blessings, to fulfil that which preceded it, and to enable thee to warn the Mother of towns and those around her. And those who believe in the Hereafter believe therein and they keep a watch over their Prayer.
[6:94] And who is more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah, or says, ‘It has been revealed to me,’ while nothing has been revealed to him; and who says, ‘I will send down the like of that which Allah has sent down?’ And if thou couldst only see, when the wrongdoers are in the agonies of death, and the angels stretch forth their hands, <i>saying</i>, ‘Yield up your souls. This day shall you be awarded the punishment of disgrace, because of that which you spoke against Allah falsely and <i>because</i> you turned away from His Signs with disdain.’
[6:95] And now you come to Us one by one even as We created you at first, and you have left behind you that which We bestowed upon you, and We see not with you your intercessors of whom you asserted that they were partners <i>with God</i> in your <i>affairs</i>. Now you have been cut off from one another and that which you presumed has failed you.
[6:96] Verily, it is Allah Who causes the grain and the date-stones to sprout. He brings forth the living from the dead, and <i>He</i> is the Bringer forth of the dead from the living. That is Allah; wherefore, then, are you turned back?
[6:97] He causes the break of day; and He made the night for rest and the sun and the moon for reckoning <i>time.</i> That is the decree of the Mighty, the Wise.
[6:98] And He it is Who has made the stars for you that you may follow the right direction with their help amid the deep darkness of the land and the sea. We have explained the Signs in detail for a people who possess knowledge.
[6:99] And He it is Who has produced you from a single person and there is <i>for you</i> a home and a lodging. We have explained the Signs in detail for a people who understand.
[6:100] And it is He Who sends down water from the cloud; and We bring forth therewith every kind of growth; then We bring forth with that green foliage wherefrom We produce clustered grain. And from the date-palm, out of its sheaths, <i>come forth</i> bunches hanging low. And <i>We produce therewith</i> gardens of grapes, and the olive and the pomegranate — similar and dissimilar. Look at the fruit thereof when it bears fruit, and the ripening thereof. Surely, in this are Signs for a people who believe.
[6:101] And they hold the Jinn to be partners with Allah, although He created them; and they falsely ascribe to Him sons and daughters without any knowledge. Holy is He and exalted <i>far</i> above what they attribute <i>to Him</i>!
[6:102] The Originator of the heavens and the earth! How can He have a son when He has no consort, and <i>when</i> He has created everything and has knowledge of all things?
[6:103] Such is Allah, your Lord. There is no God but He, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is Guardian over everything.
[6:104] Eyes cannot reach Him but He reaches the eyes. And He is the Incomprehensible, the All-Aware.
[6:105] Proofs have indeed come to you from your Lord; so whoever sees, it is for his own good; and whoever becomes blind, it is to his own harm. And I am not a guardian over you.
[6:106] And thus do We vary the Signs <i>that the truth may become established</i>, but <i>the result is</i> that they say, ‘Thou hast learnt <i>well</i>;’ and <i>We vary the Signs</i> that We may explain it to a people who have knowledge.
[6:107] Follow that which has been revealed to thee from thy Lord; there is no God but He; and turn aside from the idolaters.
[6:108] And if Allah had <i>enforced</i> His will, they would not have set up gods <i>with Him.</i> And We have not made thee a keeper over them nor art thou over them a guardian.
[6:109] And revile not those whom they call upon beside Allah, lest they, out of spite, revile Allah in <i>their</i> ignorance. Thus unto every people have We caused their doing <i>to seem</i> fair. Then unto their Lord is their return; and He will inform them of what they used to do.
[6:110] And they swear their strongest oaths by Allah that if there came to them a Sign, they would surely believe therein. Say, ‘Surely, Signs are with Allah. But what should make you understand that when the Signs come, they will not believe?’
[6:111] And We shall confound their hearts and their eyes, as they believed not therein at the first time, and We shall leave them in their transgression to wander in distraction. Footnote: And We shall <b>cause their hearts and faculties of sight to revert to the same state as when they initially rejected Our Signs,</b> and We shall leave them in their transgression to wander in distraction.
[6:112] And even if We send down unto them angels, and the dead speak to them, and We gather to them all things face to face, they would not believe, unless Allah <i>enforced</i> His will. But most of them behave ignorantly.
[6:113] And in like manner have We made for every Prophet an enemy, evil ones from among men and Jinn. They suggest one to another gilded speech in order to deceive — and if thy Lord had <i>enforced</i> His will, they would not have done it; so leave them alone with that which they fabricate — 
[6:114] And in order that the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter may incline thereto and that they may be pleased therewith and that they may <i>continue to</i> earn what they are earning.
[6:115] Shall I seek for judge other than Allah, when He it is Who has sent down to you the Book, clearly explained? And those to whom We gave the Book know that it has been sent down from thy Lord with truth; so be thou not of those who doubt.
[6:116] And the word of thy Lord has been fulfilled in truth and justice. None can change His words; and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
[6:117] And if thou obey the majority of those on earth, they will lead thee astray from Allah’s way. They follow nothing but <i>mere</i> conjecture, and they do nothing but lie. Footnote: <b>Note:</b> Here the word ‘lie’ is not sufficient to do justice to the fuller meaning of the word <i>‘yukhrusun’</i> (<b></b>) which covers wider connotations like fabrication or professing to be able to predict the future while they only indulge in wild guesses.
[6:118] Surely, thy Lord knows best those who go astray from His way; and He knows best those who are rightly guided.
[6:119] Eat, then, of that over which the name of Allah has been pronounced, if you are believers in His Signs.
[6:120] And what reason have you that you should not eat of that over which the name of Allah has been pronounced, when He has already explained to you that which He has forbidden unto you — save that which you are forced to? And surely many mislead <i>others</i> by their evil desires through lack of knowledge. Assuredly, thy Lord knows best the transgressors.
[6:121] And eschew open sins as well as secret ones. Surely, those who earn sin will be rewarded for that which they have earned. Footnote: And eschew <b>sin be it apparent or hidden</b>.
[6:122] And eat not of that on which the name of Allah has not been pronounced, for surely that is disobedience. And certainly the evil ones inspire their friends that they may dispute with you. And if you obey them, you will indeed be setting up gods <i>with God.</i>
[6:123] Can he, who was dead and We gave him life and made for him a light whereby he walks among men, be like him whose condition is <i>that he is</i> in utter darkness whence he cannot come forth? Thus have the doings of the disbelievers been made <i>to seem</i> fair to them.
[6:124] And thus have We made in every town the great ones from among its sinners <i>such as are in utter darkness</i> with the result that they plot therein; and they plot not except against their own souls; but they perceive not. Footnote: And thus <b>We allowed the leaders of the sinners in every township to plot therein <i>against the truth</i></b>;… (p) <b>Note:</b> The expression <i>‘akabira mujrimiha’</i> (<b></b>) literally means ‘the great among the sinful of that township.’ The word ‘great’ here may mean those who have the larger share of sin and as such they stand out among them as leaders or it may mean the great and influential members of a sinful society.
[6:125] And when there comes to them a Sign, they say, ‘We will not believe until we are given the like of that which Allah’s Messengers have been given.’ Allah knows best where to place His Message. Surely, humiliation before Allah and a severe punishment shall smite the offenders because of their plotting.
[6:126] So, whomsoever Allah wishes to guide, He expands his bosom for <i>the acceptance of</i> Islam; and as to him whom He wishes to <i>let</i> go astray, He makes his bosom narrow <i>and</i> close, as though he were mounting up into the skies. Thus does Allah inflict punishment on those who do not believe. Footnote: So whomever Allah wishes to guide, <b>He opens his heart</b> for <i>the acceptance of</i> Islam; and as to him whom He wishes to let go astray, <b>He constricts his heart as if he were climbing a steep height.</b> Thus does Allah inflict punishment on those who do not believe. (p) <b>Note:</b> The word <i>‘sadra’</i> (<b></b>) can be translated as heart. (See Al-Munjid.)
[6:127] And this is the path of thy Lord <i>leading</i> straight <i>to Him.</i> We have indeed explained the Signs in detail for a people who would be admonished.
[6:128] For them is the abode of peace with their Lord, and He is their Friend because of what they did.
[6:129] And on the day when He will gather them all together, <i>He will say</i>, ‘O company of Jinn! you sought <i>to make subservient to yourselves</i> a great many from among men!’ And their friends from among men will say, ‘Our Lord! we profited from one another but <i>now</i> we have reached our term which Thou didst appoint for us.’ He will say, ‘The Fire is your abode, wherein you shall abide, save what Allah may will.’ Surely, thy Lord is Wise, All-Knowing.
[6:130] And in like manner do We set some of the wrongdoers over the others because of what they earned.
[6:131] ‘O company of Jinn and men! did not Messengers come to you from among yourselves who related to you My Signs and who warned you of the meeting of this your day?’ They will say, ‘We bear witness against ourselves.’ And the worldly life deceived them. And they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.
[6:132] That is because thy Lord would not destroy the towns unjustly while their people were unwarned.
[6:133] And for all are degrees <i>of rank</i> according to what they do, and thy Lord is not unmindful of what they do.
[6:134] And thy Lord is Self-Sufficient, full of mercy. If He please, He can do away with you and cause to succeed you what He pleases, even as He raised you from the offspring of other people.
[6:135] Surely, that which you are promised shall come to pass and you cannot frustrate <i>it</i>.
[6:136] Say, ‘O my people, act as best you can. I, too, am acting. Soon will you know whose will be the ultimate reward of the abode.’ Surely, the wrongdoers shall not prosper.
[6:137] And they have assigned Allah a portion of the crops and cattle which He has produced, and they say, ‘This is for Allah,’ as they imagine, ‘and this is for our idols.’ But that which is for their idols reaches not Allah, while that which is for Allah reaches their idols. Evil is what they judge. Footnote: Evil is what they <b>conclude</b>.
[6:138] And in like manner have their associate-gods made the killing of their children <i>appear</i> beautiful to many of the idolaters that they may ruin them and cause them confusion in their religion. And if Allah had <i>enforced</i> His will, they would not have done this; so leave them alone with that which they invent. Footnote: And in like manner have their <b>associates</b> made the killing of their children…
[6:139] And they say, ‘Such and such cattle and crops are forbidden. None shall eat thereof save whom we please’ — so they allege — and there are cattle whose backs are forbidden, and there are cattle over which they pronounce not the name of Allah, forging a lie against Him. Soon will He requite them for that which they have fabricated.
[6:140] And they say, ‘That which is in the wombs of such and such cattle is exclusively <i>reserved</i> for our males and is forbidden to our wives; but if it be <i>born</i> dead, then they are <i>all</i> partakers thereof. He will reward them for their assertion. Surely, He is Wise, All-Knowing. Footnote: He will <b>requite them</b> for their assertion.
[6:141] Losers indeed are they who kill their children foolishly for lack of knowledge, and make unlawful what Allah has provided for them, forging a lie against Allah. They have indeed gone astray and are not rightly guided.
[6:142] And He it is Who brings into being gardens, trellised and untrellised, and the date-palm and cornfields whose fruits are of diverse kinds, and the olive and the pomegranate, alike and unlike. Eat of the fruit of each when it bears fruit, but pay His due on the day of harvest and exceed not the bounds. Surely, Allah loves not those who exceed the bounds.
[6:143] And of the cattle <i>He has created some</i> for burden and <i>some</i> for slaughter. Eat of that which Allah has provided for you, and follow not the footsteps of Satan. Surely, he is to you an open foe.
[6:144] <i>And of the cattle He has created</i> eight mates: of the sheep two, and of the goats two; — say, ‘Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Inform me with knowledge, if you are truthful.’ Footnote: <i>He has created</i> eight mates <b>altogether <i>consisting of</i></b> the sheep two, and of the goats two;-
[6:145] And of the camels two, and of the oxen two. Say, ‘Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Were you present when Allah enjoined this on you?’ Who is then more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah that he may lead men astray without knowledge? Surely, Allah guides not the unjust people.
[6:146] Say, ‘I find not in what has been revealed to me aught forbidden to an eater <i>who wishes</i> to eat it, except it be that which dies of itself, or blood poured forth, or the flesh of swine — for <i>all</i> that is unclean — or what is profane, on which is invoked the name of other than Allah. But whoso is driven by necessity, being neither disobedient nor exceeding <i>the limit</i>, then surely thy Lord is Most Forgiving, Merciful.’ Footnote: <b>Note:</b> Here the word <i>idturra</i> (<b></b>) means compelled by starvation and famished beyond one’s capacity to withstand the pressure.
[6:147] And to those who are Jews We forbade all animals having claws; and of the oxen and the sheep and goats did We forbid them their fats, save that which their backs bear or the intestines, or that which is mixed with a bone. That is the reward We gave them for their rebellion. And most surely We are truthful.
[6:148] But if they accuse thee of falsehood, say, ‘Your Lord is possessed of all-embracing mercy, and His wrath shall not be turned back from the guilty people.’
[6:149] Those who join gods <i>with God</i> will say, ‘If Allah had pleased, we could not have joined gods <i>with Him</i>, nor could our fathers; nor could we have made anything unlawful.’ In like manner did those who were before them accuse <i>God’s Messengers</i> of falsehood, until they tasted of Our wrath. Say, ‘Have you any knowledge? Then produce it for us. You follow nothing but <i>mere</i> conjecture. And you do nothing but lie.’ Footnote: Those who <b>associate partners</b> <i>with</i> <i><b>Allah</b></i>, will say,
[6:150] Say, ‘Allah’s is the argument that reaches <i>home.</i> If He had <i>enforced</i> His will, He could have surely guided you all.’ Footnote: Say, ‘<b>To Allah belongs the conclusive argument.</b>
[6:151] Say, ‘Bring forward your witnesses who testify that Allah has forbidden this.’ If they bear witness, bear thou not witness with them, nor follow thou the evil inclinations of those who treat Our Signs as lies and those who believe not in the Hereafter and who set up equals to their Lord.
[6:152] Say, ‘Come, I will rehearse to you what your Lord has forbidden: that you associate not anything as partner with Him and <i>that you do</i> good to parents, and that you kill not your children for <i>fear of</i> poverty — it is We Who provide for you and for them — and that you approach not foul deeds, whether open or secret; and that you kill not the life which Allah has made sacred, save by right. That is what He has enjoined upon you, that you may understand. Footnote: Say, ‘Come, I will rehearse to you what your Lord has <b>made inviolable for you; that you may not associate anything with Him as a partner and that you must treat parents with exceeding kindness,</b>
[6:153] ‘And approach not the property of the orphan, except in <i>a way</i> which is best, till he attains his maturity. And give full measure and weight with equity. We task not any soul except according to its capacity. And when you speak, observe justice, even if <i>the concerned person</i> be a relative, and fulfil the covenant of Allah. That is what He enjoins upon you, that you may remember.’
[6:154] And <i>say</i>, ‘This is My path <i>leading</i> straight. So follow it; and follow not <i>other</i> ways, lest they lead you away from His way. That is what He enjoins upon you, that you may <i>become able to</i> guard <i>against evils</i>.’
[6:155] Again, We gave Moses the Book — completing the favour upon him who did good, and an explanation of all <i>necessary</i> things, and a guidance and a mercy — that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord. Footnote: Again, We gave Moses the Book <b>which completely fulfils the requirements of one who is excellent in conduct and explains everything to the last detail and is a guidance and blessing so that they come to</b> believe in the meeting with their Lord.
[6:156] And this is a Book which We have sent down; <i>it is</i> full of blessings. So follow it, and guard against <i>sin</i> that you may be shown mercy;
[6:157] Lest You should say, ‘The Book was sent down only to two peoples before us, and we were indeed unaware of their reading;’
[6:158] Or lest you should say, ‘Had the Book been sent down to us, we should surely have been better guided than they.’ There has <i>now</i> come to you a clear evidence from your Lord, and a guidance and a mercy. Who, then, is more unjust than he who rejects the Signs of Allah and turns away from them? We will requite those who turn away from Our Signs with an evil punishment because of their turning away.
[6:159] Do they expect aught but that angels should come to them or that thy Lord should come or that some of the Signs of thy Lord should come? The day when some of the Signs of thy Lord shall come, to believe in them shall not profit a soul which believed not before, nor earned any good by its faith. Say, ‘Wait ye, we <i>too</i> are waiting.’
[6:160] <i>As for</i> those who split up their religion and became <i>divided into</i> sects, thou hast no concern at all with them. Surely their case will come before Allah, then will He inform them of what they used to do.
[6:161] Whoso does a good deed shall have ten times as much; but he who does an evil deed, shall have only a like reward; and they shall not be wronged.
[6:162] Say, ‘As for me, my Lord has guided me unto a straight path — a right religion, the religion of Abraham, the upright. And he was not of those who join gods <i>with God</i>.’ Footnote: a right religion, the religion of Abraham <b>who was always inclined to the right path</b>. And he was not of those who associate partners <i>with God</i>.
[6:163] Say, ‘My Prayer and my sacrifice and my life and my death are <i>all</i> for Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
[6:164] ‘He has no partner. And so am I commanded, and I am the first of those who submit.’
[6:165] Say, ‘Shall I seek a lord other than Allah, while He is the Lord of all things?’ And no soul acts but only against itself; nor does any bearer of burden bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord will be your return, and He will inform you of that wherein you used to differ. Footnote: And no soul <b>earns aught <i>of evil</i> but carries its burden against itself. And no bearer shall carry the burden of another.</b> Then to your Lord will be your return……
[6:166] And He it is Who has made you successors <i>of others</i> on the earth and has exalted some of you over the others in degrees <i>of rank</i>, that He may try you by that which He has given you. Surely, thy Lord is quick in punishment; and surely He is Most Forgiving, Merciful. Footnote: Surely, <b>your</b> Lord is <b>swift in punishment</b>; and surely He is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[7:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[7:2] Alif Lam Mim Sad. Footnote: I am Allah, I know and I explain.
[7:3] <i>This is</i> a Book revealed unto thee — so let there be no straitness in thy bosom concerning it — that thou mayest warn thereby, and <i>that it be</i> an exhortation to the believers.
[7:4] Follow that which has been sent down to you from your Lord, and follow no protectors other than Him. How little do you remember!
[7:5] How many a town have We destroyed! And Our punishment came upon it by night or while they slept at noon. Footnote: or while <b>they were resting at noon</b>.
[7:6] So when Our punishment came upon them, their cry was nothing but that they said: ‘We were indeed wrongdoers!’
[7:7] And We will certainly question those to whom <i>the Messengers</i> were sent, and We will certainly question the Messengers.
[7:8] Then will We certainly relate to them <i>their deeds</i> with knowledge, for We were never absent.
[7:9] And the weighing on that day will be true. Then as for those whose scales are heavy, it is they who shall prosper.
[7:10] And as for those whose scales are light, it is they who shall have ruined their souls because of their being unjust to Our Signs.
[7:11] And We have established you in the earth and provided for you therein the means of subsistence. How little thanks you give!
[7:12] And We did create you <i>and</i> then We gave you shape; then said We to the angels, ‘Submit to Adam;’ and they <i>all</i> submitted but Iblis <i>did not</i>; he would not be of those who submit.
[7:13] <i>God</i> said, ‘What prevented thee from submitting when I commanded thee?’ He said, ‘I am better than he. Thou hast created me of fire while him hast Thou created of clay.’
[7:14] <i>God</i> said, ‘Then go down hence; it is not for thee to be arrogant here. Get out; thou art certainly of those who are abased.’
[7:15] He said, ‘Grant me respite till the day when they will be raised up.’
[7:16] <i>God</i> said, ‘Thou shalt be of those who are given respite.’
[7:17] He said: ‘Now, since Thou hast adjudged me as lost, I will assuredly lie in wait for them on Thy straight path.
[7:18] ‘Then will I surely come upon them from before them and from behind them and from their right and from their left, and Thou wilt not find most of them to be grateful.’
[7:19] <i>God</i> said: ‘Get out hence, despised and banished. Whosoever of them shall follow thee, I will surely fill Hell with you all.’
[7:20] ‘And O Adam, dwell thou and thy wife in the garden and eat therefrom wherever you will, but approach not this tree lest you be among the wrongdoers.’
[7:21] But Satan whispered <i>evil suggestions</i> to them so that he might make known to them what was hidden from them of their shame, and said, ‘Your Lord has only forbidden you this tree, lest you should become angels or such <i>beings</i> as live for ever.’ Footnote: But Satan whispered <i>suggestions</i> to them so that he might <b>reveal to them their shortcomings which had remained concealed in them</b> of their shame, and said, ‘Your Lord has only forbidden you this tree, lest you should become angels or such <i>beings</i> as live for ever.’
[7:22] And he swore to them, <i>saying</i>, ‘Surely, I am a sincere counsellor unto you.’
[7:23] So he caused them to fall <i>into disobedience</i> by deceit. And when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them and they began to stick the leaves of the garden <i>together</i> over themselves. And their Lord called them, <i>saying</i>, ‘Did I not forbid you that tree and tell you: verily, Satan is to you an open foe?’
[7:24] They said, ‘Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves; and if Thou forgive us not and have not mercy on us, we shall surely be of the lost.’
[7:25] He said, ‘Go forth, some of you <i>being</i> enemies of others. And for you there is an abode on the earth and a provision for a time.’
[7:26] He said, ‘Therein shall you live, and therein shall you die, and therefrom shall you be brought forth.’
[7:27] O children of Adam! We have indeed sent down to you raiment to cover your shame, and to be an elegant dress; but the raiment of righteousness — that is the best. That is <i>one</i> of the Signs of Allah, that they may remember.
[7:28] O children of Adam! let not Satan seduce you, even as he turned your parents out of the garden, stripping them of their raiment that he might show them their shame. Truly he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you see them not. Surely, We have made satans friends for those who believe not.
[7:29] And when they commit a foul deed, they say: ‘We found our fathers doing it, and Allah has enjoined it upon us.’ Say, ‘Allah never enjoins foul deeds. Do you say of Allah what you know not?’
[7:30] Say, ‘My Lord has enjoined justice. And fix your attention aright at every <i>time and</i> place of worship, and call upon Him, making yourselves sincere towards Him in religion. As He brought you into being, so shall you return.’
[7:31] Some has He guided, and <i>as for</i> others error has become their desert. They have taken evil ones for friends to the exclusion of Allah, and they think that they are rightly guided.
[7:32] O children of Adam! look to your adornment at every <i>time and</i> place of worship, and eat and drink but exceed not the bounds; surely, He does not love those who exceed the bounds. Footnote: O children of Adam! <b>adorn yourself</b> at every <i>time and</i> place of worship <b><i>with garment of fear of Allah</i></b>, and eat and drink but exceed not the bounds; surely, He does not love those who exceed the bounds.
[7:33] Say, ‘Who has forbidden the adornment of Allah which He has produced for His servants, and the good things of <i>His</i> providing?’ Say, ‘They are for the believers in the present life <i>and</i> exclusively <i>for them</i> on the Day of Resurrection. Thus do We explain the Signs for a people who have knowledge.’
[7:34] Say, ‘My Lord has only forbidden foul deeds, whether open or secret, and sin and wrongful transgression, and that you associate with Allah that for which He has sent down no authority, and that you say of Allah that of which you have no knowledge.’
[7:35] And for every people there is a term, and when their term is come, they cannot remain behind a single moment, nor can they get ahead <i>of it</i>.
[7:36] O children of Adam! if Messengers come to you from among yourselves, rehearsing My Signs unto you, then whoso shall fear God and do good deeds, on them <i>shall come</i> no fear nor shall they grieve.
[7:37] But those who reject Our Signs and turn away from them with disdain, these shall be the inmates of the Fire; they shall abide therein.
[7:38] Who is, then, more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah or gives the lie to His Signs? It is these who shall have their lot as ordained till when Our messengers shall visit them to take away their souls, they shall say, ‘Where is that which you used to call upon beside Allah?’ They will answer, ‘We cannot find them;’ and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers. Footnote: They will answer, ‘<b>To us they are entirely lost</b>;’
[7:39] He will say, ‘Enter ye into the Fire among the nations of Jinn and men who passed away before you.’ Every time a people enters, it shall curse its sister (people) until, when they have all successively arrived therein, the last of them will say of the first of them: ‘Our Lord, these led us astray, so give them a double punishment of the Fire.’ He will say, ‘For each <i>preceding party</i> there shall be double <i>punishment</i>, but you do not know.’
[7:40] And the first of them will say to the last of them: ‘You have then no superiority over us; taste therefore the punishment for all that you did.’
[7:41] Those who reject Our Signs and turn away from them with disdain, the gates of the <i>spiritual</i> firmament will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Heaven until a camel goes through the eye of a needle. And thus do We requite the offenders. Footnote: <b>gates of heaven</b> will not be opened for them,
[7:42] They shall have a bed of Hell, and over them coverings <i>of the same.</i> And thus do We requite the unjust.
[7:43] But <i>as to</i> those who believe and do good works — <i>and</i> We task not any soul beyond its capacity — these are the inmates of Heaven; they shall abide therein.
[7:44] And We shall remove whatever rancour may be in their hearts. Beneath them shall flow rivers. And they shall say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah Who has guided us to this. And we could not have found guidance, if Allah had not guided us. The Messengers of our Lord did indeed bring the truth.’ And it shall be proclaimed unto them: ‘This is the Heaven which you have been given for an inheritance <i>as a reward</i> for what you used to do.’
[7:45] And the inmates of Heaven will call out to the inmates of Hell: ‘We have indeed found what our Lord promised us to be true. Have you too found what your Lord promised you to be true?’ They shall say: ‘Yes’. Then a proclaimer shall proclaim between them <i>saying</i>, ‘The curse of Allah is on the wrongdoers — 
[7:46] ‘Who turn <i>men</i> away from the path of Allah and seek to make it crooked, and who are disbelievers in the Hereafter.’
[7:47] And between the two there shall be a partition, and on the elevated places there shall be men who will know all by their marks. And they will call out to the people of Heaven: ‘Peace be on you.’ These will not have <i>yet</i> entered it although they will be hoping <i>to do so.</i>
[7:48] And when their eyes are turned towards the people of the Fire, they will say, ‘Our Lord, put us not with the unjust people.’
[7:49] And the occupants of the elevated places will call out to men whom they will know by their marks, <i>and</i> say, “Your multitude availed you not, nor your arrogance.
[7:50] “Are these the men about whom you swore that Allah would not extend mercy to them? <i>To them it has been said</i>, ‘Enter Paradise; no fear <i>shall come</i> upon you, nor shall you grieve.’”
[7:51] And the inmates of the Fire will call out to the inmates of Heaven, ‘Pour out on us some water or some of that which Allah has provided for you.’ They will say, ‘Verily, Allah has forbidden them both to disbelievers — 
[7:52] ‘Those who took their religion for a pastime and a sport, and whom the life of the world beguiled.’ This day, then, shall We forget them as they forgot the meeting of this day of theirs, and as they used to deny Our Signs.
[7:53] And surely We have brought them a Book which We have expounded with knowledge, a guidance and a mercy for a people who believe.
[7:54] Do they wait only for the fulfilment <i>of warnings</i> thereof? On the day when the fulfilment thereof shall come, those who had forgotten it before shall say, ‘The Messengers of our Lord did indeed bring the truth. Have we then any intercessors to intercede for us? Or could we be sent back so that we might do <i>deeds</i> other than that which we used to do?’ They have indeed ruined their souls and that which they used to fabricate has failed them.
[7:55] Surely, your Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth in six periods; then He settled Himself on the Throne. He makes the night cover the day, which pursues it swiftly. And <i>He created</i> the sun and the moon and the stars, <i>all</i> made subservient by His command. Verily, His is the creation and the command. Blessed is Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
[7:56] Call upon your Lord in humility and in secret. Surely, He does not love the transgressors.
[7:57] And create not disorder in the earth after it has been set in order, and call upon Him in fear and hope. Surely, the mercy of Allah is nigh unto those who do good.
[7:58] And He it is Who sends the winds as glad tidings before His mercy, till, when they bear a heavy cloud, We drive it to a dead land, then We send down water therefrom, and We bring forth therewith fruits of every kind. In like manner do We bring forth the dead that you may remember.
[7:59] And <i>as for</i> the good land, its vegetation comes forth <i>plentifully</i> by the command of its Lord; and that which is bad, <i>its vegetation</i> does not come forth but scantily. In like manner do We vary the Signs for a people who are grateful.
[7:60] We sent Noah to his people and he said, ‘O my people, worship Allah, you have no other God but Him. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of the great day.’
[7:61] The chiefs of his people said, ‘Surely, we see thee to be in manifest error.’
[7:62] He said, ‘O my people, there is no error in me, but I am a Messenger from the Lord of the worlds.
[7:63] ‘I deliver to you the messages of my Lord and give you sincere advice, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
[7:64] ‘Do you wonder that an exhortation has come to you from your Lord through a man from among yourselves, that he may warn you and that you may become righteous and that you may be shown mercy?’
[7:65] But they accused him of falsehood, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and We drowned those who rejected Our Signs. They were indeed a blind people.
[7:66] And unto ‘Ad <i>We sent</i> their brother Hud. He said, ‘O my people, worship Allah; you have no other deity but Him. Will you not then be God-fearing?’
[7:67] The disbelieving chiefs of his people said, ‘We surely see thee <i>lost</i> in foolishness, and we surely think thee to be <i>one</i> of the liars.’
[7:68] He replied, ‘O my people, there is no foolishness in me, but I am a Messenger from the Lord of the worlds.
[7:69] ‘I deliver to you the messages of my Lord and I am to you a sincere and faithful counsellor.
[7:70] ‘Do you wonder that an exhortation has come to you from your Lord through a man from among yourselves that he may warn you? And remember <i>the time</i> when He made you inheritors <i>of His favours</i> after the people of Noah, and increased you abundantly in constitution. Remember, then, the favours of Allah, that you may prosper.’
[7:71] They said, ‘Hast thou come to us that we may worship Allah alone and forsake what our fathers used to worship? Bring us, then, that which thou threatenest us with, if thou art of the truthful.’
[7:72] He replied, ‘Indeed there have <i>already</i> fallen on you punishment and wrath from your Lord. Do you dispute with me about names which you have named — you and your fathers — for which Allah has sent down no authority? Wait then, I am with you among those who wait.’
[7:73] And We saved him and those who were with him, by Our mercy, and We cut off the last remnant of those who rejected Our Signs. And they were not believers.
[7:74] And to Thamud <i>We sent</i> their brother Salih. He said, ‘O my people, worship Allah; you have no other deity but Him. Verily there has come to you a clear evidence from your Lord — this she-camel of Allah, a Sign for you. So leave her that she may feed in Allah’s earth, and do her no harm, lest a painful punishment seize you.
[7:75] And remember <i>the time</i> when He made you inheritors <i>of His favours</i> after ‘Ad, and assigned you an abode in the land; you build palaces in its plains, and you hew the mountains into houses. Remember, therefore, the favours of Allah and commit not iniquity in the earth, causing disorder.’
[7:76] The chief men of his people who were arrogant said to those who were reckoned weak — those among them who believed — ‘Do you know <i>for certain</i> that Salih is one sent by his Lord?’ They answered, ‘Surely, we believe in that with which he has been sent.’
[7:77] Those who were arrogant said, ‘Verily, we do disbelieve in that in which you believe.’
[7:78] Then they hamstrung the shecamel and rebelled against the command of their Lord, and said, ‘O Salih, bring us that which thou threatenest us with, if thou art <i>indeed one</i> of the Messengers.’
[7:79] So the earthquake seized them and in their homes they lay prostrate upon the ground. Footnote: <b>Then</b> the earthquake seized them <b>so that they turned into corpses lying prone in their houses</b>.
[7:80] Then <i>Salih</i> turned away from them and said, ‘O my people, I did deliver the message of my Lord unto you and offered you sincere counsel, but you love not sincere counsellors.’
[7:81] And <i>We sent</i> Lot — when he said to his people, ‘Do you commit an abomination such as no one in the world ever did before you?
[7:82] ‘You approach men with lust instead of women. Nay, you are a people who exceed <i>all</i> bounds.’
[7:83] And the answer of his people was no other than that they said, ‘Turn them out of your town, for they are men who would keep pure.’
[7:84] And We saved him and his family, except his wife: she was of those who stayed behind.
[7:85] And We rained upon them a rain. Now see, what was the end of the sinners!
[7:86] And to Midian <i>We sent</i> their brother Shu‘aib. He said, ‘O my people, worship Allah; you have no other deity but Him. A clear Sign has indeed come to you from your Lord. So give full measure and full weight, and diminish not unto people their things, and create not disorder in the earth after it has been set in order. This is better for you, if you are believers. Footnote: <b>and do not give people less than what rightfully belongs to them,</b>
[7:87] ‘And sit not on every path, threatening and turning away from the path of Allah those who believe in Him, and seeking to make it crooked. And remember when you were few and He multiplied you. And behold, what was the end of those who created disorder!
[7:88] ‘And if there is a party among you who believes in that with which I have been sent, and a party who does not believe, then have patience until Allah judges between us. And He is the Best of judges.’
[7:89] The chief men of his people who were arrogant said, ‘Assuredly, we will drive thee out, O Shu‘aib, and the believers <i>that are</i> with thee, from our town, or you shall have to return to our religion.’ He said: ‘Even though we be unwilling?
[7:90] ‘We have indeed been forging a lie against Allah, if we <i>now</i> return to your religion after Allah has saved us therefrom. And it behoves us not to return thereto except that Allah, our Lord, should <i>so</i> will. Our Lord comprehends all things in <i>His</i> knowledge. In Allah have we put our trust. <i>So</i> O our Lord, decide Thou between us and between our people with truth, and Thou art the Best of those who decide.’ Footnote: <b>In knowledge our Lord comprehends all things.</b>
[7:91] And the chief men of his people who disbelieved said, ‘If you follow Shu‘aib, you shall then certainly be the losers.’
[7:92] So the earthquake seized them and in their homes they lay prostrate upon the ground.
[7:93] Those who accused Shu‘aib of lying became as if they had never dwelt therein. Those who accused Shu‘aib of lying — it was they who were the losers.
[7:94] Then he turned away from them and said, ‘O my people, indeed, I delivered to you the messages of my Lord and gave you sincere counsel. How then should I sorrow for a disbelieving people?’
[7:95] And never did We send a Prophet to any town but We seized the people thereof with adversity and suffering, that they might become humble.
[7:96] Then We changed <i>their</i> evil <i>condition</i> into good until they grew <i>in affluence and number</i> and said, ‘Suffering and happiness betided our fathers <i>also.</i>’ Then We seized them suddenly, while they perceived not.
[7:97] And if the people of <i>those</i> towns had believed and been righteous, We would have surely opened for them blessings from heaven and earth; but they disbelieved, so We seized them because of that which they used to earn.
[7:98] Are the people of <i>these</i> towns, then, secure from the coming of Our punishment upon them by night while they are asleep?
[7:99] And are the people of <i>these</i> towns secure from the coming of Our punishment upon them in the early part of the forenoon while they are engaged in play?
[7:100] Are they then secure from the design of Allah? And none feels secure from the design of Allah save the people that perish.
[7:101] Does it not afford guidance to those who have inherited the earth in succession to its <i>former</i> inhabitants, that if We please, We can smite them for their sins and seal up their hearts, so that they should not hear?
[7:102] Such were the towns some of whose news We have related to thee. And their Messengers did indeed come to them with clear Signs. But they would not believe what they had disbelieved before. In this manner does Allah seal up the hearts of the disbelievers.
[7:103] And We found not in most of them any <i>observance of</i> covenant and surely We found most of them to be evil-doers. Footnote: And We found not in most of them any <b>regard for</b> <i>observance of</i> covenant and surely We found most of them to be evil-doers.
[7:104] Then, after them, We sent Moses with Our Signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they unjustly <i>rejected</i> them. Behold, then, what was the end of those who created disorder!
[7:105] And Moses said, ‘O Pharaoh, <i>truly</i>, I am a Messenger from the Lord of the worlds.
[7:106] ‘It is not meet that I should say anything of Allah except the truth. I have come to you with a clear Sign from your Lord; therefore, let the children of Israel go with me.’
[7:107] <i>Pharaoh</i> replied, ‘If thou hast indeed come with a Sign, then produce it, if thou art of the truthful.’
[7:108] So he flung down his rod, and behold! it was a serpent plainly visible.
[7:109] And he drew forth his hand, and lo! it was white for the beholders.
[7:110] The chiefs of Pharaoh’s people said, ‘This is most surely a skilful magician.
[7:111] ‘He desires to turn you out from your land. Now what do you advise?’
[7:112] They said, ‘Put him off and his brother <i>awhile</i>, and send into the cities summoners,
[7:113] ‘Who should bring to thee every skilful magician.’
[7:114] And the magicians came to Pharaoh <i>and</i> said: ‘We shall, of course, have a reward, if we prevail.’
[7:115] He said, ‘Yes, and you shall <i>also</i> be of those who are placed near <i>me</i>.’
[7:116] They said, ‘O Moses, either throw thou <i>first</i>, or we shall be the <i>first</i> throwers.’
[7:117] He replied, ‘Throw ye.’ And when they threw, they enchanted the eyes of the people, and struck them with awe and brought forth a great magic.
[7:118] And We inspired Moses, <i>saying</i>, ‘Throw thy rod,’ and lo! it swallowed up whatever they feigned.
[7:119] So was the Truth established, and their works proved vain.
[7:120] Thus were they vanquished there, and they returned humiliated.
[7:121] And the magicians were impelled to fall down prostrate.
[7:122] <i>And</i> they said, ‘We believe in the Lord of the worlds,
[7:123] ‘The Lord of Moses and Aaron.’
[7:124] Pharaoh said, ‘You have believed in him before I gave you leave. Surely, this is a plot that you have plotted in the city, that you may turn out therefrom its inhabitants, but you shall soon know <i>the consequences.</i>
[7:125] ‘Most surely will I cut off your hands and your feet on alternate sides. Then will I surely crucify you all together.
[7:126] They answered, ‘To our Lord <i>then</i> shall we return.
[7:127] ‘And thou dost not wreak vengeance on us but because we have believed in the Signs of our Lord, when they came to us. Our Lord, pour forth upon us steadfastness and cause us to die resigned <i>unto Thee</i>.’
[7:128] And the chiefs of Pharaoh’s people said, ‘Wilt thou leave Moses and his people to create disorder in the land, and forsake thee and thy gods?’ He answered, ‘We will ruthlessly slay their sons and let their women live. And surely we are dominant over them.’
[7:129] Moses said to his people, ‘Seek help from Allah and be steadfast. Verily, the earth is Allah’s ; He gives it as a heritage to whomsoever He pleases of His servants, and the end is for the God-fearing.’
[7:130] They replied, ‘We were persecuted before thou camest to us and <i>even</i> after thou camest to us.’ He said, ‘Your Lord is about to destroy your enemy and make you rulers in the land, <i>that</i> He may then see how you act.’
[7:131] And We punished Pharaoh’s people with drought and scarcity of fruits, that they might be admonished.
[7:132] But when there came to them good, they said, ‘This is for us.’ And if evil befell them, they ascribed the evil fortune to Moses and those with him. Now, surely, <i>the cause of</i> their evil fortune is with Allah. But most of them do not know.
[7:133] And they said, ‘Whatever Sign thou mayest bring us to bewitch us with, we will not believe in thee.’
[7:134] Then We sent upon them the storm and the locusts, and the lice, and the frogs, and the blood — clear Signs; but they behaved proudly and were a sinful people.
[7:135] And when there fell upon them the punishment, they said, ‘O Moses, pray for us to thy Lord according to that which He has promised to thee. If thou remove from us the punishment, we will surely believe in thee and we will surely send with thee the children of Israel.’
[7:136] But when We removed from them the punishment for a term which they were to reach, lo! they broke their promise.
[7:137] So We took vengeance upon them and drowned them in the sea, because they treated Our Signs as lies and were heedless of them.
[7:138] And We caused the people who were considered weak to inherit the eastern parts of the land and the western parts thereof, which We blessed. And the gracious word of thy Lord was fulfilled for the children of Israel because they were steadfast; and We destroyed all that Pharaoh and his people had built and all that they had erected.
[7:139] And We brought the children of Israel across the sea, and they came to a people who were devoted to their idols. They said, ‘O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods.’ He said, ‘Surely, you are an ignorant people.
[7:140] ‘<i>As to</i> these, surely destroyed shall be all that they are engaged in, and vain shall be all that they do.’
[7:141] He said, ‘Shall I seek for you a god other than Allah, while He has exalted you above all peoples?’
[7:142] And <i>remember the time</i> when We delivered you from Pharaoh’s people who afflicted you with grievous torment, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women. And therein was a great trial for you from your Lord.
[7:143] And We made Moses a promise of thirty nights and supplemented them with ten. Thus the period appointed by his Lord was completed — forty nights. And Moses said to his brother, Aaron, ‘Act for me among my people in my absence, and manage <i>them</i> well, and follow not the way of those who cause disorder.’
[7:144] And when Moses came at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, ‘My Lord, show <i>Thyself</i> to me that I may look at Thee.’ He replied, ‘Thou shalt not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it remains in its place, then shalt thou see Me.’ And when his Lord manifested Himself on the mountain, He broke it into pieces and Moses fell down unconscious. And when he recovered, he said, ‘Holy art Thou, I turn towards Thee, and I am the first to believe.’
[7:145] <i>God</i> said, ‘O Moses, I have chosen thee above the people <i>of thy time</i> by My messages and by My word. So take hold of that which I have given thee and be of the grateful.’
[7:146] And We wrote for him upon the tablets about everything — an admonition and an explanation of all things. ‘So hold them fast and bid thy people follow the best thereof. Soon shall I show you the abode of the transgressors.’
[7:147] I shall soon turn away from My Signs those who behave proudly in the land in an unjust manner; and even if they see all the Signs, they will not believe therein; and if they see the way of righteousness, they will not adopt it as <i>their</i> way; but if they see the way of error, they will adopt it as <i>their</i> way. That is because they treated Our Signs as lies and were heedless of them.
[7:148] And those who disbelieve in Our Signs and the meeting of the Hereafter — their works are vain. Can they <i>expect to</i> be rewarded <i>for anything</i> except for what they do?
[7:149] And the people of Moses made, in his absence, out of their ornaments a calf — a <i>lifeless</i> body producing a lowing sound. Did they not see that it spoke not to them, nor guided them to any way? They took it <i>for worship</i> and they were transgressors.
[7:150] And when they were smitten with remorse and saw that they had indeed gone astray, they said, ‘If our Lord do not have mercy on us and forgive us, we shall surely be among the losers.’
[7:151] And when Moses returned to his people, indignant and grieved, he said, ‘Evil is that which you did in my place in my absence. Did you hasten <i>to devise a way for yourselves without waiting for</i> the command of your Lord?’ And he put down the tablets, and caught hold of his brother’s head, dragging him towards himself. He (Aaron) said, ‘Son of my mother, the people indeed deemed me weak, and were about to kill me. Therefore make not the enemies rejoice over me, and place me not with the unjust people.’
[7:152] He (Moses) said, ‘My Lord, forgive me and my brother, and admit us to Thy mercy, and Thou art the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.’
[7:153] <i>As to</i> those who took the calf <i>for worship</i>, wrath from their Lord shall overtake them and abasement in the present life. And thus do We reward those who invent lies.
[7:154] But those who did evil deeds and repented after that and believed, surely thy Lord is thereafter Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[7:155] And when the anger of Moses was appeased, he took the tablets, and in their writing there was guidance and mercy for those who fear their Lord.
[7:156] And Moses chose of his people seventy men for Our appointment. But when the earthquake overtook them, he said, ‘My Lord, if Thou hadst pleased, Thou couldst have destroyed them before <i>this</i>, and me <i>also</i>. Wilt Thou destroy us for that which the foolish among us have done? This is nothing but a trial from Thee. Thou causest to perish thereby whom Thou pleasest and Thou guidest whom Thou pleasest. Thou art our Protector; forgive us then and have mercy on us, for Thou art the Best of those who forgive.
[7:157] ‘And ordain for us good in this world, as well as in the next; we have turned to Thee <i>with repentance</i>.’ <i>God</i> replied, ‘I will inflict My punishment on whom I will; but My mercy encompasses all things; so I will ordain it for those who act righteously, and pay the Zakat and those who believe in Our Signs — Footnote: ‘And ordain for us good in this world, as well as in the next; we have turned to <b>You <i>seeking forgiveness.</i></b>’
[7:158] ‘Those who follow the Messenger, the Prophet, the Immaculate one, whom they find mentioned in the Torah and the Gospel <i>which are</i> with them. He enjoins on them good and forbids them evil, and makes lawful for them the good things and forbids them the bad, and removes from them their burden and the shackles that were upon them. So those who shall believe in him, and honour and support him, and help him, and follow the light that has been sent down with him — these shall prosper.’ Footnote: ‘Those who follow the Messenger, the Prophet, <b>the unlettered one</b>,
[7:159] Say, ‘O mankind! truly I am a Messenger to you all from Allah to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. There is no God but He. He gives life, and He causes death. So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the Prophet, the Immaculate one, who believes in Allah and His words; and follow him that you may be rightly guided.’ Footnote: He gives life, and He causes death. So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the Prophet, <b>the unlettered one</b>, who believes in Allah and His words; and follow him that you may be rightly guided.’
[7:160] And of the people of Moses there is a party that exhorts <i>people</i> to truth and does justice therewith. Footnote: …a party <b>that guides with truth</b>…
[7:161] And We divided them into twelve tribes, <i>distinct</i> peoples. And We revealed to Moses, when his people asked drink of him, <i>saying</i>, ‘Strike the rock with thy rod;’ and from it there gushed forth twelve springs; every tribe knew their drinking place. And We caused the clouds to overshadow them, and We sent down for them Manna and Salwa: ‘Eat of the good things We have provided for you.’ And they wronged Us not, but it was themselves that they wronged.
[7:162] And when it was said to them, “Dwell in this town and eat therefrom wherever you will, and say, ‘<i>God</i>! lighten <i>our</i> burden,’ and enter the gate in humility, We shall forgive you your sins, <i>and</i> surely We shall give increase to those who do good.”
[7:163] But the transgressors among them changed <i>it</i> for a word other than that which was said to them. So We sent upon them a punishment from heaven, because of their wrongdoing.
[7:164] And ask them concerning the town which stood by the sea. When they profaned the Sabbath; when their fish came to them on their Sabbath day appearing on the surface <i>of the water</i>, but on the day when they did not keep the Sabbath, they came not to them. Thus did We try them because they were rebellious.
[7:165] And when a party among them said, ‘Wherefore do you preach to a people whom Allah is going to destroy or punish with a severe punishment?’ They said, ‘As an excuse before your Lord, and that they may become righteous.’ Footnote: They said, ‘<b>In order to be absolved in the sight of your Lord and that perchance they fear <i>Allah</i></b>.’
[7:166] And when they forgot all that with which they had been admonished, We saved those who forbade evil, and We seized the transgressors with a severe punishment because they were rebellious. Footnote: because <b>of the sins they used to commit</b>.
[7:167] And when they insolently rebelled against that which they had been forbidden, We said to them, ‘Be ye apes, despised!’
[7:168] And <i>remember the time</i> when thy Lord proclaimed that He would truly raise against them, till the Day of Resurrection, those who would afflict them with grievous torment. Surely, thy Lord is quick in retribution, and surely He is <i>also</i> Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[7:169] And We broke them up into <i>separate</i> peoples in the earth. Among them are those that are righteous and among them are those that are otherwise. And We tried them with good things and bad things that they might return.
[7:170] Then there has come an <i>evil</i> generation after them who inherited the Book. They take the paltry goods of this low <i>world</i> and say, ‘It will be forgiven us.’ But if there came to them similar goods <i>again</i>, they would take them. Was not the covenant of the Book taken from them, that they would not say of Allah <i>anything</i> but the truth? And they have studied what is therein. And the abode of the Hereafter is better for those who are righteous. Will you not then understand?
[7:171] And <i>as to</i> those who hold fast by the Book, and observe Prayer, surely We suffer not the reward of <i>such</i> righteous <i>people</i> to perish.
[7:172] And when We shook the mountain over them as though it were a covering, and they thought it was going to fall on them, <i>We said</i>, ‘Hold fast that which We have given you, and remember what is therein that you may be saved.’ Footnote: And then <b>We caused the mountain to lean over them as though it were a canopy</b> and they thought it <b>was about to fall upon them</b>,
[7:173] And when thy Lord brings forth from Adam’s children — out of their loins — their offspring and makes them witnesses against their own selves <i>by saying</i>: ‘Am I not your Lord?’ They say, ‘Yea, we do bear witness.’ <i>This He does</i> lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, ‘We were surely unaware of this.’
[7:174] Or <i>lest</i> you should say, ‘It was only our fathers who attributed copartners <i>to God</i> in the past and we were <i>merely</i> a generation after them. Wilt Thou then destroy us for what was done by those who lied?’
[7:175] And thus do We make clear the Signs, <i>that they may be admonished</i> and that they may return <i>to Us.</i>
[7:176] And relate to them the story of him to whom We gave Our Signs, but he stepped away from them; so Satan followed him up, and he became <i>one</i> of those who go astray.
[7:177] And if We had pleased, We could have exalted him thereby; but he inclined to the earth and followed his evil inclination. His case therefore is like the case of a <i>thirsty</i> dog; if thou drive him away, he hangs out his tongue; and if thou leave him, he hangs out his tongue. Such is the case of the people who disbelieve in Our Signs. So give <i>them</i> the description that they may ponder. Footnote: And if We had <b>so desired</b>, We could have exalted him thereby; but he inclined to the earth and followed his evil inclination. <b>His case is like that of a dog that hands out his tongue in exhaustion <i>while barking at you</i> regardless of whether you make a motion of casting a stone at him or leave him alone,</b> he hangs out his tongue. Such is the case of the people who disbelieve in Our Signs. So <b>narrate episodes <i>from history</i> so that they may ponder <i>to draw lessons from them.</i></b>
[7:178] Evil is the case of the people who treat Our Signs as lies. And it was their own selves that they wronged.
[7:179] He whom Allah guides is on the right path. And they whom He adjudges astray, these it is who shall be the losers.
[7:180] Verily, We have created many of the Jinn and men whose end shall be Hell! They have hearts <i>but</i> they understand not therewith, and they have eyes <i>but</i> they see not therewith, and they have ears <i>but</i> they hear not therewith. They are like cattle; nay, they are <i>even</i> more astray. They are indeed <i>quite</i> heedless.
[7:181] And to Allah <i>alone</i> belong <i>all</i> perfect attributes. So call on Him by these. And leave alone those who deviate from the right way with respect to His attributes. They shall be repaid for what they do.
[7:182] And of those We have created there are a people that guide <i>men</i> with truth and do justice therewith.
[7:183] And those who reject Our Signs, We will draw them <i>to destruction</i> step by step in a manner which they do not know.
[7:184] And I give them the rein; surely, My plan is mighty.
[7:185] Have they not considered <i>that</i> there is no insanity about their companion? He is only a plain Warner.
[7:186] And have they not looked into the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and all things that Allah has created? And <i>do they not see</i> that, maybe their <i>own</i> term has already drawn nigh? Then in what thing will they believe thereafter?
[7:187] Whomsoever Allah adjudges astray, there can be no guide for him. And He leaves such in their transgression, wandering in distraction.
[7:188] They ask thee respecting the Hour: ‘When will it come to pass?’ Say, ‘The knowledge thereof is only with my Lord. None can manifest it at its time but He. It lies heavy on the heavens and the earth. It shall not come upon you but of a sudden.’ They ask thee as if thou wert well acquainted therewith. Say, ‘The knowledge thereof is only with Allah; but most men do not know.’
[7:189] Say, ‘I have no power to do good or harm to myself, save as Allah please. And if I had knowledge of the unseen, I should have secured abundance of good’ and evil would not have touched me. I am only a warner and a bearer of good tidings to a people who believe.’
[7:190] He it is Who has created you from a single soul, and made therefrom its mate, that he might find comfort in her. And when he knows her, she bears a light burden, and goes about with it. And when she grows heavy, they both pray to Allah, their Lord, <i>saying</i>: ‘If Thou give us a good <i>child,</i> we will surely be of the thankful.’ Footnote: He it is Who has created you from <b>a single being</b> and made <b>from that</b> its mate, that he might find comfort in her. And when <b>he covered her she conceived and carried a light burden and walked about with it. And when she grew heavy, they both prayed to Allah: ‘If You give us a healthy righteous child we shall surely be of those who are grateful.’</b>
[7:191] But when He gives them a good <i>child,</i> they attribute to Him partners in respect of that which He has given them. But exalted is Allah above what they associate <i>with Him.</i>
[7:192] Do they associate <i>with Him</i> as partners those who create nothing, and are themselves created?
[7:193] And they can give them no help, nor can they help themselves.
[7:194] And if you call them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is the same to you whether you call them or you remain silent.
[7:195] Surely, those whom you call on beside Allah are <i>mere</i> servants like you. Then call on them and let them answer you, if you are truthful.
[7:196] Have they feet wherewith they walk, or have they hands wherewith they hold, or have they eyes wherewith they see, or have they ears wherewith they hear? Say, ‘Call upon the partners you associate <i>with</i> <i>God</i>, then contrive <i>ye all</i> against me, and give me no time.
[7:197] ‘Truly, my protector is Allah Who revealed the Book. And He protects the righteous.
[7:198] ‘And they whom you call on beside Him have no power to help you, nor can they help themselves.’
[7:199] And if you invite them to guidance, they hear not. And thou seest them looking towards thee, but they see not.
[7:200] Take to forgiveness, and enjoin kindness, and turn away from the ignorant.
[7:201] And if an evil suggestion from Satan incite thee, then seek refuge in Allah; surely, He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
[7:202] <i>As to</i> those who are righteous, when a suggestion from Satan assails them, they remember <i>God</i>: and behold! they begin to see <i>things rightly</i>.
[7:203] And their brethren make them continue in error, and then they relax not.
[7:204] And when thou bringest not to them a Sign, they say, ‘Wherefore dost thou not forge it?’ Say, ‘I follow only that which is revealed to me from my Lord. These are evidences from your Lord, and guidance and mercy for a people that believe.’ Footnote: <b>These are illuminating Signs from your Lord and a guidance and blessing</b> for a people that believe.’
[7:205] And when the Qur’an is recited, give ear to it and keep silence, that you may be shown mercy.
[7:206] And remember thy Lord in thy mind with humility and fear, and without loudness of speech, in the mornings and evenings; and be not of the neglectful.
[7:207] Truly, those who are near to thy Lord, turn not away with pride from His worship, but they glorify Him and prostrate themselves before Him.
[8:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[8:2] They Ask thee concerning the spoils <i>of war.</i> Say, ‘The spoils belong to Allah and the Messenger. So fear Allah, and set things right among yourselves, and obey Allah and His Messenger, if you are believers.’
[8:3] <i>True</i> believers are only those whose hearts tremble when <i>the name of</i> Allah is mentioned, and when His Signs are recited to them they increase their faith, and who put their trust in their Lord,
[8:4] Who observe Prayer and spend out of that which We have provided for them.
[8:5] These it is who are true believers. They have grades <i>of rank</i> with their Lord, as well as forgiveness and an honourable provision.
[8:6] As <i>it was</i> thy Lord <i>Who</i> rightfully brought thee forth from thy house, while a party of the believers were averse, <i>therefore He helped thee against thy enemy.</i>
[8:7] They dispute with thee concerning the truth after it has become manifest, as though they are being driven to death while they actually see <i>it</i>.
[8:8] And <i>remember the time</i> when Allah promised you one of the two parties‡ that it should be yours, and you wished that the one without sting should be yours, but Allah desired to establish the truth by His words and to cut off the root of the disbelievers, Footnote: <i>i.e.</i> The well-equipped Meccan army and the caravan which, only lightly armed, was proceeding to Mecca from the north.
[8:9] That He might establish the truth and bring to naught that which is false, although the guilty might dislike it.
[8:10] When you implored the assistance of your Lord, and He answered you, <i>saying</i>, ‘I will assist you with a thousand of the angels, following one another.’
[8:11] And Allah made it only as glad tidings, and that your hearts might thereby be set at rest. But help comes from Allah alone; surely, Allah is Mighty, Wise.
[8:12] When He caused sleep to come upon you as a <i>sign of</i> security from Him, and He sent down water upon you from the clouds, that thereby He might purify you, and remove from you the filth of Satan, and that He might strengthen your hearts and make <i>your</i> steps firm therewith.
[8:13] When thy Lord revealed to the angels, <i>saying</i>, ‘I am with you; so give firmness to those who believe. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve. Smite, then, the upper parts of <i>their</i> necks, and smite off all finger-tips.’
[8:14] That is because they have opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoso opposes Allah and His Messenger, then Allah is surely severe in retribution.
[8:15] That <i>is your punishment</i>, taste it then; and <i>know</i> that for disbelievers there is the punishment of the Fire.
[8:16] O ye who believe! when you meet those who disbelieve, advancing in force, turn not <i>your</i> backs to them.
[8:17] And whoso turns his back to them on such a day, unless manoeuvring for battle or turning to <i>join another</i> company, he indeed draws upon himself the wrath of Allah, and Hell shall be his abode. And an evil resort it is.
[8:18] So you killed them not, but it was Allah Who killed them.
