Surely, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. Footnote: and that He might confer on the believers a <b>trial</b> from Himself – <b>a goodly trial</b> – Surely Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
[8:19] That <i>is what happened</i>; and <i>know</i> that Allah is He Who weakens the design of the disbelievers.
[8:20] If you sought a judgment, then judgment has indeed come to you. And if you desist, it will be better for you; but if you return <i>to hostility</i>, We <i>too</i> will return. And your party shall be of no avail at all to you, however numerous it be, and <i>know</i> that Allah is with the believers.
[8:21] O ye who believe! obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not turn away from him while you hear <i>him speak</i>.
[8:22] And be not like those who say, ‘We hear,’ but they hear not.
[8:23] Surely, the worst of beasts in the sight of Allah are the deaf <i>and</i> the dumb, who have no sense.
[8:24] And if Allah had known any good in them, He would certainly have made them hear. And if He <i>now</i> makes them hear, they will turn away, in aversion.
[8:25] O ye who believe! respond to Allah, and the Messenger when he calls you that he may give you life, and know that Allah comes in between a man and his heart, and that He it is unto Whom you shall be gathered.
[8:26] And beware of an affliction which will not smite exclusively those among you who have done wrong. And know that Allah is severe in requiting.
[8:27] And remember <i>the time</i> when you were few <i>and</i> deemed weak in the land, <i>and</i> were in fear lest people should snatch you away, but He sheltered you and strengthened you with His help, and provided you with good things that you might be thankful.
[8:28] O ye who believe! prove not false to Allah and the Messenger, nor prove false to your trusts knowingly. Footnote: O ye who believe! <b>Do not betray Allah and the Messenger while you <i>so often</i> betray your trusts and you know it.</b>
[8:29] And know that your possessions and your children are but a trial and that it is Allah with Whom is a great reward.
[8:30] O ye who believe! if you fear Allah, He will grant you a distinction and will remove your evils from you and will forgive you; and Allah is <i>Lord</i> of great bounty.
[8:31] And <i>remember the time</i> when the disbelievers plotted against thee that they might imprison thee or kill thee or expel thee. And they planned and Allah <i>also</i> planned, and Allah is the Best of planners.
[8:32] And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, ‘We have heard. If we wished we could certainly utter the like of this. This is nothing but <i>mere</i> tales of the ancients.’
[8:33] And <i>remember the time</i> when they said, ‘O Allah, if this be indeed the truth from Thee, then rain down upon us stones from heaven or bring down upon us a grievous punishment.’
[8:34] But Allah would not punish them while thou wast among them, and Allah would not punish them while they sought forgiveness.
[8:35] And what excuse have they <i>now</i> that Allah should not punish them, when they hinder <i>men</i> from the Sacred Mosque, and they are not its <i>true</i> guardians? Its <i>true</i> guardians are only those who are righteous, but most of them know not.
[8:36] And their prayer at the House is nothing but whistling and clapping of hands. ‘Taste then the punishment because you disbelieved.’
[8:37] Surely, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to turn <i>men</i> away from the way of Allah. They will surely continue to spend it; <i>but</i> then shall it become a <i>source of</i> regret for them, <i>and</i> then shall they be overcome. And the disbelievers shall be gathered unto Hell; Footnote: Surely, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to turn <i><b>people</b></i> away from the way of Allah. They will surely continue to spend it, <i>but</i> then <b>it will result for them in <i>nothing but</i> lament <i>and mourning at their utter failure</i> and then shall they be <i>roundly</i> defeated.</b>
[8:38] That Allah may separate the bad from the good, and put the bad, one upon another, and heap them up all together, <i>and</i> then cast them into Hell. These indeed are the losers.
[8:39] Say to those who disbelieve, if they desist, that which is past will be forgiven them; and if they return <i>thereto</i>, then verily, the example of the former peoples has already gone <i>before them</i>.
[8:40] And fight them until there is no persecution and religion is wholly for Allah. But if they desist, then surely Allah is Watchful of what they do.
[8:41] And if they turn their backs, then know that Allah is your Protector. What an excellent Protector and what an excellent Helper!
[8:42] And know that whatever you take as spoils <i>in war</i>, a fifth thereof shall go to Allah and to the Messenger and to the kindred and orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, if you believe in Allah and in what We sent down to Our servant on the Day of Distinction — the day when the two armies met — and Allah has the power to do all things. Footnote: The battle of Badr.
[8:43] When you were on the nearer bank <i>of the valley</i>, and they were on the farther bank, and the caravan was below you. And if you had to make a mutual appointment, you would have certainly differed with regard to the appointment. But <i>the encounter was brought about</i> that Allah might accomplish the thing that was decreed; so that he who had <i>already</i> perished through a clear Sign might perish, and he who had <i>already</i> come to life through a clear Sign might live. And certainly Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. Footnote: And if you, <b><i>both the belligerent parties</i>, were to decide the time of encounter, you would have differed regarding the time <i>to suit your own interests</i>. But it was destined that Allah would decide <i>the time</i> to accomplish that which had already been decreed so that they may perish who are doomed to perish by manifest justification, and they may survive who deserve to survive on the strength of manifest justification</b>.
[8:44] When Allah showed them to thee in thy dream as few; and if He had shown them to thee as many, you would have surely faltered and would have disagreed with one another about the matter; but Allah saved <i>you</i>. Surely, He has full knowledge of what is in <i>your</i> breasts.
[8:45] And when at the time of your encounter He made them appear to you as few in your eyes, and made you appear as few in their eyes, that Allah might bring about the thing that was decreed. And to Allah are all affairs referred <i>for final decision.</i>
[8:46] O ye who believe! when you encounter an army, remain firm, and remember Allah much that you may prosper.
[8:47] And obey Allah and His Messenger and dispute not with one another, lest you falter and your power depart <i>from you</i>. And be steadfast; surely, Allah is with the steadfast.
[8:48] And be not like those who came forth from their homes boastfully, and to be seen of men, and who turn <i>men</i> away from the path of Allah, and Allah encompasses all that they do. Footnote: And be not like those who came forth from their homes <b>to boast <i>of their deeds</i> and to make a display to the people and they prevent <i>people</i> from reaching the path of Allah,</b> and Allah encompasses all that they do.
[8:49] And when Satan made their deeds <i>seem</i> fair to them and said, ‘None among men shall prevail against you this day, and I am your protector.’ But when the two armies came in sight of each other, he turned on his heels, and said, ‘Surely, I have nothing to do with you; surely, I see what you see not. Surely, I fear Allah; and Allah is severe in punishing.’
[8:50] When the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease said, ‘Their religion has deluded these <i>men</i>.’ And whoso puts his trust in Allah, then surely, Allah is Mighty, Wise.
[8:51] And if thou couldst see, when the angels take away the souls of those who disbelieve, smiting their faces and their backs, <i>saying</i>: ‘Taste ye the punishment of burning!
[8:52] ‘That is because of that which your hands have sent on before <i>yourselves</i>, and <i>know</i> that Allah is not at all unjust to <i>His</i> servants.’
[8:53] <i>Their case is</i> like the case of the people of Pharaoh and those before them: they disbelieved in the Signs of Allah; so Allah punished them for their sins. Surely, Allah is Powerful <i>and</i> severe in punishing.
[8:54] This is because Allah would never change a favour that He has conferred upon a people until they change their own condition, and <i>know</i> that Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
[8:55] <i>Their case is</i> like the case of the people of Pharaoh and those before them: they rejected the Signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins. And We drowned the people of Pharaoh, for they were all wrongdoers.
[8:56] Surely, the worst of beasts in the sight of Allah are those who are ungrateful. So they will not believe, Footnote: Surely, the worst of <b>creatures</b> in the sight of Allah are those who are ungrateful. So they will not believe,
[8:57] Those with whom thou didst make a covenant; then they break their covenant every time, and they do not fear God.
[8:58] So, if thou catchest them in war, then by <i>routing</i> them strike fear in those that are behind them, that they may be admonished.
[8:59] And if thou fearest treachery from a people, throw back to them <i>their covenant</i> with equity. Surely, Allah loves not the treacherous.
[8:60] And let not those who disbelieve think that they have outstripped <i>Us</i>. Surely, they cannot frustrate <i>God’s purpose.</i>
[8:61] And make ready for them whatever you can of <i>armed</i> force and of mounted pickets at the frontier, whereby you may frighten the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you know not, <i>but</i> Allah knows them. And whatever you spend in the way of Allah, it shall be repaid to you in full and you shall not be wronged.
[8:62] And if they incline towards peace, incline thou also towards it, and put thy trust in Allah. Surely, it is He Who is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
[8:63] And if they intend to deceive thee, then surely Allah is sufficient for thee. He it is Who has strengthened thee with His help and with the believers;
[8:64] And He has put affection between their hearts. If thou hadst expended all that is in the earth, thou couldst not have put affection between their hearts, but Allah has put affection between them. Surely, He is Mighty, Wise.
[8:65] O Prophet, Allah is sufficient for thee and for those who follow thee of the believers.
[8:66] O Prophet, urge the believers to fight. If there be of you twenty who are steadfast, they shall overcome two hundred; and if there be a hundred of you, they shall overcome a thousand of those who disbelieve, because they are a people who do not understand.
[8:67] For the present Allah has lightened your burden, for He knows that there is weakness in you. So, if there be a hundred of you who are steadfast, they shall overcome two hundred; and if there be a thousand of you, they shall overcome two thousand by the command of Allah. And Allah is with those who are steadfast.
[8:68] It does not behove a Prophet that he should have captives until he engages in regular fighting in the land. You desire the goods of the world, while Allah desires <i>for you</i> the Hereafter. And Allah is Mighty, Wise.
[8:69] Had there not been a decree from Allah which had gone before, great distress would have surely overtaken you in <i>connection with that</i> which you took.
[8:70] So eat of that which you have won <i>in war</i> as lawful and good, and fear Allah. Surely, Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[8:71] O Prophet, say to the captives who are in your hands, ‘If Allah knows any good in your hearts, He will give you better than that which has been taken from you, and will forgive you. And Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.’
[8:72] And if they intend to deal treacherously with thee, they have already dealt treacherously with Allah before, but He gave <i>thee</i> power over them. And Allah is All- Knowing, Wise. Footnote: <b>And if they intend to betray your trust, they have already betrayed the trust of Allah before. So He rendered them powerless.</b> and Allah is All-Knowing, Wise.
[8:73] Surely, those who have believed and fled from their homes and striven with their property and their persons for the cause of Allah, and those who have given <i>them</i> shelter and help — these are friends one of another. But as for those who have believed but have not left their homes, you are not at all responsible for their protection until they leave their homes. But if they seek your help in <i>the matter of</i> religion, then it is your duty to help them, except against a people between whom and yourselves there is a treaty. And Allah sees what you do. Footnote: Surely, those who have believed and <b>left their homes</b> and striven with their property and their persons for the cause of Allah, and those who have given <i>them</i> shelter and help – <b>are indeed mutual friends</b>.
[8:74] And those who disbelieve — they are friends one of another. If you do it not, there will be mischief in the land and great disorder.
[8:75] And those who have believed and left their homes and striven for the cause of Allah, and those who have given <i>them</i> shelter and help — these indeed are true believers. For them is forgiveness and an honourable provision.
[8:76] And those who have believed since then and left their homes and striven <i>for the cause of Allah</i> along with you — these are of you; and <i>as to</i> blood relations, they are nearer one to another in the Book of Allah. Surely, Allah knows all things well.
[9:1] <i>This is</i> a declaration of <i>complete</i> absolution on the part of Allah and His Messenger <i>from all obligation</i> to the idolaters with whom you had made promises.
[9:2] So go about in the land for four months, and know that you cannot frustrate <i>the plan of</i> Allah and that Allah will humiliate the disbelievers.
[9:3] And <i>this is</i> a proclamation from Allah and His Messenger to the people on the day of the Greater Pilgrimage, that Allah is clear of the idolaters, and so is His Messenger. So if you repent, it will be better for you; but if you turn away, then know that you cannot frustrate <i>the plan of</i> Allah. And give tidings of a painful punishment to those who disbelieve, Footnote: that Allah is <b>absolved</b> of the idolaters, and so is His Messenger.
[9:4] Excepting those of the idolaters with whom you have entered into a treaty and who have not <i>subsequently</i> failed you in anything nor aided anyone against you. So fulfil to these the treaty <i>you have</i> made with them till their term. Surely, Allah loves those who are righteous. Footnote: and who have not <b>fallen short of fulfilling their obligations to you</b> nor aided anyone against you.
[9:5] And when the forbidden months have passed, kill the idolaters wherever you find them and take them <i>prisoners</i>, and beleaguer them, and lie in wait for them at every place of ambush. But if they repent and observe Prayer and pay the Zakat, then leave their way <i>free</i>. Surely, Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful. Footnote: And when the <b>consecrated</b> months have passed,
[9:6] And if anyone of the idolaters ask protection of thee, grant him protection so that he may hear the word of Allah; then convey him to his place of security. That is because they are a people who have no knowledge.
[9:7] How can there be a treaty of <i>these</i> idolaters with Allah and His Messenger, except those with whom you entered into a treaty at the Sacred Mosque? So, as long as they stand true to you, stand true to them. Surely, Allah loves those who are righteous.
[9:8] How <i>can it be</i> when, if they prevail against you, they would not observe any tie of relationship or covenant in respect of you? They would please you with their mouths, while their hearts refuse, and most of them are perfidious.
[9:9] They barter the Signs of Allah for a paltry price and turn <i>men</i> away from His way. Evil indeed is that which they do.
[9:10] They observe not any tie of relationship or covenant in respect of anyone who trusts <i>them</i>. And it is they who are transgressors.
[9:11] But if they repent and observe Prayer and pay the Zakat, then they are your brethren in faith. And We explain the Signs for a people who have knowledge.
[9:12] And if they break their oaths after their covenant, and attack your religion, then fight <i>these</i> leaders of disbelief — surely, they have no regard for their oaths — that they may desist. Footnote: and <b>revile</b> your religion,
[9:13] Will you not fight a people who have broken their oaths, and who plotted to turn out the Messenger, and they were the first to commence <i>hostilities</i> against you? Do you fear them? Nay, Allah is most worthy that you should fear Him, if you are believers.
[9:14] Fight them, that Allah may punish them at your hands, and humiliate them, and help you <i>to victory</i> over them, and relieve the minds of a people who believe;
[9:15] And that He may take away the wrath of their hearts. And Allah turns with mercy to whomsoever He pleases. And Allah is All-Knowing, Wise.
[9:16] Do you think that you would be left alone, while Allah has not yet known those of you who strive <i>in the cause of Allah</i> and do not take <i>anyone</i> for an intimate friend beside Allah and His Messenger and the believers? Allah is well aware of what you do.
[9:17] The idolaters cannot keep the Mosques of Allah in a good and flourishing condition while they bear witness against themselves to disbelief. It is they whose works shall be vain, and in the Fire shall they abide. Footnote: <b>It is not for the idolaters to do justice to the purposes for which the mosques are built for Allah and to maintain them accordingly while they stand witness to their own disbelief.</b>
[9:18] He alone can keep the Mosques of Allah in a good and flourishing condition who believes in Allah, and the Last Day, and observes Prayer, and pays the Zakat, and fears none but Allah; so these it is who may be among those who reach the goal. Footnote: <b>Verily, he alone is worthy of maintaining the Mosques of Allah who</b> believes in Allah, and the Last Day, and observes Prayer, and pays Zakat, and fears none but Allah; so these it is who <b>are far more likely to be <i>counted</i> among the guided</b>.
[9:19] Do you hold the giving of drink to the pilgrims, and the maintenance of the Sacred Mosque as <i>equal to the works of</i> him who believes in Allah and the Last Day and strives in the path of Allah? They are not <i>at all</i> equal in the sight of Allah. And Allah guides not the unjust people.
[9:20] Those who believe and emigrate <i>from their homes for the sake of God</i> and strive in the cause of Allah with their property and their persons have the highest rank in the sight of Allah. And it is they who shall triumph.
[9:21] Their Lord gives them glad tidings of mercy from Him, and of <i>His</i> pleasure, and of Gardens wherein there shall be lasting bliss for them;
[9:22] They will abide therein for ever. Verily, with Allah there is a great reward.
[9:23] O ye who believe! take not your fathers and your brothers for friends, if they prefer disbelief to faith. And whoso befriends them from among you, it is they that are wrongdoers.
[9:24] Say, if your fathers, and your sons, and your brethren, and your wives, and your kinsfolk, and the wealth you have acquired, and the trade whose dullness you fear, and the dwellings which you love are dearer to you than Allah and His Messenger and striving in His cause, then wait until Allah comes with His judgment; and Allah guides not the disobedient people.
[9:25] Surely, Allah had helped you on many a battlefield, and on the Day of Hunain, when your great numbers made you proud, but they availed you nought; and the earth, with <i>all</i> its vastness, became straitened for you, <i>and</i> then you turned your backs retreating.
[9:26] Then Allah sent down His peace upon His Messenger and upon the believers, and He sent down hosts which you did not see, and He punished those who disbelieved. And this is the reward of the disbelievers. Footnote: Then Allah <b>caused tranquility to descend upon</b> His Messenger and upon the believers.
[9:27] Then will Allah, after that, turn with compassion to whomsoever He pleases; and Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[9:28] O ye who believe! surely, the idolaters are unclean. So they shall not approach the Sacred Mosque after this year of theirs. And if you fear poverty, Allah will enrich you out of His bounty, if He pleases. Surely, Allah is All-Knowing, Wise.
[9:29] Fight those from among the People of the Book who believe not in Allah, nor in the Last Day, nor hold as unlawful what Allah and His Messenger have declared to be unlawful, nor follow the true religion, until they pay the tax with <i>their own</i> hand and acknowledge their subjection. Footnote: until they pay the tax with <i>their own</i> hand <i><b>submissively</b></i> and acknowledge their subjection.
[9:30] And the Jews say, Ezra is the son of Allah, and the Christians say, the Messiah is the son of Allah; that is what they say with their mouths. They imitate the saying of those who disbelieved before them. Allah’s curse be on them! How are they turned away! Footnote: <b>they are but a word of their mouths.</b>
[9:31] They have taken their learned men and their monks for lords beside Allah. And <i>so have they taken</i> the Messiah, son of Mary. And they were not commanded but to worship the One God. There is no God but He. Too Holy is He for what they associate <i>with Him</i>!
[9:32] They desire to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths; but Allah will permit nothing except that He will perfect His light, though the disbelievers may dislike <i>it</i>.
[9:33] He it is Who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, that He may make it prevail over every <i>other</i> religion, even though the idolaters may dislike <i>it.</i>
[9:34] O ye who believe! surely, many of the priests and monks devour the wealth of men by false means and turn <i>men</i> away from the way of Allah. And those who hoard up gold and silver and spend it not in the way of Allah — give to them the tidings of a painful punishment,
[9:35] On the day when it shall be made hot in the fire of Hell, and their foreheads and their sides and their backs shall be branded therewith <i>and it shall be said to them</i>: ‘This is what you treasured up for yourselves; so now taste what you used to treasure up.’
[9:36] The reckoning of months with Allah has been twelve months by Allah’s ordinance since the day when He created the heavens and the earth. Of these, four are sacred. That is the right creed. So wrong not yourselves therein. And fight the idolaters all together as they fight you all together; and know that Allah is with the righteous. Footnote: <b>This is the religion that stays.</b>
[9:37] Surely, the postponement <i>of a Sacred Month</i> is an addition to disbelief. Those who disbelieve are led astray thereby. They allow it one year and forbid it another year, that they may agree in the number of <i>the months</i> which Allah has made sacred, and thus may make lawful what Allah has forbidden. The evil of their deeds is made <i>to seem</i> fair to them. And Allah guides not the disbelieving people.
[9:38] O ye who believe! what is the matter with you that, when it is said to you, go forth in the way of Allah, you sink heavily towards the earth? Would you be contented with the present life in preference to the Hereafter? But the enjoyment of the present life is but little, as compared with the Hereafter. Footnote: <b>The gains of the present life will but seem small and insignificant in the Hereafter.</b>
[9:39] If you do not go forth <i>to fight</i>, He will punish you with a painful punishment, and will choose in your stead a people other than you, and you shall do Him no harm at all. And Allah has full power over all things.
[9:40] If you help him not, then <i>know that</i> Allah helped him <i>even</i> when the disbelievers drove him forth while he was one of the two when they were both in the cave, when he said to his companion, ‘Grieve not, for Allah is with us.’ Then Allah sent down His peace on him, and strengthened him with hosts which you did not see, and humbled the word of those who disbelieved, and it is the word of Allah alone which is supreme. And Allah is Mighty, Wise.
[9:41] Go forth, light and heavy, and strive with your property and your persons in the cause of Allah. That is better for you, if only you knew.
[9:42] If it had been an immediate gain and a short journey, they would certainly have followed thee, but the hard journey seemed too long to them. Yet they will swear by Allah, <i>saying</i>, ‘If we had been able, we would surely have gone forth with you.’ They ruin their souls; and Allah knows that they are liars.
[9:43] Allah remove thy <i>cares</i>. Why didst thou permit them <i>to stay behind</i> until those who spoke the truth had become known to thee and <i>until</i> thou hadst known the liars?
[9:44] Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day will not ask leave of thee <i>to be exempted</i> from striving with their property and their persons. And Allah well knows the righteous.
[9:45] Only those will ask leave of thee <i>to be exempted</i> who do not believe in Allah and the Last Day, and whose hearts are full of doubt, and in their doubt they waver.
[9:46] And if they had intended to go forth they would certainly have made some preparation for it; but Allah was averse to their marching forth. So He kept them back, and it was said: ‘Sit ye <i>at home</i> with those who sit.’
[9:47] If they had gone forth with you, they would have added to you nothing but trouble, and would have hurried to and fro in your midst, seeking <i>to create</i> discord among you. And there are among you those who would listen to them. And Allah well knows the wrongdoers. Footnote: And there are among you those who <b>are wont to</b> listen to them.
[9:48] They sought <i>to create</i> disorder even before <i>this</i>, and they devised plots against thee till the truth came and the purpose of Allah prevailed, though they did not like <i>it.</i>
[9:49] And among them is he who says, ‘Permit me <i>to stay behind</i> and put me not to trial.’ Surely, they have already fallen into trial. And surely, Hell shall encompass the disbelievers.
[9:50] If good befall thee, it grieves them, but if a misfortune befall thee, they say, ‘We had indeed taken our precaution beforehand.’ And they turn away rejoicing.
[9:51] Say, ‘Nothing shall befall us save that which Allah has ordained for us. He is our Protector. And in Allah then should the believers put their trust.’
[9:52] Say, ‘You do not await for us anything except one of the two good things; while as regards you, we await that Allah will afflict you with a punishment either from Himself or at our hands. Wait then; we <i>also</i> are waiting with you.’
[9:53] Say, ‘Spend willingly or unwillingly, it shall not be accepted from you. You are indeed a disobedient people.’
[9:54] And nothing has deprived them of the acceptance of their contributions save that they disbelieve in Allah and His Messenger. And they come not to Prayer except lazily and they make no contribution save reluctantly.
[9:55] So let not their wealth nor their children excite thy wonder. Allah only intends to punish them therewith in the present life and that their souls may depart while they are disbelievers.
[9:56] And they swear by Allah that they are indeed of you, while they are not of you, but they are a people who are timorous.
[9:57] If they could find a place of refuge, or caves, or <i>even</i> a hole to enter, they would surely turn thereto, rushing uncontrollably.
[9:58] And among them are those who find fault with thee in <i>the matter of</i> alms. If they are given thereof, they are content; but if they are not given thereof, behold! they are discontented.
[9:59] Had they but been content with what Allah and His Messenger had given them and said, ‘Sufficient for us is Allah; Allah will give us of His bounty, and so will His Messenger; to Allah do we turn in supplication,’ <i>it would have been better for them</i>. Footnote: <b>‘Sufficient for us is Allah – and His Messenger; Surely Allah will bestow on us of His bounty;</b>
[9:60] The alms are only for the poor and the needy, and for those employed in connection therewith, and for those whose hearts are to be reconciled, and for the <i>freeing of</i> slaves, and for those in debt, and for the cause of Allah, and for the wayfarer — an ordinance from Allah. And Allah is All-Knowing, Wise.
[9:61] And among them are those who annoy the Prophet and say, ‘He <i>gives</i> ear <i>to all</i>.’ Say, ‘<i>His giving</i> ear <i>to all</i> is good for you; he believes in Allah and believes the Faithful, and is a mercy for those of you who believe.’ And those who annoy the Messenger of Allah shall have a grievous punishment. Footnote: And among them are those who <b>hurt the Prophet and say, ‘He is all ears</b>.’ Say, ‘<b>His disposition to listen <i>to all</i> is good for you</b>; he believes in Allah and <b>has trust in the believers</b>, and is a mercy for those of you who believe.’
[9:62] They swear by Allah to you to please you; but Allah and His Messenger are more worthy that they should please him <i>and God</i>, if they are believers.
[9:63] Have they not known that whoso opposes Allah and His Messenger, for him is the fire of Hell, wherein he shall abide? That is the great humiliation.
[9:64] The hypocrites fear lest a Surah should be revealed against them, informing them of what is in their hearts. Say, ‘Mock ye! surely, Allah will bring to light what you fear.’
[9:65] And if thou question them, they will most surely say, ‘We were only talking idly and jesting.’ Say, ‘Was it Allah and His Signs and His Messenger that you mocked at?
[9:66] ‘Offer no excuse. You have certainly disbelieved after your believing. If We forgive a party from among you, a party shall We punish, for they have been guilty.’
[9:67] The hypocrites, men and women, are <i>all connected</i> one with another. They enjoin evil and forbid good, and keep their hands closed. They neglected Allah, so He has neglected them. Surely, it is the hypocrites who are the disobedient.
[9:68] Allah promises the hypocrites, men and women, and the disbelievers the fire of Hell, wherein they shall abide. It will suffice them. And Allah has cursed them. And they shall have a lasting punishment,
[9:69] Even as those before you. They were mightier than you in power and richer in possessions and children. They enjoyed their lot for a short time, so have you enjoyed your lot as those before you enjoyed their lot. And you indulged in idle talk as they indulged in idle talk. It is they whose works shall be of no avail in this world and the Hereafter. And it is they who are the losers.
[9:70] Has not the story reached them of those before them — the people of Noah, ‘Ad, and Thamud, and the people of Abraham, and the dwellers of Midian, and the cities which were overthrown? Their Messengers came to them with clear Signs. So Allah would not wrong them, but they wronged themselves.
[9:71] And the believers, men and women, are friends one of another. They enjoin good and forbid evil and observe Prayer and pay the Zakat and obey Allah and His Messenger. It is these on whom Allah will have mercy. Surely, Allah is Mighty, Wise.
[9:72] Allah has promised to believers, men and women, Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide, and delightful dwelling places in Gardens of Eternity. And the pleasure of Allah is the greatest of all. That is the supreme triumph.
[9:73] O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites. And be severe to them. Their abode is Hell, and an evil destination it is.
[9:74] They swear by Allah that they said nothing, but they did certainly use blasphemous language, and disbelieved after they had embraced Islam. And they meditated that which they could not attain. And they cherished hatred only because Allah and His Messenger had enriched them out of His bounty. So if they repent, it will be better for them; but if they turn away, Allah will punish them with a grievous punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they shall have neither friend nor helper in the earth. Footnote: And they meditated <b>upon</b> that which they <b><i>subsequently</i> failed to attain.</b> And they <b>nourished</b> hatred only because Allah and His Messenger had enriched them out of His bounty. So if they repent, <b>it would</b> be better for them; but if they turn away, Allah will punish them with a grievous punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they shall have neither friend nor helper in the earth.
[9:75] And among them there are those who made a covenant with Allah, <i>saying</i>, ‘If He give us of His bounty, we would most surely give alms and be of the virtuous.’
[9:76] But when He gave them of His bounty, they became niggardly of it, and they turned away in aversion.
[9:77] So He requited them with hypocrisy <i>which shall last</i> in their hearts until the day when they shall meet Him, because they broke their promise to Allah, and because they lied.
[9:78] Know they not that Allah knows their secrets as well as their private counsels and that Allah is the Best Knower of all unseen things? Footnote: Know they not that Allah knows their secrets <b>and covert deliberations</b> and that Allah is the Best Knower of the unseen things?
[9:79] Those who find fault with such of the believers as give alms of their own free will and with such as find nothing <i>to give</i> save <i>the earnings of</i> their toil. They thus deride them. Allah shall requite them for their derision, and for them is a grievous punishment.
[9:80] Ask thou forgiveness for them, or ask thou not forgiveness for them; even if thou ask forgiveness for them seventy times, Allah will never forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger. And Allah guides not the perfidious people.
[9:81] Those who were left behind rejoiced in their sitting <i>at home</i> behind <i>the back of</i> the Messenger of Allah, and were averse to striving with their property and their persons in the cause of Allah. And they said, ‘Go not forth in the heat.’ Say, ‘The fire of Hell is more intense in heat.’ Could they but understand! Footnote: <b>Those <i>who constricted to be</i> left behind rejoiced at their staying back in contradiction to the Messenger of Allah</b>, and were averse to striving with their property and their persons in the cause of Allah.
[9:82] They must laugh little and weep much as a reward for that which they used to earn.
[9:83] And if Allah return thee to a party of them, and they ask of thee leave to go forth <i>to fight</i>, say then, ‘You shall never go forth with me and shall never fight an enemy with me. You chose to sit <i>at home</i> the first time, so sit now with those who remain behind.’
[9:84] And never pray thou for any of them that dies, nor stand by his grave; for they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger and died while they were disobedient. Footnote: <b>Never say prayer over any of them when he dies, nor stand by his grave <i>to pray</i></b>; for they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger and died while they were disobedient.
[9:85] And their possessions and their children should not excite thy wonder; Allah only intends to punish them therewith in this world and that their souls may depart while they are disbelievers.
[9:86] And when a Surah is revealed, <i>enjoining</i>, ‘Believe in Allah and strive <i>in the cause of Allah</i> in company with His Messenger,’ those of them who possess affluence ask leave of thee and say, ‘Leave us that we be with those who sit <i>at home</i>.’
[9:87] They are content to be with the womenfolk, and their hearts are sealed so that they understand not.
[9:88] But the Messenger and those who believe with him strive <i>in the cause of Allah</i> with their property and their persons, and it is they who shall have good things, and it is they who shall prosper.
[9:89] Allah has prepared for them Gardens underneath which flow rivers; therein they shall abide. That is the supreme triumph.
[9:90] And those who make excuses from among the desert Arabs, came that exemption might be granted them. And those who were false to Allah and His Messenger stayed <i>at home</i>. A grievous punishment shall befall those of them who disbelieve.
[9:91] No blame lies on the weak, nor on the sick, nor on those who find naught to spend, if they are sincere to Allah and His Messenger. There is no cause of reproach against those who do good deeds; and Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[9:92] Nor against those to whom, when they came to thee that thou shouldst mount them, thou didst say, ‘I cannot find whereon I can mount you;’ they turned back, their eyes overflowing with tears, out of grief that they could not find what they might spend.
[9:93] The cause of reproach is only against those who ask leave of thee, while they are rich. They are content to be with the womenfolk. And Allah has set a seal upon their hearts so that they know not.
[9:94] They will make excuses to you when you return to them. Say, ‘Make no excuses; we will not believe you. Allah has already informed us of the facts about you. And Allah will observe your conduct, and <i>also</i> His Messenger; then you will be brought back to Him Who knows the unseen and the seen, and He will tell you all that you used to do.’
[9:95] They will swear to you by Allah, when you return to them, that you may leave them alone. So leave them alone. Surely, they are an abomination, and their abode is Hell — a <i>fit</i> recompense for that which they used to earn. Footnote: Surely, they are <b>foul</b>,
[9:96] They will swear to you that you may be pleased with them. But <i>even</i> if you be pleased with them, Allah will not be pleased with the rebellious people.
[9:97] The Arabs of the desert are the worst in disbelief and hypocrisy, and most apt not to know the ordinances <i>of the Revelation</i> which Allah has sent down to His Messenger. And Allah is All-Knowing, Wise.
[9:98] And among the Arabs of the desert are those who regard that which they spend <i>for God</i> as a fine and they wait for calamities to <i>befall</i> you. On themselves shall fall an evil calamity. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. Footnote: And among the <b>Bedouin there</b> are those who <b>consider what they spend <i>in the cause of Allah</i> a penalty and <i>wishfully</i> await calamities</b> to <i>befall</i> you. <b>Let evil befall them instead.</b>
[9:99] And among the Arabs of the desert are those who believe in Allah and the Last Day and regard that which they spend as means of drawing near to Allah and <i>of receiving</i> the blessings of the Prophet. Aye! it is for them certainly a means of drawing near <i>to God</i>. Allah will soon admit them to His mercy. Surely, Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[9:100] And <i>as for</i> the foremost <i>among the believers</i>, the first of the Emigrants and the Helpers, and those who followed them in the best possible manner, Allah is well pleased with them and they are well pleased with Him; and He has prepared for them Gardens beneath which flow rivers. They will abide therein for ever. That is the supreme triumph. Footnote: from Mecca. In Medina. Footnote: and those who follow them <b>excellently</b>, Allah is well pleased with them and they are well pleased with Him;
[9:101] And of the desert Arabs around you <i>some</i> are hypocrites; and of the people of Medina <i>also</i>. They persist in hypocrisy. Thou knowest them not; We know them. We will punish them twice; then shall they be given over to a great punishment.
[9:102] And <i>there are</i> others who have acknowledged their faults. They mixed a good work with another <i>that was</i> evil. It may be that Allah will turn to them with compassion. Surely, Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[9:103] Take alms out of their wealth, so that thou mayest cleanse them and purify them thereby. And pray for them; thy prayer is indeed a <i>source of</i> tranquillity for them. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
[9:104] Know they not that Allah is He Who accepts repentance from His servants and takes alms, and that Allah is He Who is Oft-Returning <i>with compassion</i>, <i>and is</i> Merciful? Footnote: <b>and acknowledges alms</b>, and that Allah is He Who is Oft-Returning <i>with compassion, and is</i> Merciful.
[9:105] And say, ‘Work, and Allah will surely see your work and <i>also</i> His Messenger and the believers. And you shall be brought back to Him Who knows the unseen and the seen; then He will tell you what you used to do.’ Footnote: And say, ‘<b>Do what you may, surely, Allah will watch your acts, so also will His Messenger and the believers. And you shall be made to return to the Knower of the unseen and the seen</b>; then He will tell you what you used to do.’
[9:106] And <i>there are</i> others <i>whose</i> case has been postponed for the decree of Allah. He may punish them or He may turn to them with compassion. And Allah is All- Knowing, Wise. Footnote: And <i>there are</i> others <b>who are kept awaiting</b> the decree of Allah. He <b>may decide to</b> punish them or He may turn to them with compassion.
[9:107] And <i>among the hypocrites are</i> those who have built a mosque in order to injure <i>Islam</i> and <i>help</i> disbelief and cause a division among the believers, and prepare an ambush for him who warred against Allah and His Messenger before <i>this</i>. And they will surely swear: ‘We meant nothing but good;’ but Allah bears witness that they are certainly liars. Footnote: And <i>among the hypocrites are</i> those who have built a mosque in order to injure <i>Islam</i> and <i>help</i> disbelief and <b>cause division among the believers, and to provide a place of hiding for those who have already waged war against Allah and His Messenger.</b>
[9:108] Never stand <i>to pray</i> therein. A mosque which was founded upon piety from the <i>very</i> first day is surely more worthy that thou shouldst stand <i>to pray</i> therein. In it are men who love to become purified, and Allah loves those who purify themselves.
[9:109] Is he, then, who founded his building on fear of Allah and His pleasure better or he who founded his building on the brink of a tottering water-worn bank which tumbled down with him into the fire of Hell? And Allah guides not the wrongdoing people. Footnote: Is he, then, who <b>laid his foundation</b> on fear of Allah and His pleasure better or he who <b>laid his foundation</b> on the brink of a tottering water-torn bank which tumbled down with him into the fire of Hell? And Allah <b>does not guide a people who transgress.</b>
[9:110] <i>This</i> building of theirs, which they have built, will ever continue to be a <i>source of</i> disquiet in their hearts, unless their hearts be torn to pieces. And Allah is All-Knowing, Wise. Footnote: <i>This</i> building of theirs, <b>they have raised,</b> will ever be a <i>source of</i> disquiet <b>and uncertainty in their hearts, until their hearts split and are torn into pieces.</b> And Allah is All-Knowing, Wise.
[9:111] Surely, Allah has purchased of the believers their persons and their property in return for the Garden they shall have; they fight in the cause of Allah, and they slay and are slain — a promise <i>that He has made</i> incumbent on Himself in the Torah, and the Gospel, and the Qur’an. And who is more faithful to his promise than Allah? Rejoice, then, in your bargain which you have made with Him; and that it is which is the supreme triumph. Footnote: …in return for <b>the Paradise</b> they shall have;
[9:112] <i>They are</i> the ones who turn <i>to God in repentance</i>, who worship <i>Him</i>, who praise <i>Him</i>, who go about in the land <i>serving Him</i>, who bow down <i>to God</i>, who prostrate themselves <i>in prayer</i>, who enjoin good and forbid evil, and who watch the limits <i>set</i> by Allah. And give glad tidings to those who believe.
[9:113] It is not for the Prophet and those who believe that they should ask <i>of God</i> forgiveness for the idolaters, even though they may be kinsmen, after it has become plain to them that they are the people of Hell.
[9:114] And Abraham’s asking forgiveness for his father was only because of a promise he had made to him, but when it became clear to him that he was an enemy to Allah, he dissociated himself from him. Surely, Abraham was most tender-hearted, forbearing.
[9:115] And it is not for Allah to cause a people to go astray after He has guided them until He makes clear to them that which they ought to guard against. Surely, Allah knows all things full well.
[9:116] Surely, it is Allah to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and causes death. And you have no friend nor helper beside Allah.
[9:117] Allah has certainly turned with mercy to the Prophet and <i>to</i> the Emigrants and the Helpers who followed him in the hour of distress after the hearts of a party of them had well-nigh swerved. He again turned to them with mercy. Surely, He is to them Compassionate, Merciful.
[9:118] And <i>He has turned with mercy</i> to the three whose <i>case</i> was deferred, until the earth became too strait for them with <i>all</i> its vastness, and their souls were <i>also</i> straitened for them, and they became convinced that there was no refuge from Allah save unto Himself. Then He turned to them with mercy that they might turn <i>to Him</i>. Surely, it is Allah Who is Oft-Returning <i>with compassion and is</i> Merciful. Footnote: <b>And the three <i>who remained</i> behind, until the earth seemed too narrow for them despite <i>all</i> its vastness,</b>
[9:119] O ye who believe! fear Allah and be with the truthful.
[9:120] It was not proper for the people of Medina and those around them from among the Arabs of the desert that they should have remained behind the Messenger of Allah or that they should have preferred their own lives to his. That is because there distresses them neither thirst nor fatigue nor hunger in the way of Allah, nor do they tread a track which enrages the disbelievers, nor do they cause an enemy any injury whatsoever, but there is written down for them a good work on account of it. Surely, Allah suffers not the reward of those who do good to be lost. Footnote: …nor do they <b>gain an advantage over the enemy,</b>
[9:121] And they spend not any sum, small or great, nor do they traverse a valley, but it is written down for them, that Allah may give them the best reward for what they did.
[9:122] It is not possible for the believers to go forth all together. Why, then, does not a party from every section of them go forth that they may become well versed in religion, and that they may warn their people when they return to them, so that they may guard <i>against evil</i>? Footnote: …that they may <b>gain better understanding of religion,</b>
[9:123] O ye who believe! fight such of the disbelievers as are near to you and let them find hardness in you; and know that Allah is with the righteous. Footnote: …let them find <b>uncompromising firmness</b> in you;
[9:124] And whenever a Surah is sent down, there are some of them who say: ‘Which of you has this <i>Surah</i> increased in faith?’ But, as to those who believe, it increases their faith and they rejoice.
[9:125] But as for those in whose hearts is a disease, it adds <i>further</i> filth to their <i>present</i> filth, and they die while they are disbelievers.
[9:126] Do they not see that they are tried every year once or twice? Yet they do not repent, nor would they be admonished. Footnote: Do they not see that they are <b>put to trial</b> every year, once or twice?
[9:127] And whenever a Surah is sent down, they look at one another, <i>saying,</i> ‘Does any one see you?’ Then they turn away. Allah has turned away their hearts because they are a people who would not understand.
[9:128] Surely, a Messenger has come unto you from among yourselves; grievous to him is that you should fall into trouble; <i>he is</i> ardently desirous of your <i>welfare</i>; <i>and</i> to the believers <i>he is</i> compassionate, merciful.
[9:129] But if they turn away, say, ‘Allah is sufficient for me. There is no God but He. In Him do I put my trust, and He is the Lord of the mighty Throne.
[10:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[10:2] Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the Book that is full of wisdom. Footnote: I am Allah Who is All-Seeing.
[10:3] Is it a <i>matter of</i> wonder for men that We have inspired a man from among them, <i>saying</i>, ‘Warn mankind and give glad tidings to those who believe that they have a true rank <i>of honour</i> with their Lord?’ The disbelievers say, ‘Surely, this is a manifest enchanter.’ Footnote: Is it a <i>matter of</i> wonder for <b>people</b> that We have sent down revelation to a man from among them <i>saying</i>, ‘Warn mankind and give glad tidings to those who believe that <b>for them there is a station of truth</b> with their Lord.’
[10:4] Verily, your Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth in six periods, then He settled Himself on the Throne; He governs everything. There is no intercessor <i>with Him</i> save after His permission. That is Allah, your Lord, so worship Him. Will you not, then, be admonished? Footnote: he <b>regulates</b> everything.
[10:5] To Him shall you all return. The promise of Allah is true. Surely, He originates the creation; then He reproduces it, that He may reward those who believe and do good works, with equity; and <i>as for</i> those who disbelieve, they shall have a drink of boiling water, and a painful punishment, because they disbelieved.
[10:6] He it is Who made the sun <i>radiate</i> a brilliant light and the moon <i>reflect</i> a lustre, and ordained for it stages, that you might know the number of years and the reckoning <i>of time</i>. Allah has not created this but in truth. He details the Signs for a people who have knowledge. Footnote: He it is Who made the sun <b>radiant and the moon lambent,</b>
[10:7] Verily, in the alternation of night and day, and in all that Allah has created in the heavens and the earth there are Signs for a God-fearing people.
[10:8] Those who look not for the meeting with Us and are content with the life of this world and feel at rest therewith, and those who are heedless of Our Signs — 
[10:9] It is these whose abode in Fire, because of what they earned.
[10:10] But <i>as for</i> those who believe, and do good works — their Lord will guide them because of their faith. Rivers shall flow beneath them in the Gardens of Bliss.
[10:11] Their prayer therein shall be, ‘Glory be to Thee, O Allah!’ and their greeting therein shall be, ‘Peace.’ And the conclusion of their prayer shall be, ‘All praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.’
[10:12] And if Allah were to hasten for men the ill <i>they have earned</i> as they would hasten on the <i>acquisition of</i> wealth, <i>the end of</i> their term <i>of life</i> would have been already brought upon them. But We leave those who look not for the meeting with Us to wander distractedly in their transgression.
[10:13] And when trouble befalls a man, he calls on Us, lying on his side, or sitting, or standing; but when We have removed his trouble from him, he goes his way as though he had never called on Us for the <i>removal of the</i> trouble that befell him. Thus it is that the doings of the extravagant are given a fair appearance in their eyes. Footnote: And when <b>affliction</b> befalls a man, he calls on Us, lying on his side, or sitting, or standing; but when <b>We relieve him of his distress, he walks away as if he had never beseeched Us to attend to the misery afflicting him.</b>
[10:14] And We destroyed the generations before you when they did wrong; and there came to them their Messengers with clear Signs, but they would not believe. Thus do We requite the guilty people. Footnote: And we destroyed <b>many a generation before you when they transgressed, while Messengers had come to them <i>before that</i> with manifest Signs,</b> but they would not believe.
[10:15] Then, We made you <i>their</i> successors in the earth after them, that We might see how you would act.
[10:16] And when Our clear Signs are recited unto them, those who look not for the meeting with Us say, ‘Bring a Qur’an other than this or change it.’ Say, ‘It is not for me to change it of my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed, I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of an awful day.’ Footnote: …the punishment of an <b>Enormous</b> Day.
[10:17] Say, ‘If Allah had <i>so</i> willed, I should not have recited it to you nor would He have made it known to you. I have indeed lived among you a <i>whole</i> lifetime before this. Will you not then understand?’
[10:18] Who is then more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah or <i>he</i> who treats His Signs as lies? Surely, the guilty shall never prosper. Footnote: Who <b>violates justice more blatantly than the one</b> who forges a lie against Allah or <i>he</i> who treats His Signs as lies?
[10:19] And they worship, instead of Allah, that which neither harms them nor profits them; and they say, ‘These are our intercessors with Allah.’ Say, ‘Would you inform Allah of something He knows not in the heavens or in the earth?’ Holy is He, and high exalted above <i>all</i> that which they associate <i>with Him</i>. Footnote: <b>Glorious is He, exalted far above that</b> which they associate <i>with Him</i>.
[10:20] And mankind were but one community, then they differed <i>among themselves</i>; and had it not been for a word that had gone before from thy Lord, it would have <i>already</i> been judged between them concerning that in which they differed. Footnote: And mankind were but one community, then they differed; and had it not been for a word <b>gone before from your Lord, their fate would have been sealed in accordance with all they differed therein.</b>
[10:21] And they say, ‘Why has not a Sign been sent down to him from his Lord?’ Say, ‘The unseen belongs only to Allah. So wait; I am with you among those who wait.’ Footnote: Say, ‘<b>To Allah belongs the unseen. Wait therefore;</b> I am with you among those who wait.’
[10:22] And when We make people taste of mercy after adversity has touched them, behold, they begin to plan against Our Signs. Say, ‘Allah is swifter in planning.’ Surely, Our messengers write down all that you plan. Footnote: <b>The moment We give a taste of mercy to a people stricken by calamity, they begin to plot against Our Signs forthwith. Say, ‘Swifter is Allah in planning.’ Surely, Our messengers maintain a record of what you plan.</b>
[10:23] He it is Who enables you to journey through land and sea until, when you are on <i>board</i> the ships and they sail with them with a fair breeze and they rejoice in it, there overtakes them (the ships) a violent wind and the waves come on them from every side and they think they are encompassed, <i>then</i> they call upon Allah, purifying <i>their</i> religion for Him, <i>saying</i>, ‘If Thou deliver us from this, we will surely be of the thankful.’ Footnote: …there overtakes them <b>a ferocious wind</b> and the waves come on them from every side and they think they are encompassed, <i>then</i> they call upon Allah, <b>promising sincerity of faith for Him,</b> <i>saying</i>; ‘If Thou deliver us from this, we will surely be of the thankful.’
[10:24] But when He has delivered them, lo! they begin to commit excesses in the earth wrongfully. O ye men, your excesses are only against your own selves. <i>Have</i> the enjoyment of the present life. Then to Us shall be your return; and We will inform you of what you used to do. Footnote: O ye men, your excesses are only against your own selves – <b>a mere enjoyment of the present life.</b> Then to Us shall be your return; and We will inform you of what you used to do.
[10:25] The likeness of the present life is only as water which We send down from the clouds, then there mingles with it the produce of the earth, of which men and cattle eat till, when the earth receives its ornature and looks beautiful and its owners think that they have power over it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day and We render it a field that is mown down, as if nothing had existed there the day before. Thus do We expound the Signs for a people who reflect. Footnote: <b>The example of life on earth is like that of water that We cause to descend from heaven. Then with it mingles the vegetation of the earth of which both the people and the cattle partake. It continues to be so until the earth blossoms forth in full bloom and ripens into loveliness – then while those who possess it deem themselves supreme over it, there suddenly descends Our decree at night or during the day. Then We render it a field that is mown down as if it had not existed the day before.</b> Thus do We expound the Signs for a people who reflect.
[10:26] And Allah calls to the abode of peace, and guides whom He pleases to the straight path.
[10:27] For those who do good deeds, there shall be the best <i>reward</i> and <i>yet</i> more <i>blessings</i>. And neither darkness nor ignominy shall cover their faces. It is these who are the inmates of Heaven; therein shall they abide.
[10:28] And <i>as for</i> those who do evil deeds, the punishment of an evil shall be the like thereof, and ignominy shall cover them. They shall have none to protect them against Allah. <i>And they shall look</i> as if their faces had been covered with dark patches of night. It is these who are the inmates of the Fire; therein shall they abide.
[10:29] And <i>remember</i> the day when We shall gather them all together, then shall We say to those who ascribed partners <i>to God</i>, “<i>Stand back in</i> your places, you and your ‘partners’”. Then We shall separate them widely, one from another, and their ‘partners’ will say: ‘It was not us that you worshipped. Footnote: <b>Beware of</b> the day when We shall gather them all together, then shall We say to those who ascribed partners <i>to God</i>, ‘<b>Stay put where you are – you and your associate gods.’ Then shall We separate them; and those whom they had considered partners will say, ‘It is not we whom you worshipped.’</b>
[10:30] ‘So Allah is <i>now</i> sufficient as a Witness between us and you. We were certainly unaware of your worship.’ Footnote: <b>‘So Allah is sufficient Witness between you and us. We were absolutely unaware of your devotion.’</b>
[10:31] There shall every soul realize what it shall have sent on before. And they shall be brought back to Allah, their true Master, and all that they used to forge shall be lost to them.
[10:32] Say, ‘Who provides sustenance for you from the heaven and the earth? Or who is it that has power over the ears and the eyes? And who brings forth the living from the dead and brings the dead out of the living? And who governs all affairs?’ They will say, ‘Allah’. Then say, ‘Will you not then seek <i>His</i> protection?’ Footnote: Then say, ‘Will you not then <b>desist <i>from your wrong pursuits</i>?’</b>
[10:33] Such is Allah, your true Lord. So what <i>would you have</i> after <i>discarding</i> the truth except error? How then are you being turned away <i>from the truth</i>? Footnote: Such is Allah, your true Lord. So what <b>is left after truth but manifest error?</b>
[10:34] Thus is the word of thy Lord proved true against those who rebel, that they believe not.
[10:35] Say, ‘Is there any of your associate- gods who originates creation and then reproduces it?’ Say, ‘It is Allah <i>alone</i> Who originates creation and then reproduces it. Whither then are you turned away?’ Footnote: Say, ‘Is there <b>one among your associates who originates creation then repeats it?’</b> Say, ‘It is Allah <i>alone</i> Who <b>initiates creation and then repeats it. How could you then be led astray?’</b>
[10:36] Say, ‘Is there any of your associate- gods who leads to the truth?’ Say, ‘It is Allah Who leads to the truth. Is then He Who leads to the truth more worthy to be followed or he who finds not the way <i>himself</i> unless he be guided? What, then, is the matter with you? How judge ye?’
[10:37] And most of them follow nothing but conjecture. Surely, conjecture avails nothing against truth. Verily, Allah is well aware of what they do. Footnote: Surely, conjecture <b>cannot substitute truth in the least.</b>
[10:38] And this Qur’an is not such as might be devised by any one except Allah. On the contrary, it fulfils that which is before it and is an exposition of the Law <i>of God</i>. There is no doubt about it. <i>It is</i> from the Lord of the worlds.
[10:39] Do they say, ‘He has forged it?’ Say, ‘Bring then a Surah like unto it, and call for help on all you can besides Allah, if you are truthful.’
[10:40] Nay, but they have rejected that the knowledge of which they did not encompass nor has the <i>true</i> significance thereof yet come to them. In like manner did those before them reject <i>the truth</i>. But see what was the end of those who did wrong!
[10:41] And of them there are <i>some</i> who believe therein, and of them there are <i>others</i> who do not believe therein, and thy Lord well knows those who act corruptly. Footnote: and <b>your Lord knows best those who provoke disorder.</b>
[10:42] And if they accuse thee of lying, say, ‘For me is my work and for you is your work. You are not responsible for what I do and I am not responsible for what you do.’ Footnote: And if they accuse <b>you</b> of lying, say, <b>‘I am accountable for my actions and you for yours.</b>
[10:43] And among them are <i>some</i> who give ear to thee. But canst thou make the deaf hear, even though they understand not?
[10:44] And among them are <i>some</i> who look towards thee. But canst thou guide the blind, even though they see not?
[10:45] Certainly, Allah wrongs not men at all, but men wrong their own souls.
[10:46] And on the day when He will gather them together, <i>it will appear to them</i> as though they had not tarried in the world save for an hour of a day. They will recognize one another. Losers indeed are those who deny the meeting with Allah and would not follow guidance. Footnote: …and would <b>not be guided.</b>
[10:47] And if We show thee <i>in thy lifetime the fulfilment of</i> some of the things with which We have threatened them, <i>thou wilt know it</i>; or if We cause thee to die <i>before that</i>, then to Us is their return, <i>and thou wilt see the fulfilment in the next world</i>; and Allah is Witness to all that they do. Footnote: <b>And if We make you witness a part of what We promised them or cause you to die <i>before that</i>, to Us shall be their return; then will Allah stand witness against what they do.</b>
[10:48] And for every people there is a Messenger. So when their Messenger comes, it is judged between them with equity, and they are not wronged.
[10:49] And they say, ‘When will this promise be <i>fulfilled</i>, if you are truthful?’
[10:50] Say, ‘I have no power for myself over any harm or benefit, save that which Allah wills. For every <i>disbelieving</i> people there is an appointed term. When their term is come, they cannot remain behind a single moment, nor can they get ahead <i>of it</i>.’
[10:51] Say, ‘Tell me, if His punishment comes upon you by night or by day, how will the guilty run away from it? Footnote: …how <b>could the guilty escape it however hastily</b>?
[10:52] ‘Is it then when it has befallen you that you will believe in it? What! Now! And <i>before this</i> you used to demand its speedy coming?’
[10:53] Then will it be said to those who did wrong, ‘Taste ye the abiding punishment. You are not requited save for that which you used to earn.’
[10:54] And they enquire of thee, ‘Is it true?’ Say, ‘Yea, by my Lord! It is most surely true; and you cannot frustrate <i>it</i>.’
[10:55] And if every soul that does wrong possessed all that is in the earth, it would surely offer to ransom <i>itself</i> therewith. And they will conceal <i>their</i> remorse when they see the punishment. And judgment shall be passed between them with equity, and they shall not be wronged.
[10:56] Know ye! to Allah, surely, belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Know ye, that Allah’s promise is surely true! But most of them understand not. Footnote: <b>Lo!</b> To Allah, surely, belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. <b>Lo! Verily, the promise of Allah is true. But most of them know not.</b>
[10:57] He it is Who gives life and causes death, and to Him shall you be brought back.
[10:58] O mankind! there has indeed come to you an exhortation from your Lord and a cure for whatever <i>disease</i> there is in the hearts, and a guidance and a mercy to the believers.
[10:59] Say, ‘<i>All this is</i> through the grace of Allah and through His mercy; therein, therefore, let them rejoice. That is better than what they hoard.’
[10:60] Say, ‘Have you considered that Allah sent down provision to you, then you made <i>some</i> of it unlawful and <i>some</i> lawful?’ Say, ‘Has Allah permitted you <i>that</i> or do you invent lies against Allah?’
[10:61] What think those who invent lies against Allah of the Day of Resurrection? Surely, Allah is gracious towards mankind, but most of them are not thankful.
[10:62] And thou art not engaged in anything, and thou recitest not from Him any portion of the Qur’an, and you do no work, but We are witnesses of you when you are engrossed therein. And there is not hidden from thy Lord even an atom’s weight in the earth or in heaven. And there is nothing smaller than that or greater, but it is <i>recorded</i> in a clear Book. Footnote: And <b>you are</b> not engaged in anything, and <b>you recite</b> not from Him any portion of the Qur’an, and <b>you</b> do not do <b>anything but We watch you</b> when you are engrossed therein. <b>And nothing is hidden from the view of your Lord – even that which weighs no more than a particle or less thereof, or greater than that in the earth or in the heavens - </b> but it is <i>recorded</i> in a clear Book.
[10:63] Behold! the friends of Allah shall certainly have no fear, nor shall they grieve — 
[10:64] Those who believed and kept to righteousness — Footnote: Those who believed and <b>acted ever righteously.</b>
[10:65] For them are glad tidings in the present life and <i>also</i> in the Hereafter — there is no changing the words of Allah; that indeed is the supreme triumph.
[10:66] And let not their words grieve thee. Surely, all power belongs to Allah. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. Footnote: And let not their words grieve <b>you. Surely all majesty</b> belongs to Allah.
[10:67] Behold! whoever is in the heavens and whoever is in the earth is Allah’s. Those who call on others than Allah do not <i>really</i> follow <i>these</i> ‘partners’; they follow only a conjecture, and they do nothing but guess. Footnote: <b>Lo! To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth.</b> Those who <b>pray to partners beside Allah</b> do not <i>really</i> follow <b>them. They follow nothing but fancy and indulge not but in conjectures.</b>
[10:68] He it is Who has made for you the night <i>dark</i> that you may rest therein, and the day full of light. Surely, therein are Signs for a people who listen. Footnote: He it is Who has made for you the night that you may rest therein, and the day <b>illuminating</b>.
[10:69] They say, ‘Allah has taken unto Himself a son.’ Holy is He! He is Self-Sufficient. To Him belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say against Allah what you know not?
[10:70] Say, ‘Those who invent a lie against Allah shall not prosper.’
[10:71] <i>They will have some</i> enjoyment in this world. Then to Us is their return. Then shall We make them taste a severe punishment, because they used to disbelieve. Footnote: <i>They will have</i> <b>a small transient gain</b> in this world. Then to Us is their return. Then shall We make them taste a severe punishment, because they <b>would not believe.</b>
[10:72] And recite unto them the story of Noah, when he said to his people, ‘O my people, if my station <i>with God</i> and my reminding you <i>of your duty</i> through the Signs of Allah offend you — and in Allah do I put my trust — muster then <i>all</i> your designs, <i>you</i> and your ‘partners’; then let not your course of action be obscure to you; then carry out <i>your designs</i> against me and give me no respite.
[10:73] ‘But if you turn back, <i>remember</i>, I have not asked of you any reward. My reward is with Allah alone, and I have been commanded to be of those who are resigned <i>to Him</i>.’ Footnote: …and I have been commanded to be of those who <b>have submitted.’</b>
[10:74] But they rejected him, so We saved him and those who were with him in the Ark. And We made them inheritors <i>of Our favours</i>, while We drowned those who rejected Our Signs. See then, how was the end of those who had been warned! Footnote: And We made them inheritors <b><i>of the land</i></b>, while We drowned those who rejected Our Signs.
[10:75] Then We sent, after him, <i>other</i> Messengers to their <i>respective</i> peoples, and they brought them clear proofs. But they would not believe <i>in them</i>, because they had rejected them before. Thus do We seal the hearts of transgressors.
[10:76] Then did We send, after them, Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our Signs, but they behaved arrogantly. And they were a sinful people.
[10:77] And when there came to them the truth from Us, they said, ‘This is surely a manifest enchantment.’
[10:78] Moses said, ‘Do you say <i>this</i> of the truth when it has come to you? Is this enchantment? And the enchanters never prosper.’
[10:79] They said, ‘Hast thou come to us that thou mayest turn us away from what we found our fathers following, and that you two may have greatness in the land? But we will not believe in either of you.’
[10:80] And Pharaoh said, ‘Bring to me every expert magician.’
[10:81] And when the magicians came, Moses said to them, ‘Cast ye what you would cast.’
[10:82] And when they had cast, Moses said, ‘What you have brought is <i>mere</i> sorcery. Surely, Allah will make it vain. Verily, Allah does not allow the work of mischief-makers to prosper.
[10:83] ‘And Allah establishes the truth by His words, even though the sinners be averse <i>to it</i>.’
[10:84] And none obeyed Moses save some youths from among his people, because of the fear of Pharaoh and their chiefs, lest he should persecute them. And of a truth, Pharaoh was a tyrant in the land and surely he was of the transgressors. Footnote: And none obeyed Moses <b>except a generation</b> from among his people, because of the fear of Pharaoh and their chiefs, lest he should persecute them. And verily, Pharaoh was a tyrant in the land, and <b>certainly</b> he was of the transgressors.
[10:85] And Moses said, ‘O my people, if you have believed in Allah, then in Him put your trust, if you indeed submit <i>to His will</i>.’
[10:86] And they said, ‘In Allah do we put our trust. Our Lord, make us not a trial for the wrongdoing people.
[10:87] ‘And deliver us by Thy mercy from the disbelieving people.’
[10:88] And We spoke to Moses and his brother, <i>saying</i>, ‘Take, ye twain, <i>some</i> houses for your people in <i>the</i> town, and make your houses so as to face one another, and observe Prayer. And give glad tidings to the believers.’ Footnote: And We spoke to Moses and his brother, <i>saying</i>, ‘<b>Build</b> houses for your people in <i>the</i> city and make your houses <b>facing in the same direction</b>, and observe Prayer. (p) <b>Note:</b> The Arabic words <i>waj’alu buyutakum qiblatan</i> (<b></b>) in this verse may mean: facing the Qiblah <i>i.e.,</i> the point or place to which the worship is oriented or facing each other or facing in the same direction. (p) As for the first meaning it is difficult to adopt this because there was no definite Qiblah prescribed for the Children of Israel before the building of the Temple of Solomon. If the second meaning is preferred then the scenario will be that of houses built facing each other for the purpose of security. (p) We prefer the third option, meaning: <b>build your houses facing the same direction.</b> This has the advantage of enabling all the dwellers of the houses to worship in the same direction which creates a sense of unity and discipline among them. (p) Immediately after this instruction the believers are admonished to observe prayer which further strengthens our view. Because the Arabic word <i>aqimu al-salata</i> (<b></b>) does not merely enjoin performance of individual prayer but emphasizes the performance of prayer in congregation.

[11:18] Can he, then, who possesses a clear proof from his Lord, and <i>to testify to whose truth</i> a witness from Him shall follow him, and who was preceded by the Book of Moses, a guide and a mercy, <i>be an impostor</i>? Those <i>who consider these matters</i> believe therein, and whoever of the <i>opposing</i> parties disbelieves in it, Fire shall be his promised place. So be not thou in doubt about it. Surely, it is the truth from thy Lord; but most men do not believe. Footnote: Can he, then <b><i>be an imposter,</i></b> who possesses a clear proof from his Lord, and <i>to testify to whose truth</i> a witness from Him shall follow him, and who was preceded by the Book of Moses, a guide and a mercy? <b>They believe in him; and whoever from among the different sects rejects him,</b> Fire shall be him promised <b>abode.</b> So be no in doubt about it. Surely, it is the truth from <b>your</b> Lord; but most <b>people</b> do not believe. (p) <b>Note:</b> It is very important to determine to whom the pronoun ‘they’ refers. The only two persons mentioned in this verse are the Holy Prophet (may peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the Divine witness who is to follow him. As far as Moses is concerned, it is not he but his Book to which reference is made because Books do not believe. It leaves us with the only option that a body of people is implied in the verse. The pronoun refers not only to the Prophet himself but also to his subordinate witness and some others. (p) The above verse should be understood in the same context that not only the Prophet and his witness believe in the truth of the Prophet and testify to it, but also the large number of their followers do the same. (p) It should be remembered that sometimes great Prophets are mentioned in the singular as one person but they have the potential to multiply and spread out. They are referred to as ‘<i>ummah</i>’ (<b></b>), a large body of people in themselves. For reference see chapter 16 verse 121. (p) Some have understood the pronoun ‘they’ (<i>‘ula’ika</i> ) to refer to Moses and his people.

[11:79] And his people came running towards him, trembling <i>with rage</i>; and before this <i>too</i> they used to do evil. He said, ‘O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. Is there not among you any rightminded man?’ Footnote: He said, ‘O my people, these are my daughters. <b>They are most chaste for you.</b> So fear Allah and <b>do not disgrace me concerning my guests.</b> Is there not among you any right-minded man?’ (p) <b>Note:</b> It was a most apt and disarming retort to a people who were not interested in the charms of the opposite sex. Virtually women were chaste for them. It is to this that the expression ‘most chaste’ refers. However the wicked gave this reply a perverted twist and posed as if Lot had offered them his own daughters so that the honour of his guests could be protected at their cost. As if he were inviting them to abuse their innocence. Evidently this reply was a reflection of their perverted nature.

Verily, their appointed time is the morning. Is not the morning nigh?’ Footnote: <b>Note:</b> This advice of the visiting messengers indicates that the dialogue between Lot and his people took place in camera and that so far they had no direct access to him or to any one else in the house. This was denied them by the advice of the messengers to Lot that he should depart from the house during the latter part of the night with his members of the family except his wife.
