[30:13] And on the day when the Hour will arrive the guilty shall be in despair.
[30:14] And they shall have no intercessors from <i>among them</i> whom they associate <i>with God</i>; and they will deny <i>those</i> whom they associate <i>with Him.</i>
[30:15] And on the day when the Hour will arrive — on that day will they become separated <i>from one another</i>.
[30:16] Then those who believed and did good works will be honoured and made happy in a garden.
[30:17] But as for those who disbelieved and rejected Our Signs and the meeting of the Hereafter, these will be brought forth in punishment.
[30:18] So glorify Allah when you enter the evening and when you enter the morning — 
[30:19] And to Him belongs all praise in the heavens and the earth — and <i>glorify Him</i> in the afternoon and when you enter upon the time of the decline of the sun.
[30:20] He brings forth the living from the dead, and He brings forth the dead from the living; and He gives life to the earth after its death. And in like manner shall you be brought forth.
[30:21] And <i>one</i> of His Signs <i>is this</i>, that He created you from dust; then, behold, you are men who move about <i>on the face of the earth</i>.
[30:22] And <i>one</i> of His Signs <i>is this</i>, that He has created wives for you from among yourselves that you may find peace of mind in them, and He has put love and tenderness between you. In that surely are Signs for a people who reflect.
[30:23] And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the diversity of your tongues and colours. In that surely are Signs for those who possess knowledge.
[30:24] And among His Signs is your sleep by night and day, and your seeking of His bounty. In that surely are Signs for a people who hear.
[30:25] And <i>one</i> of His Signs <i>is this</i>, that He shows you the lightning <i>as a source of</i> fear and hope, and He sends down water from the sky, and quickens therewith the earth after its death. In that surely are Signs for a people who understand.
[30:26] And among His Signs <i>is this</i>, that the heaven and the earth stand <i>firm</i> by His command. Then when He calls you by a call <i>coming</i> from the earth, behold, you will come forth.
[30:27] And to Him belongs whosoever is in the heavens and the earth. All are obedient to Him.
[30:28] And He it is Who originates the creation, then repeats it, and it is most easy for Him. His is the most exalted state in the heavens and the earth; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
[30:29] He sets forth for you a parable concerning yourselves. Have you, among those whom your right hands possess, partners in what We have provided for you so that you become equal <i>sharers</i> therein <i>and</i> fear them as you fear each other? Thus do We explain the Signs to a people who understand.
[30:30] Nay, but those who are unjust follow their own low desires without any knowledge. Then who can guide him whom Allah has adjudged as lost? There will be no helpers for them.
[30:31] So set thy face to <i>the service of</i> religion as one devoted <i>to God</i>. <i>And follow</i> the nature made by Allah — the nature in which He has created mankind. There is no altering the creation of Allah. That is the right religion. But most men know not. Footnote: So set <b>your</b> face <b>towards religion ever inclined <i>to truth – and follow</i> the nature of Allah after which He fashioned all mankind.</b> There is no altering the creation of Allah. <b>That indeed is the religion which is firmly upright and supports others to be upright.</b> <b>Note:</b> Here the nature of Allah refers to His attributes. In this context it means that man has been made capable of imitating the attributes of Allah. That is the only way by which man can spiritually evolve. Evidently other animals cannot share this unique distinction of man. In other words, nearness to Allah can only be achieved if His excellent attributes are acquired. However it should be remembered that Allah is infinite while man is finite. As such man can only imitate Him within the scope of his human limitations.
[30:32] <i>Set your face to God</i>, turning to Him <i>in repentance</i>, and fear Him, and observe Prayer, and be not of those who associate partners <i>with God —</i> 
[30:33] Of those who split up their religion and have become divided into sects; every party rejoicing in what they have.
[30:34] And when an affliction befalls men, they cry unto their Lord, turning to Him <i>in repentance</i>; then, when He has made them taste of mercy from Him, lo! a section of them associate partners with their Lord,
[30:35] So as to be ungrateful for what We have given them. So enjoy yourselves <i>awhile</i>, but soon you will come to know.
[30:36] Have We sent down to them any authority which speaks <i>in favour</i> of what they associate with Him?
[30:37] And when We make mankind taste of mercy, they rejoice therein; but if an evil befall them because of that which their own hands have sent on, behold! they are in despair. Footnote: And when <b>We favor mankind with a taste of mercy</b> they rejoice therein; but if an evil befalls them because of <b>what their hands have earned <i>themselves</i></b> behold! <b>they begin to despair.</b>
[30:38] Have they not seen that Allah enlarges the provision to whomsoever He pleases, and straitens <i>it to whomsoever He pleases</i>? In that truly are Signs for a people who believe.
[30:39] So give to the kinsman his due, and to the needy, and to the wayfarer. That is best for those who seek the favour of Allah, and it is they who will prosper.
[30:40] Whatever you pay as interest that it may increase the wealth of the people, it does not increase in the sight of Allah; but whatever you give in Zakat seeking the favour of Allah — it is these who will increase <i>their wealth</i> manifold.
[30:41] It is Allah Who has created you, <i>and</i> then He has provided for you; then He will cause you to die, <i>and</i> then He will bring you to life. Is there any of your ‘partners’ who can do any of these things? Glorified be He and exalted above that which they associate <i>with Him.</i>
[30:42] Corruption has appeared on land and sea because of what men’s hands have wrought, that He may make them taste <i>the fruit</i> of some of their doings, so that they may turn back <i>from evil</i>.
[30:43] Say, ‘Travel in the earth and see how <i>evil</i> was the end of those before <i>you</i>! Most of them were idolaters.’
[30:44] So set thy face to <i>the service of</i> the right religion before there comes the day from Allah for which there will be no averting. On that day <i>mankind</i> will split up <i>into parts</i>. Footnote: So set <b>your face towards the Religion which is upright and helps others to be upright before there</b> comes the day from Allah for which there will be no averting. On that day <b>they will fall into groups distinct from each other.</b>
[30:45] Those who disbelieve will bear <i>the consequences of</i> their disbelief; and those who do righteous deeds prepare <i>good</i> for themselves,
[30:46] That He, out of His bounty, may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. Surely, He loves not the disbelievers.
[30:47] And among His Signs <i>is this</i>, that He sends the winds as bearers of glad tidings and that He may make you taste of His mercy, and that the ships may sail at His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may be grateful.
[30:48] And surely We sent Messengers before thee to their own people, and they brought them clear Signs. Then We punished those who were guilty. And it was certainly due from Us to help the believers.
[30:49] <i>It is</i> Allah Who sends the winds so that they raise a cloud. Then He spreads it in the sky as He pleases and places it layer upon layer and thou seest the rain issuing forth from its midst. And when He causes it to fall on whom He pleases of His servants, behold! they rejoice;
[30:50] Though before that — before it was sent down upon them — they were in despair.
[30:51] Look, therefore, at the marks of Allah’s mercy: how He quickens the earth after its death. Verily, the same <i>God</i> will quicken the dead; for He has power over all things.
[30:52] And if We sent a wind and they saw it (their harvest) turn yellow, they would certainly, thereafter, <i>begin to</i> deny <i>Our favours</i>.
[30:53] And thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call, when they turn away showing their backs.
[30:54] Nor canst thou guide the blind out of their error. Thou canst make only those to hear who would believe in Our Signs and they submit.
[30:55] <i>It is</i> Allah Who created you in <i>a state of</i> weakness, and after weakness gave strength; then, after strength, caused weakness and old age. He creates what He pleases. He is the All-knowing, the All-Powerful.
[30:56] And on the day when the Hour shall arrive the guilty will swear that they tarried not save an hour — thus were they turned away <i>from the right path</i>.
[30:57] But those who are given knowledge and faith will say, ‘You have indeed tarried according to the Book of Allah, till the Day of Resurrection. And this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not <i>care to</i> know.’
[30:58] So on that day their excuses will not avail the wrongdoers; nor will they be allowed to make amends. Footnote: nor will they be allowed <b>access to <i>His</i> threshold.</b>
[30:59] And truly, We have set forth for men in this Qur’an every kind of parable; and indeed, if thou bring them a Sign, those who disbelieve will surely say, ‘You are but liars.’
[30:60] Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who have no knowledge.
[30:61] So be thou patient. Surely the promise of Allah is true; and let not those who have no certainty <i>of faith</i> make light of thee.
[31:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[31:2] Alif Lam Mim. Footnote: I am Allah, the All-Knowing.
[31:3] These are verses of the Book of Wisdom,
[31:4] A guidance and a mercy for those who do good,
[31:5] Those who observe Prayer and pay the Zakat and who have firm faith in the Hereafter.
[31:6] It is they who follow guidance from their Lord, and it is they who shall prosper.
[31:7] And of men is he who takes idle tales in exchange <i>for guidance</i> to lead <i>men</i> astray from the path of Allah, without knowledge, and to make fun of it. For such there will be humiliating punishment.
[31:8] And when Our Signs are recited to him, he turns proudly away, as though he heard them not, as if there were a heaviness in both his ears. So announce to him a painful punishment.
[31:9] Surely those who believe and do good works — they will have Gardens of Delight,
[31:10] Wherein they will abide. Allah has <i>made</i> a true promise; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
[31:11] He has created the heavens without any pillars that you can see, and He has placed in the earth firm mountains that it may not quake with you, and He has scattered therein all kinds of creatures; and We have sent down water from the clouds, and caused to grow therein every noble species. Footnote: See alternative translation of (<b></b>) under 16:16 and the note to it, p. 300. (Publisher)
[31:12] This is the creation of Allah. Now show me what others beside Him have created. Nay, but the wrongdoers are in manifest error.
[31:13] And We bestowed wisdom on Luqman, <i>saying</i>, ‘Be grateful to Allah:’ and whoso is grateful, is grateful only for <i>the good of</i> his own soul. And whoso is ungrateful, then surely Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.
[31:14] And <i>remember</i> when Luqman said to his son while exhorting him, ‘O my dear son! associate not partners with Allah. Surely, associating partners <i>with God</i> is a grievous wrong.’
[31:15] And We have enjoined on man concerning his parents — his mother bears him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning takes two years — ‘Give thanks to Me and to thy parents. Unto Me is the <i>final</i> return.
[31:16] ‘And if they contend with thee to make thee set up equals with Me concerning which thou hast no knowledge, obey them not, but be a kind companion to them in <i>all</i> worldly affairs; and <i>in spiritual matters</i> follow the way of him who turns to Me. Then unto Me will be your return and I shall inform you of what you used to do.’
[31:17] ‘O my dear son! even though it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed, and even though it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, Allah will surely bring it out; verily Allah is the Knower of all subtleties, All-Aware.
[31:18] ‘O my dear son! observe Prayer, and enjoin good, and forbid evil, and endure patiently whatever may befall thee. Surely this is of those matters <i>which require</i> firm resolve.
[31:19] ‘And turn not thy cheek away from men in pride nor walk in the earth haughtily; Surely, Allah loves not any arrogant boaster.
[31:20] ‘And walk thou at a moderate pace, and lower thy voice; verily, the most disagreeable of voices is the voice of the ass.’
[31:21] Have you not seen that Allah has pressed for you into service whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and has completed His favours on you, <i>both</i> externally and internally? And among men there are some who dispute concerning Allah, without knowledge or guidance or an illuminating Book.
[31:22] And when it is said to them, ‘Follow that which Allah has revealed,’ they say, ‘Nay, we shall follow that which we found our fathers following.’ What! even though Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the burning fire?
[31:23] And he who submits himself <i>completely</i> to Allah, and is a doer of good, he has surely grasped a strong handle. And with Allah <i>rests</i> the end of all affairs.
[31:24] And <i>as for</i> him who disbelieves, let not his disbelief grieve thee. Unto Us is their return and We shall tell them what they did; surely Allah knows full well what is in the breasts.
[31:25] We shall let them enjoy themselves a little; then We shall drive them to a severe torment.
[31:26] And if thou ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’, they will surely answer, ‘Allah.’ Say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah.’ But most of them know not.
[31:27] To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Verily, Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.
[31:28] And if all the trees that are in the earth were pens, and the ocean <i>were ink</i>, with seven oceans swelling it thereafter, the words of Allah would not be exhausted. Surely, Allah is Mighty, Wise.
[31:29] Your creation and your resurrection are only like <i>the creation and resurrection of</i> a single soul. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing. Footnote: Your creation and your resurrection are only like <i>the creation and resurrection of</i> a single <b>being</b>.
[31:30] Hast thou not seen that Allah makes the night pass into the day, and makes the day pass into the night, and He has pressed the sun and the moon into service; each pursuing its course till an appointed term, and that Allah is well aware of what you do?
[31:31] That is because it is Allah alone Who is the True <i>God</i>, and whatever they call upon beside Him is falsehood, and because it is Allah alone Who is the Most High, the Incomparably Great.
[31:32] Dost thou not see that the ships sail on the sea by the favour of Allah, that He may show you of His Signs? Therein surely are Signs for everyone who is patient <i>and</i> grateful.
[31:33] And when waves engulf them like <i>so many</i> coverings, they call upon Allah, being sincere to Him in faith; but when He brings them safe to land, then some of them take the right course. And none denies Our Signs save every perfidous <i>and</i> ungrateful person.
[31:34] O men, seek protection with your Lord and fear the day when the father will not be of any avail to his son, nor will the son at all be of any avail to his father. Allah’s promise is surely true. So let not worldly life beguile you, nor let the Deceiver deceive you concerning Allah.
[31:35] Verily, with Allah alone is the knowledge of the Hour. And He sends down the rain, and He knows what is in the wombs. And no soul knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Surely, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.
[32:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[32:2] Alif Lam Mim. Footnote: I am Allah, the All-Knowing.
[32:3] The revelation of the Book — there is no doubt about it — is from the Lord of the worlds.
[32:4] Do they say, ‘He has forged it?’ Nay, it is the truth from thy Lord, that thou mayest warn a people to whom no Warner has come before thee, that haply they may follow guidance.
[32:5] Allah it is Who created the heavens and the earth, and that which is between them, in six periods; then He settled on the Throne. You have no helper or intercessor beside Him. Will you not then reflect?
[32:6] He will plan the <i>Divine</i> Ordinance from the heaven unto the earth, then shall it go up to Him in a day the duration of which is a thousand years according to what you reckon.
[32:7] Such is the Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Mighty, the Merciful,
[32:8] Who has made perfect everything He has created. And He began the creation of man from clay.
[32:9] Then He made his progeny from an extract of an insignificant fluid.
[32:10] Then He fashioned him and breathed into him of His spirit. And He has given you ears, and eyes, and hearts. <i>But</i> little thanks do you give! Footnote: Then He <b>balanced</b> him and breathed into him of His spirit. And He has given you <b>hearing and eyes and hearts</b>. <i>But</i> little thanks do you give! <b>Note:</b> The word <i>fu’ad</i> (<b></b>) as used in the Holy Qur’an does not only mean heart, but indicates the ultimate seat of understanding See 28:11 (Al-Qasas), 53:12 (Al-Najm), 46:27 (Al-Ahqaf) and 14:38 (Ibrahim).
[32:11] And they say, ‘What! when we are lost in the earth, shall we then become a new creation?’ Nay, but they are disbelievers in the meeting of their Lord.
[32:12] Say, ‘The angel of death that has been put in charge of you will cause you to die; then to your Lord will you be brought back.’
[32:13] If only thou couldst see when the guilty will hang down their heads before their Lord, <i>and say</i>, ‘Our Lord, we have seen and we have heard, so send us back that we may do good works; for <i>now</i> we are convinced.’
[32:14] And if We had <i>enforced</i> Our will, We could have given every soul its guidance, but the word from Me has come true: ‘I will fill Hell with Jinn and men all together.’
[32:15] So taste ye <i>the punishment of your deeds</i> for you forgot the meeting of this day of yours. We <i>too</i> have forgotten you. And taste ye the lasting punishment because of that which you used to do.
[32:16] Only they believe in Our Signs who, when they are reminded of them, fall down prostrate and celebrate the praises of their Lord, and they are not proud.
[32:17] Their sides keep away from their beds; <i>and</i> they call on their Lord in fear and hope, and spend out of what We have bestowed on them.
[32:18] And no soul knows what joy of the eyes is kept hidden for them, as a reward for their good works.
[32:19] Is he, then, who is a believer like one who is disobedient? They are not equal.
[32:20] As for those who believe and do good works, they will have Gardens of Eternal Abode, as an entertainment, for what they used to do.
[32:21] And as for those who are disobedient, their abode will be the Fire. Every time they desire to come forth therefrom, they will be turned back into it, and it will be said to them, ‘Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny,’
[32:22] And most surely We will make them taste of the nearer punishment before the greater punishment, so that they may return <i>to Us with repentance</i>. Footnote: And most surely We will make them taste of the <b>lesser</b> punishment before the greater punishment, so that they may return <i>to Us with repentance.</i>
[32:23] And who does greater wrong than he who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord and then turns away from them? We will surely punish the guilty.
[32:24] And We did give Moses the Book — be not therefore in doubt as to the meeting with Him — and We made it a guidance for the children of Israel.
[32:25] And We made from among them leaders, who guided <i>the people</i> by Our command, whilst they themselves were steadfast and had firm faith in Our Signs.
[32:26] Verily, thy Lord — He will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that in which they disagree.
[32:27] Does it not guide them how many a generation We have destroyed before them, amid whose dwellings they <i>now</i> walk about? In that surely are Signs. Will they not then hearken?
[32:28] Have they not seen that We drive the water to the dry land and produce thereby crops of which their cattle eat, and they themselves? Will they not then see?
[32:29] And they say, ‘When will this victory come, if you are truthful?’
[32:30] Say, ‘On the day of victory the believing of the disbelievers will not avail them, nor will they be granted respite.’
[32:31] So turn away from them, and wait. They are also waiting.
[33:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[33:2] O thou Prophet, seek protection in Allah, and follow not <i>the wishes of</i> the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing, Wise.
[33:3] And follow that which is revealed to thee from thy Lord. Verily Allah is well aware of what you do.
[33:4] And put thy trust in Allah, and Allah is sufficient as a Guardian.
[33:5] Allah has not made for any man two hearts in his breast; nor has He made those of your wives, from whom you keep away by calling them mothers, your <i>real</i> mothers, nor has He made your adopted sons your <i>real</i> sons. That is <i>merely</i> a word of your mouths; but Allah speaks the truth, and He guides to the <i>right</i> path. Footnote: Allah has not made for any man two hearts in his breast; nor <b>does He turn your wives into your mothers merely because you address them as your mothers and thereby abstain from maintaining conjugal relations, nor does He turn those whom you adopt into your <i>real</i> sons.</b>
[33:6] Call them by <i>the names of</i> their fathers. That is more equitable in the sight of Allah. But if you know not their fathers, then they are your brothers in faith and your friends. And there is no blame on you in any mistake you may unintentionally make in this <i>matter</i>, but <i>what matters is</i> that which your hearts intend. And Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful. Footnote: And there is no blame on you <b>for any unintentional mistake with you committed saving that which your hearts willfully pursued.</b>
[33:7] The Prophet is nearer to the believers than their own selves, and his wives are <i>as</i> mothers to them. And blood relations are nearer to one another, according to the Book of Allah, than <i>the rest of</i> the believers <i>from among the Helpers</i> as well as the Emigrants, except that you show kindness to your friends. That <i>also</i> is written down in the Book. Footnote: The Prophet is nearer to the believers than their own selves, and his wives are <i>as</i> mothers to them. <b>And some of the blood relations are nearer to each other than others from among the believers and the Emigrants according to the Book of Allah, except for the voluntary favours you may bestow upon your special friends in a goodly manner. This is what is ingrained in the Book <i>of Nature.</i></b>
[33:8] And <i>remember</i> when We took from the Prophets their covenant, and from thee, and from Noah, and Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus, son of Mary, and We <i>indeed</i> took from them a solemn covenant;
[33:9] That He may question the truthful about their truthfulness. And for the disbelievers He has prepared a painful punishment.
[33:10] O ye who believe! remember the favour of Allah on you when there came down upon you hosts, and We sent against them a wind and hosts that you saw not. And Allah sees what you do.
[33:11] When they came upon you from above you, and from below you, and when <i>your</i> eyes became distracted, and <i>your</i> hearts reached to the throats, and you thought <i>diverse</i> thoughts about Allah. Footnote: and <i>your</i> hearts <b>leapt to <i>your</i> throats and you entertained wayward thoughts about Allah.</b>
[33:12] There <i>and then</i> were the believers <i>sorely</i> tried, and they were shaken with a violent shaking.
[33:13] And when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts was a disease said, ‘Allah and His Messenger promised us nothing but a delusion.’
[33:14] And when a party of them said, ‘O people of Yathrib‡, you have <i>possibly</i> no stand <i>against the enemy</i>, therefore turn back.’ And a section of them <i>even</i> asked leave of the Prophet, saying, ‘Our houses are exposed <i>and defenceless</i>.’ And they were <i>in truth</i> not exposed. They only sought to flee away. Footnote: Madinah was known by this name before Hijrah.
[33:15] And if entry were effected against them <i>into the town</i> from its environs, and then they were asked <i>to join in</i> the disturbances, they would have <i>at once</i> done so, and would not have tarried in their houses save a little.
[33:16] And truly they had already covenanted with Allah <i>that</i> they would not turn their backs. And a covenant with Allah will have to be answered for. Footnote: And truly they had already <b>made a covenant with Allah</b> <i>that</i> they would not turn their backs. And a covenant with Allah <b>is certainly accountable for.</b>
[33:17] Say, ‘Flight shall not avail you if you flee from death or slaughter; and <i>even</i> then you will enjoy but a little.’
[33:18] Say, ‘Who is it that can save you against Allah if it be His wish to do you harm or if it be His wish to show you mercy?’ And they will not find for themselves any friend or helper other than Allah.
[33:19] Verily Allah knows those among you who hinder <i>men</i> and those who say to their brethren, ‘Come to us;’ and they come not to the fight but a little,
[33:20] Being niggardly with regard to you. But when danger comes, thou seest them looking towards thee, their eyes rolling like one who is fainting on account of death. But when the fear has passed away, they assail you with sharp tongues being greedy for wealth. These have never believed; so Allah has rendered their works null and void. And that is an easy thing for Allah.
[33:21] They think that the confederates have not gone away; and if the confederates should come <i>again</i>, they would wish to be among the nomad Arabs in the desert, asking for news about you. And if they were among you they would not fight save a little. Footnote: They think that the <b><i>invading</i> tribes</b> have not gone away; <b>and in case the tribes invade</b> <i>again</i>, they would <b><i>rather</i></b> wish to be among the nomad Arabs in the desert, asking for news about you.
[33:22] Verily you have in the Prophet of Allah an excellent model, for him who fears Allah and the Last Day and who remembers Allah much.
[33:23] And when the believers saw the confederates, they said, ‘This is what Allah and His Messenger promised us; and Allah and His Messenger spoke the truth.’ And it only added to their faith and submission.
[33:24] Among the believers are men who have been true to the covenant they made with Allah. There are <i>some</i> of them who have fulfilled their vow, and <i>some</i> who <i>still</i> wait, and they have not changed <i>their condition</i> in the least;
[33:25] That Allah may reward the truthful for their truth, and punish the hypocrites if He so please, or turn to them in mercy. Verily Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[33:26] And Allah turned back the disbelievers in their rage; they gained no good. And Allah sufficed the believes in their fight. And Allah is Powerful, Mighty.
[33:27] And He brought those of the People of the Book who aided them down from their fortresses and cast terror into their hearts. Some you slew, and some you took captive.
[33:28] And He made you inherit their land and their houses and their wealth, and a land on which you had never set foot. And Allah has power over all things.
[33:29] O Prophet! say to thy wives, ‘If you desire the life of this world and its adornment, come then, I will provide for you and send you away in a handsome manner.
[33:30] ‘But if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the Home of the Hereafter, then truly Allah has prepared for those of you who do good a great reward.’
[33:31] O wives of the Prophet! if any of you be guilty of manifestly dishonourable conduct, the punishment will be doubled for her. And that is easy for Allah.
[33:32] But whoever of you is obedient to Allah and His Messenger and does good works, We shall give her her reward twice over; and We have prepared for her an honourable provision.
[33:33] O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any <i>other</i> women if you are righteous. So be not soft in speech, lest he in whose heart is a disease should feel tempted; and speak a decent speech.
[33:34] And stay in your houses <i>with dignity</i>, and do not show off yourselves like the showing off of the former days of ignorance, and observe Prayer, and pay the Zakat, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Surely Allah desires to remove from you <i>all</i> uncleanness, O Members of the Household, and purify you completely. Footnote: And stay in your houses <i>with dignity</i>, <b>and do not embellish yourselves in the style of embellishment during the days of ignorance</b> and observe Prayer, and pay the Zakat, and obey Allah and His Messenger.
[33:35] And remember what is rehearsed in your houses of the Signs of Allah and of wisdom. Verily Allah is the Knower of subtleties, All-Aware.
[33:36] Surely, men who submit themselves <i>to God</i> and women who submit themselves <i>to Him</i>, and believing men and believing women, and obedient men and obedient women and truthful men and truthful women, and men steadfast <i>in their faith</i> and steadfast women, and men who are humble and women who are humble, and men who give alms and women who give alms, and men who fast and women who fast, and men who guard their chastity and women who guard <i>their chastity</i>, and men who remember Allah much and women who remember <i>Him</i> — Allah has prepared for <i>all of</i> them forgiveness and a great reward.
[33:37] And it behoves not a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decided a matter, that there should be a choice for them in the matter concerning them. And whoso disobeys Allah and His Messenger, surely strays away in manifest error.
[33:38] And <i>remember</i> when thou didst say to him on whom Allah had bestowed favours and on whom thou <i>also</i> hadst bestowed favours: ‘Keep thy wife to thyself, and fear Allah.’ And thou didst conceal in thy heart what Allah was going to bring to light, and thou wast afraid of the people, whereas Allah has better right that thou shouldst fear Him. Then, when Zaid had accomplished his want of her <i>so as to have no further need of her</i>, We joined her in marriage to thee, so that there may be no hindrance for the believers with regard to the wives of their adopted sons, when they have accomplished their want of them. And Allah’s decree must be fulfilled.
[33:39] There can be no hindrance for the Prophet with regard to that which Allah has made incumbent upon him. Such indeed was the way of Allah with those who have passed away before — and the command of Allah is a decree ordained — 
[33:40] Those who delivered the Messages of Allah and feared Him, and feared none but Allah. And sufficient is Allah as a Reckoner.
[33:41] Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but <i>he is</i> the Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets; and Allah has full knowledge of all things.
[33:42] O ye who believe! remember Allah with much remembrance;
[33:43] And glorify Him morning and evening.
[33:44] He it is Who sends blessings on you, as <i>do</i> His angels, that He may bring you forth from all <i>kinds of</i> darkness into light. And He is Merciful to the believers. Footnote: And as a Summoner to Allah by His command, <b>and as a radiant Lamp.</b>
[33:45] Their greeting on the day when they meet Him will be, ‘Peace.’ And He has prepared for them an honourable reward.
[33:46] O Prophet, truly We have sent thee as a Witness, and Bearer of glad tidings, and a Warner,
[33:47] And as a Summoner unto Allah by His command, and as a Lamp that gives <i>bright</i> light. Footnote: And as a Summoner to Allah by His command, <b>and as a radiant Lamp.</b>
[33:48] And announce to the believers the glad tidings that they will have great bounty from Allah.
[33:49] And follow not the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and leave alone their annoyance, and put thy trust in Allah; for Allah is sufficient as a Guardian. Footnote: And follow not the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and <b>ignore their nuisances,</b> and put <b>your</b> trust in Allah; for Allah is sufficient as a Guardian.
[33:50] O ye who believe! when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then you have no right against them with regard to the period of waiting that you reckon. So make some provision for them and send them away in a handsome manner. Footnote: then you have no right against them with regard to the <b><i>prescribed</i></b> period of waiting that you reckon.
[33:51] O Prophet, We have made lawful to thee thy wives whom thou hast paid their dowries, and those whom thy right hand possesses from among those whom Allah has given thee as gains of war, and the daughters of thy paternal uncle, and the daughters of thy paternal aunts, and the daughters of thy maternal uncle, and the daughters of thy maternal aunts who have emigrated with thee, and any <i>other</i> believing woman if she offers herself <i>for marriage</i> to the Prophet provided the Prophet desires to marry her; <i>this is</i> only for thee, as against <i>other</i> believers — We have already made known what We have enjoined on them concerning their wives and those whom their right hands possess — in order that there may be no difficulty for thee <i>in the discharge of thy work</i>. And Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[33:52] Thou mayest defer <i>the marriage of</i> any of them that thou pleasest, and receive unto thyself whom thou pleasest; and if thou desirest <i>to take back</i> any of those whom thou hast put aside, there is no blame on thee. That is more likely that their eyes may be cooled, and that they may not grieve, and that they may all be pleased with that which thou hast given them. And Allah knows what is in your hearts; and Allah is All-Knowing, Forbearing. Footnote: <b>You may defer <i>marrying</i> anyone among them <i>if you like</i> and you may receive unto yourself whom you please. And if you desire <i>to take back</i> any of those whom you have put aside, there is no blame on you. This is more likely to result in the cooling of their eyes, and that they may not grieve, and that they may all be pleased with that which you have given them.</b>
[33:53] It is not allowed to thee <i>to marry</i> women after that, not to change them for <i>other</i> wives even though their goodness please thee, except any that thy right hand possesses. And Allah is Watchful over all things.
[33:54] O ye who believe! enter not the houses of the Prophet unless leave is granted to you for a meal without waiting for its <i>appointed</i> time. But enter when you are invited, and when you have finished eating, disperse, without seeking to engage in talk. That causes inconvenience to the Prophet, and he feels shy of <i>asking</i> you <i>to leave.</i> But Allah is not shy of <i>saying</i> what is true. And when you ask them (the wives of the Prophet) for anything, ask them from behind a curtain. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it behoves you not to cause inconvenience to the Messenger of Allah, nor that you should ever marry his wives after him. Indeed that would be an enormity in the sight of Allah. Footnote: O ye who believe! Enter not the houses of the Prophet <b>unless you have been invited to meal and even then not <i>so early</i> before the food has been cooked.</b>
[33:55] Whether you reveal a thing or conceal it, Allah knows all things full well.
[33:56] There is no blame on them <i>in this respect</i> with regard to their fathers or their sons or their brothers or the sons of their brothers or the sons of their sisters or their womenfolk or those whom their right hands possess. And fear Allah, <i>O wives of the Prophet</i>, verily, Allah is Witness over all things.
[33:57] Allah and His angels send blessings on the Prophet. O ye who believe! you <i>also</i> should invoke blessings on him and salute <i>him</i> with the salutation of peace.
[33:58] Verily, those who malign Allah and His Messenger — Allah has cursed them in this world and in the Hereafter, and has prepared for them an abasing punishment. Footnote: Verily, those who <b>annoy</b> Allah and His messenger – Allah has cursed them in this world and in the Hereafter, and has prepared for them an abasing punishment.
[33:59] And those who malign believing men and believing women for what they have not earned shall bear <i>the guilt of</i> a calumny and a manifest sin.
[33:60] O Prophet! tell thy wives and thy daughters and the women of the believers that they should draw close to them portions of their <i>loose</i> outer coverings. That is nearer that they may <i>thus</i> be distinguished and not molested. And Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful. Footnote: O Prophet! <b>Tell your wives and your daughters, and the women of the believers, that they should pull down upon them of their outer cloaks, <i>from their hears over their faces.</i> That is more likely that they may <i>thus</i> be recognized</b> and not molested.
[33:61] If the hypocrites, and those in whose heart is a disease, and those who cause agitation in the city, desist not, We shall surely give thee authority over them; then they will not dwell therein as thy neighbours, save for a little while. Footnote: If the hypocrites, and those in whose hearts <b>there is disease, and those who spread baseless rumours in the city, do not desist, We shall surely make you stand up against them; then they will no longer tarry around you but a little.</b>
[33:62] <i>Then they will be</i> accursed. Wherever they are found, they will be seized, and cut into pieces.
[33:63] Such has been the way of Allah in <i>the case of</i> those who passed away before, and thou wilt never find a change in the way of Allah.
[33:64] Men ask thee concerning the Hour. Say, ‘The knowledge of it is with Allah <i>alone</i>.’ And what will make thee know that the Hour may be nigh?
[33:65] Allah has surely cursed the disbelievers, and has prepared for them a burning fire,
[33:66] Wherein they will abide for ever. They will find <i>therein</i> no friend nor helper.
[33:67] On the day when their faces are turned over in the Fire, they will say, ‘Oh, would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!’
[33:68] And they will say, ‘Our Lord, we obeyed our chiefs and our great ones and they led us astray from the way.
[33:69] ‘Our Lord, give them double punishment and curse them with a very great curse.’
[33:70] O ye who believe! be not like those who vexed and slandered Moses; but Allah cleared him of what they spoke <i>of him</i>. And he was honourable in the sight of Allah. Footnote: O ye who believe! Be not like those who vexed <b><i>and slandered</i></b> Moses; Allah cleared him of what they spoke <i>of him.</i>
[33:71] O ye who believe! fear Allah, and say the right word.
[33:72] He will bless your works for you and forgive you your sins. And whoso obeys Allah and His Messenger, shall surely attain a mighty success. Footnote: He will <b>reform your conduct</b> for you and forgive you your sins.
[33:73] Verily, We offered the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear it and were afraid of it. But man bore it. Indeed, he is <i>capable of being</i> unjust <i>to</i>, <i>and</i> neglectful <i>of</i>, <i>himself</i>. Footnote: But <b>the</b> man bore it. Indeed he <b>was too cruel</b> <i>to himself</i>, <b>unmindful of the consequences.</b>
[33:74] <i>The result is</i> that Allah will punish hypocritical men and hypocritical women, and idolatrous men and idolatrous women; and Allah turns in mercy to believing men and believing women; and Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[34:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[34:2] All praise is due to Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. And His is all praise in the Hereafter; and He is the Wise, the All-Aware.
[34:3] He knows whatever goes into the earth and whatever comes forth from it, and whatever descends from the heaven and whatever ascends into it; and He is Merciful, Most Forgiving.
[34:4] And those who disbelieve say, ‘The Hour will never come upon us.’ Say, ‘Yea, by my Lord Who knows the unseen, it will surely come upon you! Not an atom’s weight in the heavens or in the earth or any thing less than that or greater escapes Him, but <i>all is recorded</i> in a perspicuous Book,
[34:5] ‘That He may reward those who believe and do good works. It is these who will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.’
[34:6] But <i>as to</i> those who strive against Our Signs, seeking to frustrate <i>Our plans</i>, it is they for whom there will be the suffering of a painful punishment.
[34:7] And those who are given knowledge see that whatever has been revealed to thee from thy Lord is the truth, and guides unto the path of the Mighty, the Praiseworthy.
[34:8] And those who disbelieve say, ‘Shall we show you a man who will tell you <i>that</i> when you are broken up into pieces, you shall be <i>raised as</i> a new creation?
[34:9] ‘Has he forged a lie against Allah or is he afflicted with madness?’ Nay, but it is those who believe not in the Hereafter that are suffering from the punishment and are too far gone in error.
[34:10] Do they not see what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We please, We could cause the earth to sink with them, or cause pieces of the sky to fall upon them. In that verily is a Sign for every repentant servant. Footnote: Do they not see what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We please, We could cause the earth to sink with them, or cause <b>some pieces from</b> the sky to fall upon them.
[34:11] And certainly, We bestowed grace upon David from <i>Ourselves</i>: ‘O ye mountains, repeat <i>the praises of Allah</i> with him, and O birds, <i>ye also</i>.’ And We made the iron soft for him, Footnote: And certainly, We bestowed grace upon David from <b>Ourselves</b>; ‘O ye mountains, <b>turn to God with full submission along with him.</b>
[34:12] <i>Saying</i>, ‘Make thou full-length coats of mail, and make the rings of a proper measure. And do righteous deeds, surely I see all that you do.’
[34:13] And to Solomon <i>We subjected</i> the wind; its morning course was a month’s <i>journey</i>, and its evening course was a month’s <i>journey too</i>. And We caused a fount of molten copper to flow for him. And of the Jinn were <i>some</i> who worked under him, by the command of his Lord. And <i>We had told them that</i> if any of them turned away from Our command, We would make him taste the punishment of burning fire.
[34:14] They made for him what he desired; palaces and statues, and basins like reservoirs, and large cooking vessels fixed in their places: ‘Work ye, O House of David gratefully;’ but few of My servants are grateful.
[34:15] And when We decreed his (Solomon’s) death, nothing pointed out to them that he was dead save a worm of the earth that ate away his staff. So when he fell down, the Jinn plainly realized that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in a state of degrading torment. Footnote: <b>Note:</b> The word <i>dabbah</i> (<b></b>) applies to all forms of animal life. So the translation “the worm of the earth” should not be taken metaphorically and not literally. This reference is to the son of Solomon who did not inherit any of the spiritual qualities or the art of statecraft which distinguished his illustrious father Solomon. During his rule it became gradually apparent to those powerful chieftains (jinn) who had been subdued and subjugated by Solomon that Solomon was now virtually dead. They successfully rebelled against the state and caused fragmentation of the great empire.
[34:16] There was indeed a Sign for Saba’ in their home-land: two gardens on the right hand and on the left: ‘Eat of the provision of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land and a Most Forgiving Lord!’
[34:17] But they turned away; so We sent against them a fierce flood. And We gave them, in lieu of their gardens, two gardens bearing bitter fruit and tamarisk and a few lotetrees. Footnote: But they turned away; so We sent against them a <b>fierce flood <i>from a</i> burst dam.</b>
[34:18] That We awarded them because of their ingratitude; and none do We requite <i>in this way</i> but the ungrateful.
[34:19] And We placed, between them and the towns which We had blessed, <i>other</i> towns that were prominently visible, and We fixed easy stages between them; ‘Travel in them for nights and days in security.’
[34:20] But they said, ‘Our Lord, place longer distances between <i>the stages of</i> our journeys.’ And they wronged themselves; so We made them bywords and We broke them into pieces, a complete breaking up. In that verily are Signs for every steadfast and grateful person.
[34:21] And Iblis found that his judgment of them was true, so they followed him, <i>all</i> except a party of <i>true</i> believers.
[34:22] And he had no power over them, but <i>it was so</i> that We might distinguish those who believed in the Hereafter from those who were in doubt about it. And thy Lord is Watchful over all things.
[34:23] Say, ‘Call upon those whom you assert <i>to be gods</i> beside Allah. They control not <i>even</i> the weight of an atom in the heavens or in the earth, nor have they any share in either, nor has He any helper among them.’
[34:24] No intercession avails with Him, except for him about whom He permits <i>it</i>, until when their hearts are relieved of fright they would say, ‘What is it that your Lord said?’ They (the Messengers) will answer, ‘The truth.’ And He is the High, the Great.
[34:25] Say, ‘Who gives you sustenance from the heavens and the earth?’ Say, ‘Allah. Either we or you are on right guidance or in manifest error.’
[34:26] Say, ‘You will not be questioned as to our sins, nor shall we be questioned as to what you do.’
[34:27] Say, ‘Our Lord will bring us all together; then He will judge between us with truth: and He is the Judge, the All-Knowing.’
[34:28] Say, ‘Show me those whom you have joined with Him as partners. Nay! <i>You cannot do so</i>, for He is Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.’
[34:29] And We have not sent thee but as a bearer of glad tidings and a Warner, for all mankind, but most men know not.
[34:30] And they say, ‘When will this promise <i>be fulfilled</i>, if you are truthful?’
[34:31] Say, ‘For you is the promise of a day from which you cannot remain behind a single moment nor can you get ahead <i>of it</i>.’
[34:32] And those who disbelieve say, ‘We will never believe in this Qur’an, nor in what is before it;’ and couldst thou see when the wrongdoers will be made to stand before their Lord, throwing back on one another the blame. Those who were considered weak will say to those who were proud, ‘Had it not been for you, we should surely have been believers.’
[34:33] Those who were proud will say to those who were considered weak, ‘Was it we that kept you away from the guidance, after it had come to you? Nay, it was you yourselves who were guilty.’
[34:34] And those who were considered weak will say to those who were proud, ‘Nay, but it was <i>your</i> scheming night and day, when you bade us disbelieve in Allah and set up equals unto Him.’ And they will conceal <i>their</i> remorse when they see the punishment; and We shall put chains round the necks of those who disbelieved. They will not be requited but for what they did.
[34:35] And We never sent a Warner to any city but the wealthy ones thereof said, ‘Surely, we disbelieve in what you have been sent with.’ Footnote: And We never sent a Warner to any <b>township</b> but the wealthy ones thereof said, ‘Surely, we disbelieve in what you have been sent with.’
[34:36] And they say, ‘We have more riches and children; and we are not going to be punished.’
[34:37] Say, ‘Verily, my Lord enlarges the provision for whomsoever He pleases, and straitens <i>it for whomsoever He pleases</i>; but most men do not know.’
[34:38] And it is not your riches nor your children that will bring you near Us in rank, but those who believe and do good works, will have a double reward for what they did. And in lofty mansions will they be secure.
[34:39] And <i>as to</i> those who strive to frustrate <i>the purpose of</i> Our Signs, it is they who will be brought face to face with punishment.
[34:40] Say, ‘Surely, my Lord enlarges the provision for such of His servants as He pleases and straitens <i>it</i> for such of them as <i>He pleases</i>. And whatever you spend, He will replace it; and He is the Best of providers.’
[34:41] And <i>remember</i> the day, when He will gather them all together; then He will say to the angels: ‘Was it you that they worshipped?’ Footnote: And <i>remember</i> the day, when He will gather them all together; then He will say to the angels: Was it you <b><i>in particular</i></b> that they worshipped? <b>Note:</b> The translation of the word <i>iyyakum</i> (<b></b>) seems to have been omitted. The insertion of the word ‘in particular,’ therefore, seems to be appropriate.
[34:42] They will say, ‘Holy art Thou. Thou art our Protector against them. Nay, but they worshipped the Jinn; it was in them that most of them believed.’
[34:43] ‘So, this day, you will have no power either to profit or harm one another.’ And We shall say to those who did wrong: ‘Taste ye the punishment of the Fire that you denied.’
[34:44] And when Our manifest Signs are recited to them, they say, ‘This is but a man who seeks to turn you away from that which your fathers worshipped.’ And they say, ‘This is but a forged lie.’ And those who disbelieve say about the truth when it comes to them, ‘This is nothing but clear magic.’
[34:45] And We gave them no books which they studied, nor did We send to them any Warner before thee.
[34:46] And those who were before them <i>also</i> rejected <i>the truth —</i> and these have not attained <i>even</i> to a tenth of that which We gave them, but they treated My Messengers as liars. So how <i>terrible</i> was the change I <i>brought about</i>!
[34:47] Say, ‘I only exhort you <i>to do</i> one thing: that you stand up before Allah in twos and singly and then reflect. <i>You will then know that</i> there is no insanity in your companion; he is only a Warner to you of an impending severe punishment.’
[34:48] Say, ‘Whatever reward I might have asked of you — let it be yours. My reward is only with Allah; and He is Witness over all things.’
[34:49] Say, ‘Truly, my Lord hurls the Truth <i>at falsehood</i>. <i>He is</i> the Great Knower of the unseen.’
[34:50] Say, ‘The Truth has come, and falsehood could neither originate <i>any good</i> nor reproduce <i>it</i>.’ Footnote: ‘The Truth has <b>arrived</b>, and falsehood could neither <b>initiate nor repeat <i>anything.’</i></b>
[34:51] Say, ‘ If I err, I err only against myself; and if I am rightly guided, it is because of what my Lord has revealed to me. Verily, He is All-Hearing, Nigh.’
[34:52] Couldst thou but see when they will be smitten with fear! Then there will be no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby.
[34:53] And they will say, ‘We <i>now</i> believe therein.’ But how can the attaining <i>of faith</i> be possible to them from a position <i>so</i> far-off, Footnote: <b>Note:</b> It simply means that having distanced themselves earlier from it, they could not attain faith at the time of punishment.
[34:54] While they had disbelieved in it before? And they are uttering conjectures from a far-off place. Footnote: <b>Verily, they had rejected it earlier, indulging in wild conjectures from a distant position.</b>
[34:55] And a barrier will be placed between them and that which they long for, as was done with the likes of them before. They <i>too</i> were in disquieting doubt indeed.
[35:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[35:2] All praise belongs to Allah, the Maker of the heavens and the earth, Who employs the angels as messengers, having wings, two, three, and four. He adds to <i>His</i> creation whatever He pleases; for Allah has power over all things.
[35:3] Whatever of mercy Allah grants to men — there is none to withhold it; and whatever He withholds, there is none who can release it after that; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
[35:4] O ye men, remember the favour of Allah towards you. Is there any Creator other than Allah <i>Who</i> provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is none worthy of worship but He. Whither then are you turned away?
[35:5] And if they reject thee, verily, <i>God’s</i> Messengers have been rejected before thee; and unto Allah <i>all</i> things are brought back <i>for decision</i>.
[35:6] O ye men, assuredly the promise of Allah is true, so let not the present life deceive you, nor let the Deceiver deceive you with respect to Allah.
[35:7] Surely Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He calls his followers only that they may become inmates of the burning Fire.
[35:8] For those who disbelieve there is a severe punishment. And for those who believe and do good works there is forgiveness and a great reward.
[35:9] Is he, then, to whom the evil of his deed is made <i>to appear</i> pleasing, so that he looks upon it as good, <i>like him who believes and does good deeds</i>? Surely, Allah adjudges astray whom He will and guides whom He will. So let not thy soul waste away in sighing for them. Surely Allah knows what they do. Footnote: Is he, then, <b>whose deeds are made to appear beautiful to him as he views them as good <i>like one who believes and truly does good deeds?</i></b>
[35:10] And Allah it is Who sends the winds which raise the clouds; then do We drive them to a lifeless tract of land, and quicken thereby the earth after its death. Likewise <i>shall</i> the Resurrection <i>be</i>.
[35:11] Whoso desires honour, then <i>let him know that</i> all honour belongs to Allah. Unto Him ascend good words, and righteous work does He exalt. And those who plot evils — for them is a severe punishment; and the plotting of such will perish. Footnote: <b>Whoever</b> desires honour, then <i>let him know that</i> all honour belongs to Allah. <b>To</b> Him ascend good words and righteous work <b>helps them rise.</b> And those who plot evils, for them is a severe punishment; and the plotting of such will perish.
[35:12] And Allah created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then He made you pairs. And no female conceives, nor does she bring forth <i>a child</i> without His knowledge. And no one whose life is prolonged has <i>his</i> life prolonged, nor is anything diminished of his life, but <i>it is recorded</i> in a Book. That surely is easy for Allah.
[35:13] And the two seas are not alike: this one palatable, sweet <i>and</i> pleasant to drink, and the other, salt <i>and</i> bitter. And from each you eat fresh meat, and take forth ornaments which you wear. And thou seest the ships therein ploughing <i>the waves</i> that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may be grateful.
[35:14] He merges the night into the day, and He merges the day into the night. And He has pressed into service the sun and the moon; each one runs <i>its</i> course to an appointed term. Such is Allah, your Lord; His is the kingdom, and those whom you call upon beside Allah own not even a whit.
[35:15] If you call on them, they will not hear your call; and even if they heard it, they could not answer you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your having associated <i>them with God</i>. And none can inform thee like the <i>One Who is</i> All-Aware.
[35:16] O ye men, it is you that stand in need of Allah, but Allah is He Who is Self-Sufficent, the Praiseworthy. Footnote: O ye men, <b>you are mere beggars unto Allah, while Allah is He Who stands in need of none. Ever Praiseworthy.</b>
[35:17] If He please, He could destroy you, and bring a new creation <i>instead</i>.
[35:18] And that is not difficult for Allah.
[35:19] And no burdened <i>soul</i> can bear the burden of another; and if a heavily laden <i>soul</i> call another to <i>bear</i> its load, naught of it shall be carried <i>by the other</i>, even though he be a kinsman. Thou canst warn only those who fear their Lord in secret and observe Prayer. And whoso purifies himself, purifies himself only to his own advantage; and to Allah shall be the return.
[35:20] And the blind and the seeing are not alike,
[35:21] Nor the darkness and light,
[35:22] Nor the shade and heat.
[35:23] Nor alike are the living and the dead. Surely, Allah causes him to hear whom He pleases; and thou canst not make those to hear who are in the graves.
[35:24] Thou art only a Warner.
[35:25] Verily, We have sent thee with the truth, <i>as</i> a bearer of glad tidings and <i>as</i> a Warner; and there is no people to whom a Warner has not been sent.
[35:26] And if they treat thee as a liar, those who were before them <i>also</i> treated <i>their Prophets</i> as liars. Their Messengers came to them with clear Signs, and with the Scriptures, and with the illuminating Book.
[35:27] Then I seized those who disbelieved and how <i>terrible</i> was the change I <i>brought about</i>!
[35:28] Dost thou not see that Allah sends down water from the sky and We bring forth therewith fruits of different colours; and among the mountains are streaks white and red, of diverse hues and others raven black;
[35:29] And of men and beasts and cattle, in like manner, there are various colours? Only those of His servants who possess knowledge fear Allah. Verily, Allah is Mighty, Most Forgiving.
[35:30] Surely, <i>only</i> those who follow the Book of Allah and observe Prayer and spend out of what We have provided for them, secretly and openly, hope for a bargain which will never fail;
[35:31] In order that He may give them their full rewards, and <i>even</i> increase them out of His bounty. He is surely Most Forgiving, Most Appreciating.
[35:32] And the Book which We have revealed to thee is the truth <i>itself</i>, fulfilling that which is before it. Surely, Allah is All-Aware, All-Seeing with respect to His servants.
[35:33] Then We gave the Book for an inheritance to those of Our servants whom We chose. And of them are <i>some</i> who are breaking down their own selves <i>by suppressing their desires</i>, and of them are <i>some</i> who keep to the right course, and of them are <i>some</i> who excel <i>others</i> in acts of goodness by Allah’s leave. And that <i>indeed</i> is the great distinction.
[35:34] Gardens of Eternity! They will enter them. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold, and pearls; and their garments therein will be of silk.
[35:35] And they will say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah Who has removed grief from us. Surely, our Lord is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciating,
[35:36] ‘Who has, out of His bounty, settled us in the Adobe of Eternity, where no toil will touch us, nor any <i>sense of</i> weariness affect us therein.’
[35:37] But <i>as for</i> those who disbelieve, for them is the fire of Hell. Death will not be decreed for them so that they may die; nor will the punishment thereof be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every ungrateful person. Footnote: But <i>as for</i> those who disbelieve, for them is the fire of Hell. <b>It will not be decreed for them that they may die;</b> nor will the punishment thereof be lightened for them.

[35:39] Verily, Allah knows the secrets of the heavens and of the earth. Verily, He knows full well all <i>that lies hidden</i> in the breasts.
[35:40] He it is Who made you vicegerents in the earth. So he who disbelieves, will <i>himself</i> suffer <i>the consequences of</i> his disbelief. And for the disbelievers their disbelief will only increase odium in the sight of their Lord, and their disbelief will increase for the disbelievers nothing but loss.

[35:42] Surely, Allah holds the heavens and the earth lest they deviate <i>from their places</i>. And if they did deviate, none can hold them after Him. Verily, He is Forbearing, Most Forgiving.
[35:43] And they swore by Allah their strongest oaths, that if a Warner came to them, they would follow guidance better than any other people. But when a Warner did come to them, it only increased them in aversion,
[35:44] Out of arrogance in the earth and evil plotting. But the evil plot encompasses none but the authors thereof. But thou wilt never find any change in the way of Allah; nor wilt thou ever find any alteration in the way of Allah.

When said in praise, <i>huwa baidatul balad</i> (<b></b>) means: He is like an ostrich egg in which is the young bird, because the male ostrich in that case protects it; or he is unequalled in nobility, like the egg that is left alone; or he is a lord, or chief; or he is the unequalled of the <i>balad</i> (<b></b>) (country or the like) to whom others resort, and whose words they accept or he is celebrated, or well-known, person. Thus <i>baidun maknun</i> (<b></b>) would mean the pride of paradise well guarded and well protected.

[37:114] And We bestowed blessings on him and Isaac. And among their progeny are <i>some</i> who do good and others who clearly wrong themselves. Footnote: And We bestowed blessings on him and Isaac. <b>And from among the progeny of both there is many a doer of good and many a one who is manifestly cruel to himself.</b> <b>Note:</b> The word <i>zalim</i> (<b></b>) (cruel) or <i>zulm</i> (<b></b>) (cruelty) is not always used as condemnation without exception in the Holy Qur’an. When used in this sense it covers all categories of deviation from the right path. Yet, there are some exceptions where it is used to signify praiseworthiness. In 35:33 (Al-Fatir), it is evident that God has included amongst His chosen servants, such people as are <i>zalimun linafsihi</i> (<b></b>) who treat themselves cruelly as they survive in the path of Allah. In the same category those belonging to the comparatively higher order are mentioned as <i>muqtasid</i> (<b></b>) and <i>sabiq bilkhairat</i> (<b></b>). (Fatir Ch:35 Verse 33) Similarly, to bring oneself to do good deeds requires a measure of harshness and cruelty to oneself during early stages of spiritual struggle. Those who do it for the sake of God are evidently praiseworthy, yet they are spoken of as <i>zalimun linafsihi</i> (<b></b>) (cruel to himself).

[39:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[39:2] The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
[39:3] Surely it is We Who have revealed the Book to thee with truth; so worship Allah, being sincere to Him in obedience. Footnote: Surely it is We Who have revealed the Book to <b>you</b> with truth; so worship Allah, <b>dedicating your faith to Him in all sincerity.</b>
[39:4] Hearken, it is to Allah <i>alone</i> that sincere obedience is due. And those who take for protectors others beside Him <i>say</i>, ‘We serve them only that they may bring us near to Allah in station.’ Surely, Allah will judge between them concerning that wherein they differ. Surely, Allah guides not him who is an ungrateful liar.
[39:5] If Allah had desired to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen whom He pleased out of what He creates. Holy is He! He is Allah, the One, the Most Supreme. Footnote: He is Allah, <b>the only One, the Dominant.</b>
[39:6] He created the heavens and the earth in accordance with the requirements of wisdom. He makes the night to cover the day, and He makes the day to cover the night; and He has pressed the sun and the moon into service; each pursues <i>its</i> course until an appointed time. Hearken, <i>it is</i> He <i>alone Who</i> is the Mighty, the Great Forgiver.
[39:7] He created you from a single being; then from that He made its mate; and He has sent down for you eight <i>head</i> of cattle in pairs. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in threefold darkness. This is Allah, your Lord. His is the kingdom. There is no God but He. Whither then are you being turned away? Footnote: He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, <b>in three tiers of darkness.</b>
[39:8] If you are ungrateful, surely Allah is Self-Sufficient <i>being independent</i> of you. And He is not pleased with ingratitude in His servants. But if you show gratefulness, He likes it in you. And no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return; And He will inform you of what you have been doing. Surely, He knows full well all that is hidden in the breasts.
[39:9] And when an affliction befalls a man, he calls upon his Lord, turning <i>penitently</i> to Him. Then, when He confers upon him a favour from Himself, he forgets what he used to pray for before, and begins to assign rivals to Allah, that he may lead <i>men</i> astray from His way. Say, ‘Benefit thyself with thy disbelief a little while; thou art surely of the inmates of the Fire.’
[39:10] Is he who prays devoutly <i>to God</i> in the hours of the night, prostrating himself and standing, <i>and</i> fears the Hereafter and hopes for the mercy of his Lord, <i>like him who does not do so</i>? Say, ‘Are those who know equal to those who know not?’ Verily, only those endowed with understanding will take heed. Footnote: Say, ‘<b>Can those who know and those who do not know be equal</b>?’ Verily, only those endowed with understanding will take heed.
[39:11] Say, ‘O ye My servants who believe, fear your Lord. There is good for those who do good in this life. And Allah’s earth is spacious. Verily the steadfast will have their reward without measure.’
[39:12] Say, ‘Verily I am commanded to worship Allah, being sincere to Him in religion.
[39:13] ‘And I am commanded to be the first of those who submit <i>to Him</i>.’
[39:14] Say, ‘Indeed I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of the great day.’
[39:15] Say, ‘It is Allah I worship, being sincere to Him in my religion.
[39:16] ‘So worship what you like beside Him.’ Say, ‘Surely the losers will be those who ruin their souls and <i>ruin</i> their families on the Day of Resurrection.’ Beware! that will surely be the manifest loss.
[39:17] They will have over them coverings of fire, and beneath them <i>similar</i> coverings. It is this against which Allah warns His servants. ‘O My servants, take Me, then, for your Protector.’ Footnote: <b>Hence, ‘O My servants! Fear Me alone.’</b>
[39:18] And those who shun false gods lest they worship them and turn to Allah — for them is glad tidings. So give glad tidings to My servants,
[39:19] Who listen to the Word and follow the best thereof. It is they whom Allah has guided, and it is they who are men of understanding.
[39:20] Is he, then, against whom the sentence of punishment has become due <i>fit to be rescued</i>? Canst thou rescue him who is in the Fire?
[39:21] But for them who fear their Lord there are lofty mansions built over lofty mansions, beneath which rivers flow. Allah has made that promise; <i>and</i> Allah breaks not <i>His</i> promise.
[39:22] Hast thou not seen that Allah sends down water from the sky, and causes it to flow in <i>the form of</i> streamlets in the earth and then brings forth thereby herbage, varying in its colours? Then it dries up and thou seest it turn yellow; then He reduces it to broken straw. In that verily is a reminder for men of understanding.
[39:23] Is he then whose bosom Allah has opened for <i>the acceptance of</i> Islam, so that he possesses a light from his Lord, <i>like him who is groping in the darkness of disbelief</i> ? Woe, then, to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah! They are in manifest error.
[39:24] Allah has sent down the best Message <i>in the form of</i> a Book, <i>whose verses are</i> mutually supporting <i>and</i> repeated <i>in diverse forms</i> at which do creep the skins of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts soften to the remembrance of Allah. Such is the guidance of Allah; He guides therewith whom He pleases. And he whom Allah adjudges astray — he shall have no guide.
[39:25] Is he, then, who has nothing but his own face to protect him with from the evil punishment on the Day of Resurrection <i>like him who is secure</i>? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, ‘Taste ye what you used to earn.’
[39:26] Those who were before them rejected <i>Our Messengers</i>, so the punishment came upon them whence they knew not.
[39:27] So Allah made them taste humiliation in the present life and the punishment of the Hereafter will certainly be greater, if they but knew!
[39:28] And, indeed, We have set forth to men all kinds of parables in this Qur’an that they may take heed.
[39:29] <i>We have revealed</i> the Qur’an in Arabic wherein there is no deviation from rectitude, that they may become righteous. Footnote: <i>We have revealed</i> the Qur’an <b>manifestly clear, with no crookedness <i>about it,</i></b> that they may become righteous.
[39:30] Allah sets forth a parable: a man belonging to several partners, disagreeing with one another, and a man belonging wholly to one man. Are they both equal in condition? All praise belongs to Allah. But most of them know not. Footnote: Allah sets forth a parable; a man belonging to several partners, disagreeing with one another, <b>and a man belonging exclusively to one man.</b> Are they both equal <b>in example</b>?
[39:31] Surely thou wilt die, and surely they <i>too</i> will die.
[39:32] Then surely on the Day of Resurrection you will dispute with one another before your Lord.

[39:38] And he whom Allah guides — there is none to lead him astray. Is not Allah the Mighty, the Lord of retribution?
[39:39] And if thou ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’, they will surely say, ‘Allah.’ Say, ‘What think ye, if Allah intends to do me an injury, will those whom you call upon beside Allah be able to remove the injury inflicted by Him? Or if He wills to show me mercy, could they withhold His mercy?’ Say, ‘Allah is sufficient for me. In Him trust those who would trust.’
[39:40] Say, ‘O my people, act as <i>best</i> you can; I <i>too</i> am acting; soon shall you know,
[39:41] ‘Who it is unto whom comes a punishment that will disgrace him, and on whom there descends an abiding punishment.’
[39:42] Verily, We have revealed to thee the Book with truth for <i>the good of</i> mankind. So whoever follows guidance, <i>follows it</i> for the benefit of his own soul; and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to its detriment. And thou art not a guardian over them.
[39:43] Allah takes away the souls of human beings at the time of their death; and during their sleep of those <i>also</i> that are not <i>yet</i> dead. And then He retains those against which He has decreed death, and sends <i>back</i> the others till an appointed term. In that surely are Signs for a people who reflect. Footnote: Allah takes away the souls of <b>the living</b> at the time of their death;
[39:44] Have they taken intercessors beside Allah? Say, ‘Even if they have no power over anything and no intelligence?’
[39:45] Say, ‘All intercession rests with Allah. To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And to Him then shall you be brought back.’
[39:46] And when Allah alone is mentioned the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter shrink with aversion; but when those beside Him are mentioned, behold, they begin to rejoice. Footnote: And when Allah alone is mentioned the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter <b>wince in</b> aversion; but when those beside Him are mentioned, behold, they begin to rejoice.
[39:47] Say, ‘O Allah! Originator of the heavens and the earth; Knower of the unseen and the seen; Thou <i>alone</i> wilt judge between Thy servants concerning that in which they differed.’
[39:48] And even if the wrongdoers possessed all that is in the earth, and the like thereof in addition to it, they would surely <i>seek to</i> ransom themselves with it from the evil punishment on the Day of Resurrection; but there shall appear unto them, from Allah, that which they never thought of.
[39:49] And the evil <i>consequences</i> of what they had earned will become apparent to them and that which they used to mock at will encompass them.
[39:50] And when trouble touches man, he cries unto Us. But when We bestow on him a favour from Us, he says, ‘This has been given to me on account of <i>my own</i> knowledge.’ Nay, it is only a trial; but most of them know not.
[39:51] Those who were before them said the same thing, yet all that they had earned availed them not;
[39:52] So the evil <i>consequences</i> of what they had earned overtook them; and those who do wrong from among these <i>disbelievers</i> — the evil <i>consequences</i> of what they earned shall also overtake them. They cannot escape.
[39:53] Know they not that Allah enlarges the provision for whomsoever He pleases, and straitens <i>it for whomsoever He pleases</i>? Verily, in that are Signs for a people who believe.
[39:54] Say, “O My servants who have committed excesses against their own souls! despair not of the mercy of Allah, surely Allah forgives all sins. Verily He is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[39:55] “And turn ye to your Lord, and submit yourselves to Him, before there comes unto you the punishment; <i>for</i> then you shall not be helped.
[39:56] “And follow the best <i>teaching</i> that has been revealed to you from your Lord, before the punishment comes upon you unawares, while you perceive not;
[39:57] “Lest a soul should say, ‘O my grief for my remissness <i>in my duty</i> in respect of Allah! and surely I was among those who scoffed;’ Footnote: “Lest a soul should say, ‘O, my grief! <b>I fell short <i>in my conduct</i> despite being in the presence of Allah and surely I was of those who scoffed.’</b>
[39:58] “Or lest it should say, ‘If Allah had guided me, I should certainly have been among the righteous;’
[39:59] “Or lest it should say, when it sees the punishment, ‘Would that there were for me a return <i>to the world</i>, I would then be among those who do good!’”
[39:60] <i>God will answer</i>, ‘Aye, there came to thee My Signs, but thou didst treat them as lies, and thou wast arrogant, and thou wast of the disbelievers.’
[39:61] And on the Day of Resurrection, thou wilt see those who lied against Allah with their faces blackened. Is there not in Hell an abode for the proud?
[39:62] And Allah will deliver the righteous <i>and lead them</i> to a place of security and success; evil shall not touch them, nor shall they grieve. Footnote: <b>Allah delivers those who fear <i>Him</i> to their rightful</b> place of security and success;
[39:63] Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is Guardian over all things.
[39:64] To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth; and as for those who disbelieve in the Signs of Allah, these it is who are the losers.
[39:65] Say, ‘Is it other <i>gods</i> than Allah that you bid me worship, O ye ignorant ones?’
[39:66] And verily it has been revealed to thee as unto those before thee: ‘If thou attribute partners <i>to God</i>, thy work shall surely go vain and thou shalt certainly be of the losers.’
[39:67] Aye, worship Allah and be among the thankful.
[39:68] And they do not esteem Allah, with the esteem that is due to Him. And the whole earth will be <i>but</i> His handful on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand. Glory to Him and exalted is He above that which they associate <i>with Him</i>. Footnote: <b>They did not pay proper respect to the Majesty of Allah as was due to it. And the earth will be entirely in His grasp on Doomsday; so will the heavens be rolled up by His right hand.</b>
[39:69] And the trumpet will be blown, and <i>all</i> who are in the heavens and <i>all</i> who are in the earth will <i>fall down in a</i> swoon, except those whom Allah will please <i>to exempt</i>. Then will it be blown a second time, and lo! they will be standing, awaiting.
[39:70] And the earth will shine with the light of her Lord, and the Book will be laid <i>open before them</i>, and the Prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and judgment will be given between them with justice, and they will not be wronged.
[39:71] And every soul will be fully rewarded for what it did. And He knows full well what they do.
[39:72] And those who disbelieve will be driven to Hell in troops until, when they reach it, its gates will be opened, and its Keepers will say to them: ‘Did not Messengers from among yourselves come to you, reciting unto you the Signs of your Lord, and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?’ They will say, ‘Yea, but the sentence of punishment has become justly due against the disbelievers.’
[39:73] It will be said, ‘Enter ye the gates of Hell, abiding therein. And evil is the abode of the arrogant.’
[39:74] And those who feared their Lord will be conducted to Heaven in groups until, when they reach it, and its gates are opened, and its Keepers say to them, ‘Peace be upon you! be ye happy, and enter it abiding <i>therein</i>;’
[39:75] And they will say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah Who has fulfilled His promise to us, and has given us the land for an inheritance, making our abode in the Garden wherever we please.’ How excellent then is the reward of the <i>righteous</i> workers!
[39:76] And thou wilt see the angels going round the Throne, glorifying their Lord with <i>His</i> praise. And it will be judged between them with justice. And it will be said: ‘All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.’

So forgive those who repent and follow Thy way; and protect them from the punishment of Hell.
