[41:12] Then He turned to the heaven while it was <i>something like</i> smoke, and said to it and to the earth: ‘Come ye both of you, willingly or unwillingly.’ They said, ‘We come willingly.’
[41:13] So He completed them into seven heavens in two days, and He revealed to each heaven its function. And We adorned the lowest heaven with lamps <i>for light</i> and for protection. That is the decree of the Mighty, the All-Knowing.
[41:14] But if they turn away, then say: ‘I warn you of a destructive punishment like the punishment which <i>overtook</i> ‘Ad and Thamud.’
[41:15] When their Messengers came to them from before them and behind them, <i>saying</i>: ‘Worship none but Allah,’ they said: ‘If our Lord had <i>so</i> willed, He would have certainly sent down angels. So we do disbelieve in that with which you have been sent.’
[41:16] As for ‘Ad, they behaved arrogantly in the earth without any justification and said, ‘Who is mightier than we in power?’ Do they not see that Allah, Who created them, is mightier than they in power? Still they continued to deny Our Signs.
[41:17] So We sent upon them a furious wind for several ominous days, that We might make them taste the punishment of humiliation in this life. And the punishment of the Hereafter will surely be more humiliating, and they will not be helped.
[41:18] And as for Thamud, We gave them guidance, but they preferred blindness to guidance, so the calamity of a humiliating punishment seized them, on account of what they had earned.
[41:19] And We saved those who believed and acted righteously.
[41:20] And on the day when the enemies of Allah will be gathered together and driven to the Fire, they will be goaded on. Footnote: And on the day when the enemies of Allah <b>will be flocked together and led to the fire, they will be marched in order.</b>
[41:21] Till, when they reach it, their ears and their eyes and their skins will bear witness against them as to what they had been doing.
[41:22] And they will say to their skins: ‘Why bear ye witness against us?’ They will say: ‘Allah has made us to speak as He has made everything <i>else</i> to speak. And He it is Who created you the first time, and unto Him have you been brought back.
[41:23] ‘And you did not fear <i>while committing sins</i> that your ears and your eyes and your skins would bear witness against you, nay, you thought that <i>even</i> Allah did not know much of what you used to do.
[41:24] ‘And that thought of yours, which you entertained concerning your Lord, has ruined you. So <i>now</i> you have become of those who are lost.’
[41:25] Now if they can endure, the Fire is their abode; and if they ask for forgiveness, they are not of those whom forgiveness can be shown. Footnote: Now if they can endure, the Fire is their abode; and if they <b>seek a hearing</b> they will not be <b>of those who are heard.</b>
[41:26] And We had assigned for them companions who made <i>to appear</i> attractive to them what was before them and what was behind them; and the sentence became due against them along with the communities of Jinn and mankind that had gone before them. Surely, they were <i>the</i> losers. Footnote: And We had assigned for them companions who made <i>to appear</i> attractive to them <b>that which had gone before and that which lay ahead of them; and the judgement was passed against them as it was passed regarding the peoples before them belonging to the Jinn <i>(great people)</i> or common men.</b> Surely, they were <i>the</i> losers.
[41:27] And those who disbelieve say: ‘Listen not to this Qur’an, but make noise during its <i>recital</i> that you may have the upper hand.’
[41:28] And most certainly We will make those who disbelieve taste a severe punishment, and, most certainly, We will requite them for the worst of their deeds.
[41:29] That is the reward of the enemies of Allah — the Fire. For them there will be an abiding home therein as a requital because they used to deny Our Signs.
[41:30] And those who disbelieve will say, ‘Our Lord, show us those who led us astray from among both the Jinn and men, that we may put them under our feet so that both of them may become of the lowest.’
[41:31] <i>As for</i> those who say, ‘Our Lord is Allah,’ and then remain steadfast, the angels descend on them, <i>saying</i>: ‘Fear ye not, nor grieve; and rejoice in the Garden that you were promised.
[41:32] ‘We are your friends in this life and in the Hereafter. Therein you will have all that your souls will desire, and therein you will have all that you will ask for — 
[41:33] ‘An entertainment from the Most Forgiving, the Merciful.’
[41:34] And who is better in speech than he who invites <i>men</i> to Allah and does good works and says, ‘I am surely of those who submit?’
[41:35] And good and evil are not alike. Repel <i>evil</i> with that which is best. And lo, he between whom and thyself was enmity will become as though he were a warm friend.
[41:36] But none is granted it save those who are steadfast; and none is granted it save those who possess a large share of good. Footnote: But none is granted <b>that</b> save those who are steadfast; and none is granted <b>that except the one who possesses a large share <i>of excellence</i></b>.
[41:37] And if an incitement from Satan incite thee, then seek refuge in Allah. Surely He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
[41:38] And among His Signs are the night and the day and the sun and the moon. Prostrate not yourselves before the sun, nor before the moon, but prostrate yourselves before Allah, Who created them, if it is Him Whom you <i>really</i> worship.
[41:39] But if they turn away with disdain <i>they do it to their own detriment</i>, while those who are with thy Lord glorify Him night and day, and they are never wearied.
[41:40] And among His Signs is <i>this</i>: that thou seest the earth <i>lying</i> withered, but when We send down water on it, it stirs and swells <i>with verdure</i>. Surely, He Who quickened it can quicken the dead. Verily He has power over all things. Footnote: And among His signs is <i>this</i>: that <b>you see the earth dried up</b>, but when We send down water on it, it stirs and swells <i>with verdure.</i>
[41:41] Surely, those who deviate <i>from the right path</i> with respect to Our Signs are not hidden from Us. Is he, then, who is cast into the Fire better or he who comes out safe on the Day of Resurrection? Do what you will. Surely He sees all that you do. Footnote: Surely, those who <b>quarrel regarding Our signs</b> are not hidden from Us.
[41:42] Those who disbelieve in the Reminder when it comes to them <i>are the losers</i>. And, truly, it is a mighty Book.
[41:43] Falsehood cannot approach it <i>either</i> from before or from behind it. <i>It is</i> a revelation from the Wise, the Praiseworthy.
[41:44] Nothing is said to thee but what was said to the Messengers before thee. Thy Lord is indeed the Master of forgiveness; and <i>also</i> the Master of painful chastisement.
[41:45] And if We had made it a Qur’an in a foreign tongue, they surely would have said, ‘Why have not its verses been made clear? What! a foreign tongue and an Arab?’ Say, ‘It is a guidance and a healing for those who believe.’ But <i>as to those</i> who believe not, there is a deafness in their ears, and it is blindness for them. They are, <i>as it were</i>, being called to from a far off place.
[41:46] And We did give Moses the Book, but differences were created concerning it; and had it not been for a word that had gone before from thy Lord, <i>the matter</i> would have been decided between them; and certainly they are in a disquieting doubt about it.
[41:47] Whoso does right, it is for his own soul; and whoso does evil, it will <i>only go</i> against it. And thy Lord is not at all unjust to <i>His</i> servants.
[41:48] To Him <i>alone</i> is referred the knowledge of the Hour. And no fruits come forth from their spathes, nor does any female bear <i>a child</i>, nor does she give birth <i>to it</i>, but with His knowledge. And on the day when He will call unto them, <i>saying</i>, “Where are My ‘Partners’?” they will say, ‘We declare unto Thee, not one of us is a witness <i>thereto</i>.’ Footnote: <b>And <i>think of</i> the day when He will call them,</b> <i>saying</i>, ‘Where are <b>the</b> partners <b>attributed to Me?’</b> They will say, ‘We declare <b>to You, there is none among us as</b> a witness <b><i>to that.’</i></b>
[41:49] And all that they used to call upon before will be lost to them, and they will know for certain that they have no place of escape. Footnote: And all that they used to call upon before will be lost to them, <b>then will they realize that there is no escape for them.</b>
[41:50] Man does not tire of praying for good; but if evil touch him, he despairs, <i>and</i> gives up <i>all</i> hope.
[41:51] And if We make him taste of mercy from Ourself, after <i>some</i> affliction that has befallen him, he will surely say, ‘This is my due; and I do not think the Hour will <i>ever</i> come. But if I am returned to my Lord, I shall surely have with Him the very best.’ Then We will surely tell the disbelievers all that they did, and We will certainly make them taste hard punishment.
[41:52] And when We bestow a favour on man, he goes away, turning aside; but when evil touches him, lo! he <i>starts</i> offering long prayers. Footnote: And when We bestow a favour on man, <b>he ignores <i>it</i> and turns aside;</b> but when evil touches him, lo! <b>there he is a supplicant of long prayers.</b>
[41:53] Say, ‘Tell me: if it is from Allah but you disbelieve in it — who is more astray than one who has drifted away <i>from Allah</i>?’
[41:54] Soon We will show them Our Signs in all parts <i>of the earth</i>, and among their own people until it becomes manifest to them that it is the truth. Is it not enough that thy Lord is Witness over all things? Footnote: Soon We will show them Our Signs <b><i>appearing</i> on the horizon and within themselves</b> until it becomes manifest to them that it is the truth.
[41:55] Aye, they are surely in doubt concerning the meeting with their Lord. Aye, He certainly encompasses all things.
[42:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[42:2] Ha Mim. Footnote: The Praiseworthy, the Lord of Honour.
[42:3] ‘Ain Sin Qaf. Footnote: The All-Knowing, the All-Hearing, the Possessor of Power.
[42:4] Thus has Allah, the Mighty, the Wise, been revealing to thee and to those that preceded thee. Footnote: <b>Thus Allah, the Mighty, the Wise, reveals to you and has revealed to those that preceded you.</b>
[42:5] To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He is the High, the Great.
[42:6] The heavens may well-nigh rend asunder from above them; and the angels glorify their Lord with His praise and ask forgiveness for those on the earth. Behold! it is surely Allah Who is the Most Forgiving, the Merciful. Footnote: <b>The heavens may rend asunder in their celestial heights</b>; and the angels glorify their Lord with His praise and ask forgiveness for those on the earth.
[42:7] And <i>as for</i> those who take <i>for themselves</i> protectors beside Him, Allah watches over them; and thou art not a guardian over them.
[42:8] Thus have We revealed to thee the Qur’an in Arabic, that thou mayest warn the Mother of towns, and all around it; and <i>that</i> thou mayest warn <i>them</i> of the Day of Gathering whereof there is no doubt: A party <i>will be</i> in the Garden, and a party in the blazing Fire. Footnote: Thus have We revealed to <b>you</b> the Qur’an in Arabic that <b>you may</b> warn the Mother of <b>townships</b>, and all around it; and <i>that</i> <b>you may</b> warn <i>them</i> of the Day of Gathering whereof there is no doubt; <b>A section will abide in the gardens <i>of paradise</i> and a section will be in a blazing Fire.</b> <b>Note:</b> The first house ever built for the purpose of worship of Allah was <i>alka’bah</i> (<b></b>) situated in a township named Mecca. It is this township which is referred to as <i>umm-ul-Qura’</i> (<b></b>) (the mother of all townships). This expression may signify its importance with relation to all other cities or it may also literally mean to be the first township ever built. In that case it would imply that in the ancient times, in the same place where Mecca is situated, a township gradually grew around the house of God when it was initially built by some unknown people. Mankind learned to build townships in imitation of this. As such it can be referred to as the mother of all townships.
[42:9] And if Allah had <i>so</i> pleased, He could have made them one people; but He admits into His mercy whomsoever He pleases. And <i>as for</i> the wrongdoers, they will have no protector and no helper.
[42:10] Have they taken <i>for themselves</i> protectors other than Him? But it is Allah Who is the <i>real</i> Protector. And He quickens the dead, and He has power over all things.
[42:11] And in whatsoever you differ, the decision thereof <i>rests</i> with Allah. <i>Say</i>: ‘Such is Allah, my Lord; in Him I put my trust, and to Him I <i>always</i> turn.’
[42:12] <i>He is</i> the Maker of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you pairs of your own selves, and of the cattle <i>also He has made</i> pairs. He multiplies you therein. There is nothing whatever like unto Him; and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. Footnote: <i>He is</i> the <b>Prime Creator</b> of the heavens and the earth. <b>He made pairs from among you and also pairs from among the cattle for your benefit.</b>
[42:13] To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He enlarges the provision for whomsoever He pleases and straitens <i>it for whomsoever He pleases</i>. Surely, He knows all things full well.
[42:14] He has prescribed for you the religion which He enjoined on Noah, and which We have revealed to thee, and which We enjoined on Abraham and Moses and Jesus, <i>saying</i>, ‘Remain steadfast in obedience, and be not divided therein. Hard upon the idolaters is that to which thou callest them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He pleases, and guides to Himself him who turns <i>to Him</i>.’
[42:15] And they did not become divided but after knowledge had come to them, through jealousy among themselves. And had it not been for a word that had already gone forth from thy Lord for an appointed term, <i>the matter</i> would surely have been decided between them. And surely those who were made to inherit the Book after them are in a disquieting doubt concerning it. Footnote: <b>They did not differ and split, but after knowledge had come to them, <i>they did so</i> out of envy against each other.</b>
[42:16] To this, then, do thou invite <i>mankind</i>. And be thou steadfast as thou art commanded, and follow not their evil inclinations, but say, ‘I believe in whatever Book Allah has sent down, and I am commanded to judge justly between you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. For us is the reward of our works, and for you the reward of your works. There is no quarrel between us and you. Allah will gather us together, and to Him is the return.’
[42:17] And those who dispute concerning Allah after He has been accepted — their dispute is futile in the sight of their Lord; and on them is <i>God</i>’<i>s</i> wrath and for them will be a severe punishment.
[42:18] Allah it is Who has sent down the Book with truth and <i>also</i> the Balance. And what will make thee know that the Hour may be near at hand?
[42:19] Those who believe not therein seek to hasten it; but those who believe are fearful of it, and know that it is the truth. Beware! those who dispute concerning the Hour are in error, far gone.
[42:20] Allah is Benignant to His servants. He provides for whom He pleases. And He is the Powerful, the Mighty. Footnote: Allah is <b>exquisitely kind</b> to His servants.
[42:21] Whoso desires the harvest of the Hereafter, We give him increase in his harvest; and whoso desires the harvest of this world, We give him <i>thereof</i>, but in the Hereafter he will have no share.
[42:22] Have they <i>such</i> associates <i>of Allah</i> as have made lawful for them in religion that which Allah has not allowed? And but for <i>Our</i> word about the final judgment, <i>the matter</i> would have been decided <i>by now</i> between them. And surely the wrongdoers will have a grievous punishment.
[42:23] Thou wilt see the wrongdoers in fear on account of that which they have earned, and it is sure to befall them. But those who believe and do good works will be in the meadows of the Gardens. They shall have with their Lord whatever they will desire. That is the great bounty <i>of God</i>.
[42:24] This it is whereof Allah gives the glad tidings to His servants who believe and do good works. Say: ‘I ask of you no reward for it, except <i>that I am inviting you to God because of</i> love of kinship.’ And whoso earns a good deed, We give him increase of good therein. Surely, Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciating. Footnote: Say: ‘I ask of you no reward for it, except <b>a love displayed among kith and kin. And whoever does an act of goodness, We further enhance for him the beauty of his goodness.</b>
[42:25] Do they say, ‘He has forged a lie against Allah?’ If Allah had <i>so</i> willed, He could seal thy heart <i>as He</i> <i>has sealed the hearts of thy enemies</i>. But Allah is blotting out falsehood <i>through thee</i> and is establishing the truth by His words. Surely, He knows full well what is in the breasts. Footnote: Do they say, ‘He has forged a lie against Allah?’ <b>If Allah so willed He could have sealed your heart. But Allah blots out falsehood and establishes truth by His Commands.</b>
[42:26] And He it is Who accepts repentance from His servants, and forgives sins. And He knows what you do.
[42:27] And He accepts <i>the prayers of</i> those who believe and do good works, and gives them more out of His grace; and <i>as for</i> the disbelievers, they will have a severe punishment.
[42:28] And if Allah should enlarge the provision for His servants, they would rebel in the earth; but He sends down according to a <i>proper</i> measure as He pleases. Indeed, He is All-Aware and All-Seeing with regard to His servants.
[42:29] And He it is Who sends down rain after they have despaired, and spreads out His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.
[42:30] And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and <i>of</i> whatever living creatures He has spread forth in both. And He has the power to gather them together when He pleases.
[42:31] And whatever misfortune befalls you, is due to what your own hands have wrought. And He forgives many <i>of your sins</i>.
[42:32] And you cannot frustrate <i>God</i>’<i>s plan</i> in the earth; nor have you any friend or helper beside Allah.
[42:33] And of His Signs are the sailingships on the sea like mountain tops:
[42:34] If He <i>so</i> will, He can cause the wind to become still so that they become motionless upon the surface thereof — in that, surely, are Signs for every person who is most patient and grateful — 
[42:35] Or He can destroy them because of that which they (the men) have earned — but He forgives many <i>of their sins</i> — 
[42:36] And <i>He destroys them so that</i> those who dispute about the Signs of Allah may know <i>that</i> they have no refuge.
[42:37] And whatever you have been given is only a temporary provision of this life, but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord,
[42:38] And who eschew the more grievous sins and indecencies, and, when they are wroth, they forgive,
[42:39] And those who hearken to their Lord, and observe Prayer, and whose affairs are <i>decided</i> by mutual consultation, and who spend out of what We have provided for them,
[42:40] And those who, when a wrong is done to them, defend themselves.
[42:41] And the recompense of an injury is an injury the like thereof; but whoso forgives and <i>his act</i> brings about reformation, his reward is with Allah. Surely, He loves not the wrongdoers.
[42:42] But there is no blame on those who defend themselves after they have been wronged.
[42:43] The blame is only on those who wrong men and transgress in the earth without justification. Such will have a grievous punishment.
[42:44] And he who is patient and forgives — that surely is a matter of strong determination.
[42:45] And he whom Allah adjudges astray — there is no protector for him thereafter. And thou wilt find the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, saying: ‘Is there any way of return?’
[42:46] And thou wilt see them brought before it (the Fire), casting down <i>their eyes</i> on account of disgrace, looking <i>thereat</i> with a stealthy glance. And those who believe will say, ‘The losers indeed are those who ruin themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection.’ Behold! the wrongdoers are <i>to remain</i> in a lasting punishment.
[42:47] And they have no helpers to help them other than Allah. And for him whom Allah adjudges astray there is no way <i>at all</i>.
[42:48] Hearken ye to your Lord before there comes a day for which there will be no averting in opposition to <i>the decree of</i> Allah. There will be no refuge for you on that day, nor will there be for you any <i>possibility of</i> denial.
[42:49] But if they turn away, We have not sent thee as a guardian over them. Thy duty is only to convey <i>the Message</i>. And truly when We cause man to taste of mercy from Us, he rejoices therein. But if an evil befalls them because of what their hands have sent forth, then lo! man is ungrateful.
[42:50] To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He pleases. He bestows daughters upon whom He pleases, and He bestows sons upon whom He pleases;
[42:51] Or He mixes them, males and females; and He makes whom He pleases barren. Surely, He is All- Knowing, Powerful.
[42:52] And it is not for a man that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a veil or by sending a messenger to reveal by His command what He pleases. Surely, He is High, Wise.
[42:53] And thus have We revealed to thee the Word by Our command. Thou didst not know what the Book was, nor what the faith. But We have made it (the revelation) a light, whereby We guide such of Our servants as We please. And truly, thou guidest <i>mankind</i> to the right path,
[42:54] The path of Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Behold! to Allah do all things return.
[43:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[43:2] Ha Mim. Footnote: The Praiseworthy, the Lord of Honour.
[43:3] By this perspicuous Book,
[43:4] We have made it a Qur’an in clear, eloquent language that you may understand.
[43:5] And surely, it is <i>safe</i> with Us in the Mother of the Book, exalted <i>and</i> full of wisdom. Footnote: <b>Note:</b> The phrase <i>umm-ul-Kitab</i> (<b></b>) (Mother of the Book) is commonly applied to the opening chapter of the Qur’an <i>Al-Fatihah</i> (<b></b>) which like a seed has all the basic teachings and characteristics of the Qur’an. But here it seems to apply to the blueprint of the Divine Book which in some form is preserved with God, in dimensions not fully fathomable by man.
[43:6] Shall We then take away the Reminder from you, neglecting <i>you</i> because you are an extravagant people?
[43:7] And how many a Prophet did We send among the earlier peoples!
[43:8] But there never came to them a Prophet but they mocked at him.
[43:9] And We destroyed <i>those</i> who were stronger in power than these, and the example of the earlier peoples has gone before. Footnote: And We destroyed <i>those</i> who were stronger in <b>grip</b> than these, and the example of the earlier peoples has gone before.
[43:10] And if thou ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’, they will surely say, ‘The Mighty, the All-Knowing <i>God</i> created them.’
[43:11] <i>He</i>, Who has made the earth for you a cradle, and has made pathways, for you therein, that you may follow the right way;
[43:12] And Who sends down water from the sky in proper measure, and We thereby quicken a dead land; — even so will you be raised; — 
[43:13] And Who has created all the pairs, and has made for you ships and cattle whereon you ride,
[43:14] That you may sit firmly upon their backs, <i>and</i> then, when you are firmly seated thereon, you may remember the favour of your Lord, and say, ‘Holy is He Who has subjected this to us, and we had not the strength to subdue it <i>ourselves</i>. Footnote: ‘Holy is He Who has subjected this to us, and we, <b>by ourselves, were unable to harness it</b>.
[43:15] ‘And to our Lord surely shall we return.’
[43:16] And a portion of His servants they assert to be His <i>children</i>. Indeed man is clearly ungrateful. Footnote: <b>And they assert some of His servants to be a part of Him.</b> Indeed man is <b>manifestly</b> ungrateful.
[43:17] Has He taken daughters from what He has created, and honoured you with sons?
[43:18] Yet when tidings are given to one of them of that the like of which he ascribes to the Gracious <i>God</i>, his face becomes darkened and he is choked with grief.
[43:19] <i>Do you ascribe to God</i> one who is reared among ornaments, and who is not clear in disputation?
[43:20] And they describe the angels, who are the servants of the Gracious <i>God</i>, as females. Did they witness their creation? Then their testimony will be recorded, and they shall be questioned.
[43:21] And they say, ‘If the Gracious <i>God</i> had <i>so</i> willed, we should not have worshipped them.’ They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do nothing but conjecture.
[43:22] Have We given them a Scripture before this, so that they are holding fast to it?
[43:23] Nay, they say, ‘We found our fathers following a <i>certain</i> course, and we are guided by their footsteps.’
[43:24] And thus <i>has it always been</i> that We never sent any Warner before thee to any township but the evil leaders thereof said: ‘We found our fathers following a <i>certain</i> course, and we are following in their footsteps.’ Footnote: And thus <i>has it always been</i> that We never sent any Warner before <b>you</b> to any township but <b>the prosperous thereof said</b>: ‘<b>We found our ancestors set on a</b> <i>certain</i> course; and we are following in their footsteps.’
[43:25] <i>Their Warner</i> said: ‘What! even though I bring you a better guidance than that which you found your fathers following?’ They said: ‘Certainly we disbelieve in that which you are sent with.’
[43:26] So We punished them. Behold then what was the end of those who rejected <i>the Prophets</i>! Footnote: So <b>We exacted retribution from them</b>.
[43:27] And <i>remember</i> when Abraham said to his father and his people: ‘I <i>positively</i> disown what you worship,
[43:28] ‘Except Him Who created me, and He will surely guide me.’
[43:29] And He made it a byword to last among his posterity, that they might turn <i>to God</i>.
[43:30] Nay, but I allowed them and their fathers <i>temporary</i> enjoyment until there came to them the truth and a Messenger who makes <i>his Message</i> clear.
[43:31] But when the truth came to them they said, ‘This is magic, and we do reject it.’
[43:32] And they say, ‘Why has not this Qur’an been sent to some great man of the two towns?’
[43:33] Is it they who would distribute the mercy of thy Lord? It is We Who distribute among them their livelihood in the present life, and We exalt some of them above others in degrees <i>of rank</i>, so that some of them may make others subservient <i>to themselves</i>. And the mercy of thy Lord is better than that which they amass. Footnote: …and We exalt some of them above others in degrees <i>of rank</i>, <b>but alas merely to result in the subjugation of some by others.</b> And the mercy of <b>your</b> Lord is better than that which they amass.
[43:34] And were it not that mankind would have <i>all</i> become one <i>type of</i> people, We would have given to those who disbelieve in the Gracious <i>God</i>, roofs of silver for their houses, and <i>silver</i> stairways by which they could go up;
[43:35] And doors <i>of silver</i> to their houses, and couches <i>of silver</i>, on which they could recline,
[43:36] And <i>other articles of</i> embellishment. But all that is nothing but a <i>temporary</i> provision of the present life. And the Hereafter with thy Lord is for the righteous.
[43:37] And he who turns away from the remembrance of the Gracious <i>God</i>, We appoint for him a satan, who becomes his companion.
[43:38] And surely they hinder them from the way <i>of God</i>, but they think that they are rightly guided;
[43:39] Till, when such a one comes to Us, he says <i>to his companion</i>, ‘Would that between me and thee were the distance of the East and the West!’ What an evil companion is he!
[43:40] ‘And <i>the fact</i> that you are partners in punishment will not profit you this day for you have acted wrongfully.’ Footnote: <b>‘Having transgressed as you did, your being partners in punishment will be of no avail to you this day.’</b>
[43:41] Canst thou, then, make the deaf hear, or guide the blind and him who is in manifest error?
[43:42] And if We take thee away, We shall surely exact retribution from them,
[43:43] Or We shall show thee that which We have promised them; for surely We have complete power over them.
[43:44] So hold thou fast to that which has been revealed to thee; for thou art on the right path.
[43:45] And, truly, it is <i>a source of</i> eminence for thee and for thy people; and you will be inquired about. Footnote: And, truly, it is <b>a reminder for you and for your people, and you shall be called to account.</b>

[43:60] He was only Our servant on whom We bestowed Our favour, and We made him an example for the children of Israel.
[43:61] And if We <i>so</i> willed, We could make from among you angels in the earth to be successors <i>therein</i>.
[43:62] But verily, he was a sign of the Hour. So have no doubt about it, but follow me. This is the right path. Footnote: But verily, he <b>is</b> a sign of the Hour. So have no doubt about it, but follow me. This is the right path. <b>Note:</b> The word <i>‘al-sa’ah’</i> (<b></b>) literally translated as ‘the Hour’ should be understood in the light of the same expression used in (54:2) <i>Surah Al-Qamar</i>. There the revolutionary changes which were destined to be brought about by the advent of the Holy Prophet Muammad (may peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) are referred to as <i>‘al-sa’ah’</i> (<b></b>). And the splitting of the moon is presented as evidence in favour of the spiritual revolution which was about to take place. The connotation of this term as applied to Jesus in the verse under study should be understood on the same lines. Hence ‘the Hour’ refers to the advent of Jesus in the latter days and the spiritual revolution attendant upon it.
[43:63] And let not Satan hinder you. Surely, he is to you an open enemy.

[43:65] ‘Verily Allah — He is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is the right path.’

[47:4] That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood while those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus does Allah set forth for men their similitudes.

That <i>is the ordinance</i>. And if Allah had <i>so</i> pleased, He could have punished them <i>Himself</i>, but <i>He has willed</i> that He may try some of you by others. And those who are killed in the way of Allah — He will never render their works vain. Footnote: And if Allah had <b>so decided, He could have Himself exacted retribution from them, but He puts some of you to trial at the hands of some others.</b>
[47:6] He will guide them and improve their condition, Footnote: He will guide them and <b>reform their conduct.</b>
[47:7] And admit them into the Garden which He has made known to them. Footnote: And admit them into the garden which <b>He beautified and made distinguished for them.</b>
[47:8] O ye who believe! if you help <i>the cause of</i> Allah, He will help you and will make your steps firm.
[47:9] But <i>as for</i> those who disbelieve, perdition is their <i>lot</i>; and He will make their works vain.
[47:10] That is because they hate what Allah has revealed; so He has made their works futile.
[47:11] Have they not travelled in the earth and seen what was the end of those who were before them? Allah <i>utterly</i> destroyed them, and for the disbelievers there will be the like thereof.
[47:12] That is because Allah is the Protector of those who believe, and as for the disbelievers, there is no protector for them.
[47:13] Verily, Allah will make those who believe and do good works enter the Gardens underneath which rivers flow; while those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat even as the cattle eat, and the Fire will be their resort.
[47:14] And how many a township, more powerful than thy town which has driven thee out, have We destroyed, and they had no helper!
[47:15] Is he then who stands upon a clear proof from his Lord like those to whom the evil of their deeds is made <i>to look</i> beautiful and who follow their evil inclinations?
[47:16] A description of the Garden promised to the righteous: therein are rivers of water which corrupts not; and rivers of milk of which the taste changes not; and rivers of wine, a delight to those who drink, and rivers of clarified honey. And in it will they have all <i>kinds of</i> fruit, and forgiveness from their Lord. Can <i>those who enjoy such bliss</i> be like those who abide in the Fire and who are given boiling water to drink so that it tears their bowels?
[47:17] And among them are some who listen to thee till, when they go forth from thy presence, they say to those who have been given knowledge, ‘What has he been talking about just now?’ These are they whose hearts Allah has sealed, and who follow their own evil inclinations.
[47:18] But <i>as for</i> those who follow guidance, He adds to their guidance, and bestows on them their righteousness.
[47:19] They wait not but for the Hour, that it should come upon them suddenly. The signs thereof have already come. But <i>of</i> what <i>avail</i> will their admonition be to them when it has <i>actually</i> come upon them?
[47:20] Know, therefore, that there is no God other than Allah, and ask forgiveness for thy frailties, and for believing men and believing women. And Allah knows the place where you move about and the place where you stay.
[47:21] And those who believe say, ‘Why is not a Surah revealed?’ But when a decisive Surah is revealed and fighting is mentioned therein, thou seest those in whose hearts is a disease looking towards thee with the look of one who is fainting on account of <i>approaching</i> death. So ruin seize them! Footnote: <b>you will see those whose hearts are diseased looking at you with a look of one dazed by the shadow cast upon him by death.</b> So ruin seize them!
[47:22] Obedience and a kind word <i>is better for them</i>. And when the matter is determined upon, it is good for them if they were true to Allah.
[47:23] Would you then, if you are placed in authority, create disorder in the land and sever your ties of kinship?
[47:24] It is these whom Allah curses so that He makes them deaf and makes their eyes blind.
[47:25] Will they not, then, ponder over the Qur’an, or is it that on the hearts are their locks? Footnote: Will they not, then, ponder over the Qur’an, or is it that <b>upon <i>their</i> hearts are locks of their own <i>making?</i></b>
[47:26] Surely, those who turn their backs after guidance has become manifest to them, Satan has seduced them, and holds out to them false hopes.
[47:27] That is because they said to those who hate what Allah has revealed, ‘We will obey you in some matters;’ and Allah knows their secrets.
[47:28] But how <i>will they fare</i> when the angels will cause them to die, smiting their faces and their backs?
[47:29] This is because they followed that which displeased Allah, and hated that which pleased Him. So He rendered their works vain.
[47:30] Do those in whose hearts is a disease suppose that Allah will not bring to light their malice?
[47:31] And if We pleased, We could show them to thee so that thou shouldst know them by their marks. And thou shalt surely recognize them by the tone of <i>their</i> speech. And Allah knows your deeds.
[47:32] And We will surely try you until We distinguish those among you who strive <i>for the cause of God</i> and those who are steadfast. And We will make known the facts about you. Footnote: And We will surely try you <b>until We know the true strivers among you and the steadfast, and <i>by trial</i> We will bring out your real worth.</b>
[47:33] Those who disbelieve and hinder <i>men</i> from the way of Allah and oppose the Messenger after guidance has become manifest to them, shall not harm Allah in the least; and He will make their works fruitless.
[47:34] O ye who believe! obey Allah and obey the Messenger and let not your works go vain.
[47:35] Verily, those who disbelieve and hinder <i>men</i> from the way of Allah, <i>and</i> then die while they are disbelievers — Allah certainly will not forgive them.
[47:36] So be not slack and sue not for peace; for you will <i>certainly</i> have the upper hand. And Allah is with you, and He will not deprive you of <i>the reward of</i> your actions. Footnote: <b>Do not slacken lest you should sue for peace while you are bound to emerge victorious.</b>
[47:37] The life of <i>this</i> world is but a sport and a pastime, and if you believe and be righteous, He will give you your rewards, and will not ask of you your possessions.
[47:38] If He ask them of you, and press you, you would be niggardly, and He would bring to light your malice.
[47:39] Behold, you are those who are called upon to spend in the way of Allah; but of you there are some who are niggardly. And whoso is niggardly, is niggardly only against his own soul. And Allah is Self- Sufficient, and it is you that are needy. And if you turn your backs, He will bring in your stead a people other than you, then they will not be like you.
[48:1] In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.
[48:2] Verily, We have granted thee a clear victory,
[48:3] That Allah may cover up for thee thy shortcomings, past and future, and that He may complete His favour upon thee, and may guide thee on a right path;
[48:4] And that Allah may help thee with a mighty help.
[48:5] He it is Who sent down tranquillity into the hearts of the believers that they might add faith to their faith — and to Allah belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is All-knowing, Wise — 
[48:6] That He may make the believing men and the believing women enter the Gardens beneath which streams flow, wherein they will abide, and <i>that</i> He may remove their evils from them — and that, in the sight of Allah, is the supreme triumph — 
[48:7] And <i>that</i> He may punish the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women, and the idolatrous men and the idolatrous women, who entertain evil thoughts concerning Allah. On them <i>shall fall</i> an evil calamity; and the wrath of Allah is upon them. And He has cursed them, and has prepared Hell for them. And that indeed is an evil destination. Footnote: <b>Against them will turn the wheel of misfortune,</b> and wrath of Allah is upon them.
[48:8] And to Allah belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is Mighty, Wise.
[48:9] We have sent thee as a Witness and a bearer of glad tidings and a Warner,
[48:10] That you should believe in Allah and His Messenger, and may help him, and honour him, and <i>that</i> you may glorify Him morning and evening.
[48:11] Verily, those who swear allegiance to thee indeed swear allegiance to Allah. The hand of Allah is over their hands. So whoever breaks <i>his oath</i>, breaks <i>it</i> to his own loss; and whoever fulfils the covenant that he has made with Allah, He will surely give him a great reward.
[48:12] Those of the desert Arabs, who were left behind, will say to thee, ‘Our possessions and our families kept us occupied, so ask forgiveness for us.’ They say with their tongues that which is not in their hearts. Say, ‘Who can avail you aught against Allah, if He intends you some harm, or if He intends you some benefit? Nay, Allah is Well-Aware of what you do.
[48:13] ‘Nay, you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never come back to their families, and that was made <i>to appear</i> pleasing to your hearts, and you thought an evil thought, and you were a ruined people.’ Footnote: and you <b>entertained</b> an evil thought, and you were a ruined people.’
[48:14] And <i>as for</i> those who believe not in Allah and His Messenger — We have surely prepared for the disbelievers a blazing fire.
[48:15] And to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He pleases, and punishes whom He pleases. And Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.
[48:16] Those <i>who had managed to be</i> left behind will say, when you go forth to the spoils that you may get them, ‘Let us follow you.’ They seek to change the decree of Allah. Say, ‘You shall not follow us. Thus has Allah said beforehand.’ Then they will say, ‘Nay, but you envy us.’ Not so, but they understand not except a little.
[48:17] Say to the desert Arabs who were left behind, ‘You shall be called <i>to fight</i> against a people of mighty valour; you shall fight them until they surrender. Then, if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward, but if you turn your backs, as you turned your backs before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.’
[48:18] There is no blame on the blind, nor is there blame on the lame, nor is there blame on the sick, <i>if they go not forth for fight</i>. And whoso obeys Allah and His Messenger, He will make him enter the Gardens beneath which streams flow; but whoso turns his back, him will He punish with a grievous punishment.
[48:19] Surely, Allah was well pleased with the believers when they were swearing allegiance to thee under the Tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, and He sent down tranquillity on them, and He rewarded them with a victory near at hand;
[48:20] And great spoils that they will take. And Allah is Mighty, Wise.
[48:21] Allah has promised you great spoils that you will take, and He has given you this in advance, and has restrained the hands of men from you, that it may be a Sign for the believers, and that He may guide you on a right path.
[48:22] And <i>He has promised you</i> another <i>victory</i>, which you have not yet been able to achieve, <i>but</i> Allah has surely compassed it. And Allah has power over all things.
[48:23] And if those who disbelieve should fight you, they would certainly turn their backs; then they would find neither protector nor helper.
[48:24] Such is the law of Allah that has been <i>in operation</i> before; and thou shalt not find any change in the law of Allah. Footnote: Such <b>has been the established practice</b> of Allah that has been <i>in operation</i> before and <b>you shall not find any change in the established practice of Allah.</b>
[48:25] And He it is Who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Mecca, after He had given you victory over them. And Allah sees all that you do.
[48:26] It is they who disbelieved and hindered you from the Sacred Mosque and the offering which was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice. And had it not been for believing men and believing women whom you knew not and whom you might have trampled down so that harm might have come to you on their account unknowingly, <i>He would have permitted you to fight</i>, <i>but He did not do so</i> that He might admit into His mercy whom He will. If they had been separated <i>from the disbelievers</i>, We would have surely punished those of them who disbelieved with a grievous punishment.
[48:27] When those who disbelieved harboured in their hearts prideful indignation, the indignation <i>of the Days</i> of Ignorance, Allah sent down His tranquillity on His Messenger and on the believers, and made them cleave to the principle of righteousness, and they were better entitled to it and more worthy of it. And Allah knows everything full well. Footnote: and made them cleave to the <b>word</b> of righteousness and they were better entitled to it and more worthy of it.
[48:28] Surely has Allah in truth fulfilled for His Messenger the Vision. You will certainly enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allah will, in security, <i>some</i> having <i>their</i> heads shaven, and <i>others</i> having <i>their</i> hair cut short; <i>and</i> you will have no fear. But He knew what you knew not. He has in fact ordained for you, besides that, a victory near at hand.
[48:29] He it is Who has sent His Messenger, with guidance and the Religion of truth, that He may make it prevail over <i>all other</i> religions. And sufficient is Allah as a Witness.
[48:30] Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. And those who are with him are hard against the disbelievers, tender among themselves. Thou seest them bowing <i>and</i> prostrating themselves <i>in Prayer</i>, seeking grace from Allah and <i>His</i> pleasure. Their mark is upon their faces, being the traces of prostrations. This is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is like unto a seed-produce that sends forth its sprout, then makes it strong; it then becomes thick, and stands firm on its stem, delighting the sowers — that He may cause the disbelievers to burn with rage <i>at the sight</i> of them. Allah has promised, unto those of them who believe and do good works, forgiveness and a great reward. Footnote: Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. And those who are with him are <b>firm against the non-believers,</b> tender among themselves.

Such indeed are those who follow the right course,

Then if it returns, make peace between them with equity, and act justly. Verily, Allah loves the just.
[49:11] Surely <i>all</i> believers are brothers. So make peace between brothers, and fear Allah that mercy may be shown to you.
[49:12] O ye who believe! let not one people deride <i>another</i> people, who may be better than they, nor let women <i>deride other</i> women, who may be better than they. [49:13] O ye who believe! avoid most of suspicions; for suspicion in some cases is a sin. And spy not, nor back-bite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his brother who is dead? Certainly you would loathe it. And fear Allah, surely, Allah is Oft-Returning <i>with compassion and</i> is Merciful. Footnote: O ye who believe! Avoid <b>too frequent indulgence in suspicion; for some suspicions are certainly sin.</b>
[49:14] O mankind, We have created you from a male and a female; and We have made you into tribes and sub-tribes that you may recognise one another. Footnote: O mankind, We have created you from male and female; and We have made you into <b>clans and tribes</b> that you may recognise one another.

[55:64] Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will you twain deny? — 
[55:65] Dark green with foliage.
[55:66] Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will you twain deny?
[55:67] Therein <i>also</i> will be two springs gushing forth with water.
[55:68] Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will you twain deny?
[55:69] In both of them there will be <i>all kinds of</i> fruit, and dates and pomegranates.
[55:70] Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will you twain deny?
[55:71] Therein will be <i>maidens</i>, good <i>and</i> beautiful — 
[55:72] Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will you twain deny? — 
[55:73] Fair maidens with lovely black eyes, well-guarded in pavilions — 
[55:74] Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will you twain deny? — 
[55:75] Whom neither man nor Jinn will have touched before them — 
[55:76] Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will you twain deny? — 
[55:77] Reclining on green cushions and beautiful carpets.

[56:6] And the mountains will be shattered — a <i>complete</i> shattering.
[56:7] They shall <i>all</i> become like dust particles scattered about,
[56:8] And you shall be <i>divided into</i> three groups:
[56:9] <i>First</i>, those on the right hand — how <i>lucky</i> are those on the right hand! —  Footnote: <b>And the people of the right and what of the people of the right!</b>

[56:16] <i>Seated</i> on couches inwrought <i>with gold and jewels</i>,
[56:17] Reclining thereon facing each other.

[56:19] Carrying goblets and ewers and cups <i>filled</i> out of a flowing spring —

[56:22] And flesh of birds as they may desire.

[56:24] Like pearls, well preserved, Footnote: Like pearls, <b>well concealed <i>and protected.</i></b>

[56:26] They will not hear therein any vain or sinful talk,
[56:27] Except <i>only</i> the word <i>of salutation</i>, ‘Peace, peace.’

[56:39] With those on the right hand: Footnote: <b>For the people of the right.</b>

[56:43] <i>They will be</i> in the midst of scorching winds and scalding water,
[56:44] And under the shadow of black smoke,
[56:45] Neither cool nor of any good.
[56:46] Before this they lived a life of ease and plenty
[56:47] And used to persist in extreme sinfulness.
[56:48] And they were wont to say, ‘What! when we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we indeed be raised again,
[56:49] ‘And our fathers of yore too?’
[56:50] Say, ‘<i>Yes</i>, the earlier ones and the later ones

[56:61] We have ordained death for <i>all of</i> you; and We cannot be prevented
[56:62] From bringing in your place others like you, and <i>from</i> developing you into a form which <i>at present</i> you know not. Footnote: <b>From changing your <i>present</i> forms and raising you into something of which you have no idea.</b>
[56:63] And you have certainly known the first creation. Why, then, do you not reflect?
[56:64] Do you see what you sow?
[56:65] Is it you who grow it or are We the Grower?

[56:67] ‘We are ruined!
[56:68] ‘Nay, we are deprived <i>of everything</i>.’
[56:69] Do you see the water which you drink?
[56:70] Is it you who send it down from the clouds, or are We the Sender?

[56:74] We have made it a reminder and a benefit for the wayfarers.

[56:79] In a well-preserved Book,
